original: spyi dang / bye brag go //
analyzed: spyi dang / bye brag go //
translated: The general and the specific.

original: de la spyi ni 'di na kha cig stong pa nyid kyi rlung chus dkar phyogs kyi me gsod par byed de ;
analyzed: de la spyi ni 'di na kha cig stong pa nyid kyi rlung chus dkar phyogs kyi me gsod par byed de ;
translated: The general is as follows: Here, some people extinguish the fire of the white side with the water of the wind of emptiness.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: mi dge ba bcu spang ba dang / dge ba bcu'i bsgrub pa ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa nyan thos rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu spang ba dang / dge ba bcu'i bsgrub pa ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa nyan thos rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The abandonment of the ten nonvirtues and the practice of the ten virtues are taught for the sake of the śrāvakas who are attached to entities.

original: theg pa chen po zab mo'i don chos thams cad rang bzhin med par shes na ci byas kyang nyes par mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: theg pa chen po zab mo'i don chos thams cad rang bzhin med par shes na ci byas kyang nyes par mi 'gyur te ;
translated: If one knows the meaning of the profound Mahāyāna—that all phenomena are essenceless—no matter what one does, one will not incur faults.

original: rab tu byung ba yang skra bregs pa tsam la zer ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba yang skra bregs pa tsam la zer ba ma yin te /
translated: Ordination is not just called “shaving the head.”

original: sems phyal le ba cig dgos so //
analyzed: sems phyal le ba cig dgos so //
translated: One needs a mind of equanimity.

original: de bas rtogs na srog gcod pa la sogs pa yang sgrib par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bas rtogs na srog gcod pa la sogs pa yang sgrib par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, if one realizes [essencelessness], even killing and so on will not be obscurations.

original: ma rtogs na gnyen po yang sgrib par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma rtogs na gnyen po yang sgrib par 'gyur te /
translated: If one does not realize [essencelessness], even the antidotes will be obscurations.

original: 'phags pa las kyi sgrib pa rnam par dag pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa las kyi sgrib pa rnam par dag pa las /
translated: As it says in the Sūtra of the Purification of Karma:

original: 'dod chags sgrib pa nas shes rab sgrib pa'i bar du gsungs so zhes zer ba de ni bdag nyid mi mthun pa zil gyis ma non par gnyen po slob par byed pas ngan 'gro 'ba' zhig gi las sogs pa la /🔽de'i rjes su slob pa yang mi dge ba sogs 'jug go //
analyzed: 'dod chags sgrib pa nas shes rab sgrib pa'i bar du gsungs so zhes zer ba de ni bdag nyid mi mthun pa zil gyis ma non par gnyen po slob par byed pas ngan 'gro 'ba' zhig gi las sogs pa la / de'i rjes su slob pa yang mi dge ba sogs 'jug go //
translated: The practice of the antidotes without subduing the discordant side of oneself is the accumulation of karma for only a miserable rebirth.

original: de @232a * //🔽skad du / slob dpon klu sgrub kyis /
analyzed: de @232a * // skad du / slob dpon klu sgrub kyis /
translated: The practice of the antidotes after that is the engagement in nonvirtue and so forth.

original: dbu ma'i rtsa ba las /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa ba las /
translated: As it says in the Root of the Middle Way by the master Nagarjuna:

original: stong pa nyid la lta nyes na //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la lta nyes na //
translated: If emptiness is viewed incorrectly,

original: shes rab chung ldan phung 'gyur te //
analyzed: shes rab chung ldan phung 'gyur te //
translated: it will destroy the unwise.🔽Just like incorrectly holding a snake

original: ji ltar sbrul la bzung nyes pa dang // gsang sngags log par bsgrubs pa bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar sbrul la bzung nyes pa dang // gsang sngags log par bsgrubs pa bzhin //
translated: or incorrectly practicing mantra.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / yang rigs pa drug cu pa las /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / yang rigs pa drug cu pa las /
translated: And in the Sixty Reasonings:

original: rnam par dben don mi shes par //
analyzed: rnam par dben don mi shes par //
translated: Without knowing the meaning of emptiness,

original: thos pa tsam la 'jug byed cing //
analyzed: thos pa tsam la 'jug byed cing //
translated: those who engage in mere study

original: gang dag bsod nams mi byed pa //
analyzed: gang dag bsod nams mi byed pa //
translated: and do not create merit

original: skyes bu tha shal de dag brlag / ces gsungs so //
analyzed: skyes bu tha shal de dag brlag / ces gsungs so //
translated: are miserable, inferior people.

original: 'on te nga shes rab che la bsod nams kyang byed pas nyon mongs pa la mi 'dzem zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'on te nga shes rab che la bsod nams kyang byed pas nyon mongs pa la mi 'dzem zhes zer na /
translated: But if you say, “I have great wisdom and I do not avoid the afflictions because I also do the meritorious acts,”

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: that is also not reasonable.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las kyang /
translated: For the noble Sūtra on the Ten Stages says,

original: sa gnyis pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni tshul khrims rnam par dag cing ltung ba phra mo la shes bzhin du gnas pa la bzhag ste /
analyzed: sa gnyis pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni tshul khrims rnam par dag cing ltung ba phra mo la shes bzhin du gnas pa la bzhag ste /
translated: “The bodhisattva who is in the second stage is established in pure morality and in the mindfulness that observes even the smallest downfall.

original: sa la gnas pas bas nga shes rab che zhes bya ba ni ha cang gzu lum ches so //
analyzed: sa la gnas pas bas nga shes rab che zhes bya ba ni ha cang gzu lum ches so //
translated: To say, ‘I have great wisdom because I am on the stage,’ is to be overweening.”

original: de bas na kun rdzob tu gnyen po ma skyes par nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms su bzhag kyang 'phel bar 'gyur na dang du blangs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de bas na kun rdzob tu gnyen po ma skyes par nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms su bzhag kyang 'phel bar 'gyur na dang du blangs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: Therefore, if the afflictions are not avoided, even if you are indifferent to them, they will increase, much less if you embrace them.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa rang dgar spyod pa bslab pa dang bral ba de ni byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung bas ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa rang dgar spyod pa bslab pa dang bral ba de ni byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung bas ma yin te /
translated: So the bodhisattva who has gone forth should not indulge the afflictions at will, should not be without training.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said,

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal rnam par rol pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal rnam par rol pa las /
translated: in the noble Play of Mañjuśrī,

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,🔽“Noble sir, it is like this: for example, a magician or a magician’s apprentice, having conjured up a great army, would frighten himself with it.

original: bu mo rab tu byung ba ni tshul khrims la rag las pa yin te /
analyzed: bu mo rab tu byung ba ni tshul khrims la rag las pa yin te /
translated: Ordination for a daughter depends on morality.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba la ni rab tu byung ba ci yang med do //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba la ni rab tu byung ba ci yang med do // zhes gsungs so //
translated: For one with faulty morality, there is no ordination at all.

original: yang mdo sde de nyid las gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang mdo sde de nyid las gsungs pa /
translated: Again, that very sutra says,

original: gang bdag nyid kyang bslab pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs la /
analyzed: gang bdag nyid kyang bslab pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs la /
translated: “One who, having taken up the training and morality,

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sems can rnams kyang /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sems can rnams kyang /
translated: joins those sentient beings with faulty morality

original: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa dang brtul zhugs la yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa dang brtul zhugs la yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: to the vow and discipline of morality, is a monk bodhisattva.”

original: de bas na stong pa nyid go yang nyon mongs pas pham par byas pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid go yang nyon mongs pas pham par byas pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, one who understands emptiness but is defeated by the afflictions is not a bodhisattva.

original: mdo de nyid las /
analyzed: mdo de nyid las /
translated: That very sutra says,

original: bu mos smras pa /
analyzed: bu mos smras pa /
translated: The daughter said,

original: 'jam dpal 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal 'di lta ste /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na dgra bcom pa de ni dpa' bo zhes mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: dper na dgra bcom pa de ni dpa' bo zhes mi bgyi'o //
translated: For example, one who has attained the state of an arhat is not called a hero.

original: 'jam dpal de bzhin du gang nyon mongs pa rnams @232b kyis bcom pa de yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal de bzhin du gang nyon mongs pa rnams @232b kyis bcom pa de yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bgyi'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, one who is defeated by the afflictions should not be called a bodhisattva.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, likewise, one who is defeated by the afflictions should not be called a bodhisattva.

original: shes rab che zhing stong pa nyid rtogs nas bsgoms pa'i phan yon ni /
analyzed: shes rab che zhing stong pa nyid rtogs nas bsgoms pa'i phan yon ni /
translated: The benefits of cultivating the realization of emptiness through great wisdom

original: zla ba'i sgron ma'i mdo las /
analyzed: zla ba'i sgron ma'i mdo las /
translated: are taught in the Candrapradīpa Sūtra:

original: de ni bde gshegs rnams kyis bslab pa gzhan mi 'dor //
analyzed: de ni bde gshegs rnams kyis bslab pa gzhan mi 'dor //
translated: They do not abandon the other trainings of the sugatas.

original: dpa' bo de ni bud med dbang du gzhar mi 'gro //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dpa' bo de ni bud med dbang du gzhar mi 'gro // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Those heroes never fall under the power of women.🔽And so on.

original: 'phags pa chos kun 'gro ba las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa chos kun 'gro ba las kyang /
translated: The Ārya Sarvadharmapravṛttinirdeśa Sūtra says,

original: dper na mun pa dang lhan cig gnas pa de ni mar me ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na mun pa dang lhan cig gnas pa de ni mar me ma yin no //
translated: “For example, it is not a lamp that dwells together with darkness.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang lhan cig gnas pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab ma lags so //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang lhan cig gnas pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab ma lags so // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Likewise, it is not the wisdom of a bodhisattva that dwells together with the afflictions.”

original: 'phags pa gtsug na rin po che las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa gtsug na rin po che las kyang /
translated: The Ārya Ratnacūḍa Sūtra says,

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor sbyin pa nas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor sbyin pa nas /
translated: “The bodhisattva who practices emptiness should practice generosity.

original: shes rab kyi bar du mi 'bral bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi bar du mi 'bral bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: I will not be separated from wisdom.

original: bslab pa kun las btus pa las kyang //
analyzed: bslab pa kun las btus pa las kyang //
translated: And in the Compendium of Training:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms nas kyang nyon mongs pa'i sgra dang / thabs la mkhas par bya'i /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms nas kyang nyon mongs pa'i sgra dang / thabs la mkhas par bya'i /
translated: Having cultivated the perfection of wisdom, you should be skilled in means,

original: rang gi khyim na dpa' ba bzhin du mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //🔽de bas na byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid shes rab che yang nyon mongs pas pham par byas la dad pa chung bas bslab pa la g-yel zhes smra bar bya ba ni rigs kyi gzhan lam log pa la ga zung cing bstan pa la rma gdod pa ni
analyzed: rang gi khyim na dpa' ba bzhin du mi bya'o zhes gsungs so // de bas na byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid shes rab che yang nyon mongs pas pham par byas la dad pa chung bas bslab pa la g-yel zhes smra bar bya ba ni rigs kyi gzhan lam log pa la ga zung cing bstan pa la rma gdod pa ni
translated: not acting like a hero in your own home.

original: mi rigs so //
analyzed: mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is appropriate to say that a bodhisattva, though great in wisdom, is defeated by the afflictions, and that because of little faith, he is lax in the training. But it is not appropriate to say that he is attached to a false path and wounds the teaching.

original: tshul khrims kho nas chog par 'dzin //
analyzed: tshul khrims kho nas chog par 'dzin //
translated: One is satisfied with morality alone,

original: shes rab kyis ni phyogs gcig rtogs //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni phyogs gcig rtogs //
translated: and understands only one aspect through wisdom.

original: de dag sun dbyung mdor bstan pa //
analyzed: de dag sun dbyung mdor bstan pa //
translated: The refutation of these is presented

original: bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa yin //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa yin //
translated: in the summary verses.

original: de la bye brag la log par rtog pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: de la bye brag la log par rtog pa la gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of misconceptions about the distinctions:

original: lta ba la log par rtog pa dang / bsgom pa la log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba la log par rtog pa dang / bsgom pa la log par rtog pa'o //
translated: 1. Wrong ideas about the view, and 2. Wrong ideas about meditation.

original: de la lta ba la log par rtog pa ni 'di na kha cig bden pa gnyis zhes bya ba dngos po la ma grub ste /
analyzed: de la lta ba la log par rtog pa ni 'di na kha cig bden pa gnyis zhes bya ba dngos po la ma grub ste /
translated: Wrong ideas about the view are as follows: Some say that the two truths are not established in things.

original: 'di ltar gang ma skyes pa de gnyis su med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang ma skyes pa de gnyis su med de /
translated: Thus, what is not produced is not dual.

original: dper na nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like space.

original: bden pa rnam pa gnyis kyang gzod ma nas ma skyes zhing rnam par dag par gnyis su med do zhes zer te /
analyzed: bden pa rnam pa gnyis kyang gzod ma nas ma skyes zhing rnam par dag par gnyis su med do zhes zer te /
translated: The two kinds of truth are originally not produced and are pure, not dual.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: gal te don dam par gnyis med par bsgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub po //
analyzed: gal te don dam par gnyis med par bsgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub po //
translated: If you are proving non-duality ultimately, you are proving what is already established.

original: 'on te spyir bsgrub na ni @233a * //
analyzed: 'on te spyir bsgrub na ni @233a * //
translated: But if you are proving it generally,

original: gtan tshigs su ma grub ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs su ma grub ste /
translated: your reason is not established.

original: mngon sum dang 'gal lo //🔽ma skyes pa la sdug bsngal med pas khyod la mtshon gyis btab na bzod dam /
analyzed: mngon sum dang 'gal lo // ma skyes pa la sdug bsngal med pas khyod la mtshon gyis btab na bzod dam /
translated: It contradicts perception.

original: zhes smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes smra bar bya'o //
translated: Since what is not produced has no suffering, we should say to you, “Can you bear being struck by a sword?”

original: kha cig na re don dam pa'i bden pa med de /
analyzed: kha cig na re don dam pa'i bden pa med de /
translated: Some say that ultimate truth does not exist.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa gcig pu kho na yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa gcig pu kho na yin no zhes zer te /
translated: It is only the conventional truth.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: gal te byis pa ma rig pas ldongs pa'i bsam pa dang sbyar nas smra ba'am /
analyzed: gal te byis pa ma rig pas ldongs pa'i bsam pa dang sbyar nas smra ba'am /
translated: If you speak in accordance with the thoughts of the childish, who are blinded by ignorance,

original: 'on te dngos po'i gnas lugs te /🔽de dang mthun par smra ba'am /🔽mkhas pa'i bsam pas kyang smra /🔽de la phyogs dang po ltar na gnyis ma grub ste /🔽'di ltar don dam pa'i bden pa ni de ston par byed pa'i chos gang zag des ma thos ma bsams ma bsgoms pas /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po'i gnas lugs te / de dang mthun par smra ba'am / mkhas pa'i bsam pas kyang smra / de la phyogs dang po ltar na gnyis ma grub ste / 'di ltar don dam pa'i bden pa ni de ston par byed pa'i chos gang zag des ma thos ma bsams ma bsgoms pas /
translated: then you should say that the ultimate truth is not the ultimate truth,

original: blo la mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: blo la mi 'grub bo //
translated: because it is not established in the minds of those who have not heard, contemplated, or meditated on the teachings that reveal the ultimate truth.

original: de ma grub pas gzugs la sogs pa yang dag pa'o //🔽bden pa'o snyam pas 'ba' zhig skye bas 'di brdzun pa'o zhe 'am /🔽sgrib par byed pa'i phyir kun rdzob ces bya ba 'am /
analyzed: de ma grub pas gzugs la sogs pa yang dag pa'o // bden pa'o snyam pas 'ba' zhig skye bas 'di brdzun pa'o zhe 'am / sgrib par byed pa'i phyir kun rdzob ces bya ba 'am /
translated: Since it is not established, it is impossible to establish that form and so on are real and true.

original: rigs pas gnod pa'i phyir kun rdzob ces bya ba 'grub mi srid do //
analyzed: rigs pas gnod pa'i phyir kun rdzob ces bya ba 'grub mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible to establish that form and so on are false or that they are conventional, because they are said to be conventional either because they are produced by ignorance or because they are obscured by ignorance or because they are contradicted by reasoning.🔽If you say that the ultimate truth is the ultimate truth because it is established in the minds of those who have heard, contemplated, and meditated on the teachings that reveal the ultimate truth,

original: 'on te phyogs phyi ma ltar yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs phyi ma ltar yin no zhe na /
translated: then you should say that form and so on are the ultimate truth, because they are established in the minds of those who have heard, contemplated, and meditated on the teachings that reveal the ultimate truth.

original: de la smras pa /🔽gang zhig gis sgrib par byed pa'am /
analyzed: de la smras pa / gang zhig gis sgrib par byed pa'am /
translated: To this it is replied:

original: gang zhig la sgrib pa yod par de ma shes pa dang / de gzhag pa'am /
analyzed: gang zhig la sgrib pa yod par de ma shes pa dang / de gzhag pa'am /
translated: If one does not know what obscures or what is obscured,

original: rigs pas gnod par ma grub na ni kun rdzob ces ji skad du bya /
analyzed: rigs pas gnod par ma grub na ni kun rdzob ces ji skad du bya /
translated: or if it is not established that it is untenable by reasoning, then how can it be called “concealer”?

original: gal te rigs pas gnod par grub pas 'di kun rdzob kyi bden par grub bo //🔽zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te rigs pas gnod par grub pas 'di kun rdzob kyi bden par grub bo // zhes zer na /
translated: If it is established that it is untenable by reasoning, then it is established as conventional truth.

original: de nyid kyi don dam pa'i bden pa sngar grub pas 'di kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin par shes te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi don dam pa'i bden pa sngar grub pas 'di kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin par shes te /
translated: Thus, it is known to be conventional truth.

original: des ni gnyi ga khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni gnyi ga khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, both are accepted.

original: kha cig na re 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi dgongs pa don dam par ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi dgongs pa don dam par ma grub pa ste /
translated: Some say that the intention of Ārya Nāgārjuna is that it is not established ultimately,

original: ha cang yang ches kun rdzob tu yang ming las don med par bzhed don zhes zer te /
analyzed: ha cang yang ches kun rdzob tu yang ming las don med par bzhed don zhes zer te /
translated: but he asserts that it is not established even conventionally, that the object does not exist apart from the name.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this it is replied:

original: ming la brtsad pa med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ming la brtsad pa med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that there is no dispute about the name.

original: de ni mngon sum dang 'gal te /
analyzed: de ni mngon sum dang 'gal te /
translated: This contradicts direct perception.

original: mo gsham gyi bu 'di na yod do zhes smras nas /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu 'di na yod do zhes smras nas /
translated: If it is said that the son of a barren woman exists here,

original: de la mtshon btab pa dang / khyod la mtshon btab pa gnyis gnod pa med pas 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la mtshon btab pa dang / khyod la mtshon btab pa gnyis gnod pa med pas 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that the one who is struck by the weapon and the one who is not struck by the weapon are similar, since they are both unharmed.

original: slob dpon ni de ltar mi bzhed do //
analyzed: slob dpon ni de ltar mi bzhed do //
translated: The Acarya does not accept this.

original: rigs pa drug cu pa las kyang //
analyzed: rigs pa drug cu pa las kyang //
translated: And in the Yuktisastika it is said:

original: rgyu dang 'bras la @233b mkhas rnams la //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras la @233b mkhas rnams la //
translated: The wise ones in regard to cause and effect

original: nyes pa thams cad 'byung ba'i gnas //
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad 'byung ba'i gnas //
translated: Are the abode of all faults.

original: med pa rnam par bzlog zin gyis //
analyzed: med pa rnam par bzlog zin gyis //
translated: Having already refuted nonexistence,

original: zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: zhes gsungs la /
translated: And in the Vigrahavyavartani it is said:

original: de dgag par bsgrub pa'i kho bo'i nyon mongs pa yang khyod kyis bkag pas khyod kyis grogs byas te btang ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dgag par bsgrub pa'i kho bo'i nyon mongs pa yang khyod kyis bkag pas khyod kyis grogs byas te btang ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: “You have refuted my afflictions which are to be refuted, so you have helped me and I will let you go.”

original: 'phags pa chos kun 'gro ba las kyang /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rtsom pa med kyis /
analyzed: 'phags pa chos kun 'gro ba las kyang / byang chub sems dpa' rtsom pa med kyis /
translated: And in the Aryasarvadharmapravrtti🔽it is said:🔽“The Bodhisattva Asamudācāra said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros rnam par gnod pa la smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros rnam par gnod pa la smras pa /
translated: The Bodhisattva Vikiranagha said:

original: chos thams cad ni ming tsam dang brda tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de yang kun rdzob tu ming gi rnam grangs sam /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ming tsam dang brda tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de yang kun rdzob tu ming gi rnam grangs sam /
translated: ‘All dharmas are mere names, mere signs, and so on’ is also a conventional synonym.

original: yang na gcig gis gcig bshad par gsung gi / don dam par ston pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na gcig gis gcig bshad par gsung gi / don dam par ston pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Or else, they explain one to the other, but not in terms of ultimate reality.

original: kha cig ni bden pa gnyis dngos po ma grub ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni bden pa gnyis dngos po ma grub ste /
translated: Some say that the two realities are not established as things.

original: de yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni rigs pas gnod pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni rigs pas gnod pa yin la /
translated: The conventional reality is undermined by reasoning,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni rigs pas grub pa /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni rigs pas grub pa /
translated: while the ultimate reality is established by reasoning,

original: rtag pa gcig chos thams cad kyi chos nyid du 'dug pa /
analyzed: rtag pa gcig chos thams cad kyi chos nyid du 'dug pa /
translated: permanent, one, the reality of all phenomena,

original: spros pa thams cad las log pa'i ngo bo 'o //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad las log pa'i ngo bo 'o //
translated: and the essence that is the opposite of all conceptual elaborations.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamakavatara:🔽The ultimate is not the sphere of operation of the intellect,🔽For when the intellect engages it, it is no longer the ultimate.

original: bden pa gnyis rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: And in the Madhyamakavatara:🔽The ultimate is not the sphere of operation of the intellect,

original: rigs pa'i rjes 'brang ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: rigs pa'i rjes 'brang ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: For when the intellect engages it, it is no longer the ultimate.🔽And in the Madhyamakavatara:

original: skyob pa rnams kyi chos sku yin //
analyzed: skyob pa rnams kyi chos sku yin //
translated: The ultimate is not the sphere of operation of the intellect,🔽For when the intellect engages it, it is no longer the ultimate.🔽And in the Madhyamakavatara:

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa sa bcu pa las /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa sa bcu pa las /
translated: The ultimate is not the sphere of operation of the intellect,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung //
translated: For when the intellect engages it, it is no longer the ultimate.🔽And in the Madhyamakavatara:🔽The ultimate is not the sphere of operation of the intellect,🔽For when the intellect engages it, it is no longer the ultimate.🔽And in the Madhyamakavatara:🔽The ultimate is not the sphere of operation of the intellect,

original: ma byung yang rung //
analyzed: ma byung yang rung //
translated: For when the intellect engages it, it is no longer the ultimate.🔽And in the Madhyamakavatara:

original: chos kyi dbyings 'di ni gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings 'di ni gnas pa nyid de /
translated: The ultimate is not the sphere of operation of the intellect,🔽For when the intellect engages it, it is no longer the ultimate.🔽And in the Madhyamakavatara:🔽The ultimate is not the sphere of operation of the intellect,

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: For when the intellect engages it, it is no longer the ultimate.

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las /
translated: The noble Cloud of Jewels says,

original: rigs kyi bu gal te don dam pa med du zin na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gal te don dam pa med du zin na /
translated: “Son of noble family, if the ultimate did not exist,

original: tshangs par spyod pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so zer te /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so zer te /
translated: then the pure life would be pointless.”

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this we say:

original: rigs pa'i rjes 'brang ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: rigs pa'i rjes 'brang ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: Because it is the essence that accords with reasoning,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de ni /
translated: and so on.

original: de nyid las ci'i phyir rigs pas gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin snyam pa la ngo bo nyid de nyid rigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid las ci'i phyir rigs pas gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin snyam pa la ngo bo nyid de nyid rigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes gsungs te /
translated: In that very text it says, “Why is it the essence that accords with reasoning? Because that essence itself is endowed with reasoning.”

original: de yang chos thams cad don dam par rigs pas mthong bar 'gal te /
analyzed: de yang chos thams cad don dam par rigs pas mthong bar 'gal te /
translated: It is contradictory for all phenomena to be seen by reasoning in the ultimate.

original: ma mthong ba tsam la brtags na de skad gsungs kyi /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam la brtags na de skad gsungs kyi /
translated: If one analyzes mere nonseeing, that is what is said.

original: de ni rigs pa grub pa don dam par gzhag rgyu med de /🔽de skad du /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa grub pa don dam par gzhag rgyu med de / de skad du /
translated: But that does not mean that the object of reasoned establishment is not posited in the ultimate.

original: 'phags pa bden pa gnyis bstan pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa bden pa gnyis bstan pa las /
translated: As it says in the Teaching of the Two Truths:

original: @234a * // lha'i bu don dam pa'i bden pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul las kyang 'das pa'o //
analyzed: @234a * // lha'i bu don dam pa'i bden pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul las kyang 'das pa'o //
translated: “Divine son, that ultimate truth is beyond the domain of even the wisdom of omniscience.”

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gzhan lta phar zhog des kyang yul du bya ba'i gnas med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan lta phar zhog des kyang yul du bya ba'i gnas med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Not only that, it is also said that there is no basis for taking it as an object.

original: ye nas gnas pa'i rtag ces bya ba yang de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du ma byung tsam na gzugs la sogs pa don dam par yod la /
analyzed: ye nas gnas pa'i rtag ces bya ba yang de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du ma byung tsam na gzugs la sogs pa don dam par yod la /
translated: The statement that the primordial abiding is permanent means that, prior to the appearance of the Tathagata in the world, form and so on exist ultimately.

original: byung bas med pa ni ma yin gyis dngos po 'ga' zhig skyes tsam nas don dam par ma grub pa'i tshul du skye ba na de skad gsungs so //
analyzed: byung bas med pa ni ma yin gyis dngos po 'ga' zhig skyes tsam nas don dam par ma grub pa'i tshul du skye ba na de skad gsungs so //
translated: It is not that they do not exist after his appearance, but that when any entity arises, it arises in such a way that it is ultimately unestablished.

original: de lta bu ma yin na chos nyid ye nas rtag pa de gang gi chos yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu ma yin na chos nyid ye nas rtag pa de gang gi chos yin te /
translated: If it were not so, then whose phenomenon would the primordial permanent reality be?

original: snga na gnas pa dang chos can gsar du byung ba gnyis grub pa dang bde ba gcig tu mi 'dod na /
analyzed: snga na gnas pa dang chos can gsar du byung ba gnyis grub pa dang bde ba gcig tu mi 'dod na /
translated: If one does not accept that the previously existing and the newly arisen phenomenon are established as one,

original: tshangs par spyod pa don med par 'gyur //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa don med par 'gyur //
translated: then the pure life would be meaningless.

original: zhes gsungs pa yang byis pa rnams kyi gang zag gis bdag dang chos kyi bdag yod par brtags nas bden par 'dzin pa la /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yang byis pa rnams kyi gang zag gis bdag dang chos kyi bdag yod par brtags nas bden par 'dzin pa la /
translated: The statement is made in response to the childish who imagine the personal self and the phenomenal self to exist and then grasp them as truly existent.

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag ma grub pa tsam la dgongs nas bdag yod par mi bden te /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag ma grub pa tsam la dgongs nas bdag yod par mi bden te /
translated: The meaning of the statement that the self does not truly exist is that the self of persons and the self of phenomena are not established.

original: rigs pa dang 'gal lo //🔽yod pa bden na byis pa kun gyis mthong bas ma 'khrul ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pas tshangs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs pa dang 'gal lo // yod pa bden na byis pa kun gyis mthong bas ma 'khrul ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pas tshangs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: It is contradictory to reason.

original: da 'bad pa don med do //
analyzed: da 'bad pa don med do //
translated: If existence were true, then because it would be seen by all childish beings without error, then striving for the sake of attaining nirvana would be pointless.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: rigs pa'i yul du grub pa med na don med do zhes gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa'i yul du grub pa med na don med do zhes gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not being said that if it is not established as the domain of reason, then it is pointless.

original: chos can kun gyi chos nyid du 'dug pa zhes bya ba yang chos can gcig spros pa dang bral ba de bzhin du gzhan yang spros pa dang bral bas de skad gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: chos can kun gyi chos nyid du 'dug pa zhes bya ba yang chos can gcig spros pa dang bral ba de bzhin du gzhan yang spros pa dang bral bas de skad gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: The statement “it is the dharmatā of all phenomena” means that just as one phenomenon is free from elaborations, so too are all others free from elaborations.

original: chos can kun la khyab pa cig yod na /
analyzed: chos can kun la khyab pa cig yod na /
translated: If it were something that pervades all phenomena,

original: mu stegs kyis bdag thams cad la khyab par khas len pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: mu stegs kyis bdag thams cad la khyab par khas len pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: it would be similar to the tīrthikas’ assertion that the self pervades everything.🔽As it is said:

original: de la tha dad phyogs dang 'dre bas na //
analyzed: de la tha dad phyogs dang 'dre bas na //
translated: Since it is mixed with the position of difference,

original: khyab rnam gcig pur ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: khyab rnam gcig pur ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could pervasion be a single thing?

original: zhes bya ba sun dbyung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba sun dbyung ngo //
translated: This is the refutation.

original: spros pa thams cad las log pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba yang de nyid spros pa yin no //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad las log pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba yang de nyid spros pa yin no //
translated: The statement “the essence of the reversal of all fabrication” is itself a fabrication.

original: de lta bus brjod na /
analyzed: de lta bus brjod na /
translated: If it were expressed in this way,

original: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas ci'i phyir mi bstan /
analyzed: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas ci'i phyir mi bstan /
translated: why would the noble Vimalakīrti not teach?

original: de bas na don dam par rig pas grub pa'i don dam par gcig yod mi srid do //
analyzed: de bas na don dam par rig pas grub pa'i don dam par gcig yod mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, ultimately, it is impossible for there to be a single thing that is established by a reasoning consciousness.

original: 'o na ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it like?

original: de'i phyir 'di skad du /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: dngos po ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du rtogs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: dngos po ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du rtogs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Bhagavān realized things as they are.

original: @234b 'phags pa yab dang sras mjal ba'i mdo las //
analyzed: @234b 'phags pa yab dang sras mjal ba'i mdo las //
translated: In the noble Meeting of Father and Son Sūtra,

original: de skad du //
analyzed: de skad du //
translated: it says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas kun rdzob bam don dam pa gnyis su thugs su chud de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas kun rdzob bam don dam pa gnyis su thugs su chud de /
translated: The Tathāgata understands two things: the conventional and the ultimate.

original: shes par bya ba yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa 'dir zad do zhes gsungs la //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par lung bstan pa /
analyzed: shes par bya ba yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa 'dir zad do zhes gsungs la // de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par lung bstan pa /
translated: What is to be known is exhausted in these two: the conventional and the ultimate.

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis 'di skad ces /
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis 'di skad ces /
translated: The noble Nāgārjuna, who was prophesied to have understood the intention of the Tathāgata just as it is, said:

original: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i shes rab las //
analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i shes rab las //
translated: In the Wisdom Chapter of the Madhyamaka Root Text, it says:

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos ston pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos ston pa //
translated: The teachings of the buddhas

original: don dam gnyis la yang dag bsten //
analyzed: don dam gnyis la yang dag bsten //
translated: are based on the ultimate and the two truths.

original: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa las //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa las //
translated: The worldly relative truth

original: dam pa'i don gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i don gyi bden pa'o //
translated: and the truth of the ultimate.

original: zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Thus, it is taught.

original: gtan la 'bebs pa'i dus su ni dngos po yang grub la /
analyzed: gtan la 'bebs pa'i dus su ni dngos po yang grub la /
translated: At the time of ascertaining the two truths, things are established.

original: mkhas pas kyang de ltar rtogs pas gnyis su tha snyad 'dogs so //🔽gtan la 'bebs pa'i dus na grub pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: mkhas pas kyang de ltar rtogs pas gnyis su tha snyad 'dogs so // gtan la 'bebs pa'i dus na grub pa yang ma yin /
translated: Since the wise realize it in that way, they designate it as the two truths.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin /
translated: At the time of ascertaining the two truths, things are neither established nor not established.

original: ji ltar yang khas blang du med do //
analyzed: ji ltar yang khas blang du med do //
translated: They are not to be accepted in any way.

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is taught.

original: kha cig na re chos dang chos can bdag nyid gcig pas chos can dbang po'i don mngon sum du mthong ba bzhin du chos nyid kyang mngon sum du mthong ste /🔽de skad du /
analyzed: kha cig na re chos dang chos can bdag nyid gcig pas chos can dbang po'i don mngon sum du mthong ba bzhin du chos nyid kyang mngon sum du mthong ste / de skad du /
translated: Some say that since the phenomenon and the object of the phenomenon are the same, just as the object of the sense organ directly sees the object, the nature of the phenomenon is also directly seen.

original: bar ti ka las /
analyzed: bar ti ka las /
translated: In the Vartika it says:🔽The single nature of the object

original: don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig / bdag nyid mngon sum yin pa la //
analyzed: don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig / bdag nyid mngon sum yin pa la //
translated: is directly perceived.

original: tshad ma rnams kyi brtag bya gang //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams kyi brtag bya gang //
translated: What is to be examined by valid cognition?

original: ma mthong cha gzhan ci zhig yod //
analyzed: ma mthong cha gzhan ci zhig yod //
translated: What other part is there that is not seen?

original: zhes gsungs so //🔽zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this it is replied:

original: 'o na byis pa so so'i skye bo kun gyis kyang bden pa mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //🔽'on te nges pa'i shes pa ma skyes pas ma mthong ba dang 'dra'o //🔽de skad du /
analyzed: 'o na byis pa so so'i skye bo kun gyis kyang bden pa mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro // 'on te nges pa'i shes pa ma skyes pas ma mthong ba dang 'dra'o // de skad du /
translated: Well then, it follows, absurdly, that all ordinary foolish beings would see the truth.🔽If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that they would be aryas.🔽If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that they would be liberated.

original: dbu ma'i rgyan las kyang ;🔽dngos po rnams kyi sgro btags pa'i rnam par dben pa ni stong pa nyid ces bya na /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rgyan las kyang ; dngos po rnams kyi sgro btags pa'i rnam par dben pa ni stong pa nyid ces bya na /
translated: As it says in the Madhyamakalamkara:🔽The emptiness of entities is their lack of the nature that is imputed to them.

original: stong pa nyid ni sgro btags pa'i rnam pas bsgribs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni sgro btags pa'i rnam pas bsgribs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Since emptiness is the nature of the entity that is obscured by the imputations,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin bzung bzhin du yang byis pa rnams kyis nges par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin bzung bzhin du yang byis pa rnams kyis nges par mi 'gyur te /
translated: even though the nature of the entity is apprehended, the childish will not ascertain it.

original: de'i phyir bzung mod kyi tha snyad gdags su rung ba'i phyir ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba nyid pas 'di nyi dmigs pa'i rigs byar gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bzung mod kyi tha snyad gdags su rung ba'i phyir ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba nyid pas 'di nyi dmigs pa'i rigs byar gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, although it is apprehended, it is as if it were not apprehended, for it is suitable to be designated by a term. Thus it is not an object that is to be ascertained.

original: de lta bas na mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pas yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pas yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is contradicted by perception and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ston to //
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: zhes gsungs so zhes zer na /🔽de nyid kyi phyir mig gi rnam shes @235a * //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so zhes zer na / de nyid kyi phyir mig gi rnam shes @235a * //
translated: If you say this,🔽then do not make the conventional designation that the eye consciousness

original: kyis chos nyid mthong zhes tha snyad du ma 'dogs shig / de skad du /
analyzed: kyis chos nyid mthong zhes tha snyad du ma 'dogs shig / de skad du /
translated: sees reality.

original: bden pa gnyis rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: In the Analysis of the Two Realities it says:

original: tha snyad ni nges pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tha snyad ni nges pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because a convention must be preceded by a determination.

original: 'o na slob dpon chos kyi grags pa'i dgongs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na ;
analyzed: 'o na slob dpon chos kyi grags pa'i dgongs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na ;
translated: If you say that this contradicts the thought of the master Dharmakīrti,

original: de ni mi 'gal te /
analyzed: de ni mi 'gal te /
translated: it does not.

original: slob dpon gyi ni mi rtag pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi ni mi rtag pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The master Dharmakīrti taught this with impermanence in mind.

original: de ni dngos po yin pas 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: de ni dngos po yin pas 'gal ba med de /
translated: Since that is a thing, there is no contradiction.

original: stong pa nyid ni dngos po ma yin pas dbang po'i mngon sum du mthong mi srid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni dngos po ma yin pas dbang po'i mngon sum du mthong mi srid do //
translated: Since emptiness is not a thing, it is impossible for it to be seen by the sense consciousnesses.

original: bden pa gnyis rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: In the Analysis of the Two Realities it says:

original: ji ltar snang ba 'di kho na //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba 'di kho na //
translated: This very appearance

original: kun rdzob gzhan ni cig shos yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob gzhan ni cig shos yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The other is the conventional.

original: yang na tha mi dad pa la dgongs pa yin pas de ni 'dir yang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: yang na tha mi dad pa la dgongs pa yin pas de ni 'dir yang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Or else, since the non-difference is intended, there is no contradiction here.

original: de la kha cig tha mi dad ces bya ba dang / gcig ces bya ba ni don gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: de la kha cig tha mi dad ces bya ba dang / gcig ces bya ba ni don gzhan ma yin te /
translated: In this regard, some say: “Non-difference and identity do not have different meanings.

original: de ltar chos nyid mngon sum du mthong bas thams cad kyi de kho na mngon sum du mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / chos kyi dbyings bzhin du chos can yang bden par 'gyur ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de ltar chos nyid mngon sum du mthong bas thams cad kyi de kho na mngon sum du mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / chos kyi dbyings bzhin du chos can yang bden par 'gyur ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Thus, since the reality of all is seen by directly seeing reality, the reality of all is directly seen; and like the ultimate realm, the subject would also be real; and it would not be defiled.

original: chos can bzhin du chos kyi dbyings de yang 'dus byas dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos can bzhin du chos kyi dbyings de yang 'dus byas dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: And like the subject, the ultimate realm would also be compounded and defiled.

original: de thams cad du gcig khas ma blangs pas nyes pa med do zhes smras nas //
analyzed: de thams cad du gcig khas ma blangs pas nyes pa med do zhes smras nas //
translated: Since we do not accept that it is the same in all cases, there is no fault.

original: 'o na ni 'du byed gyi bdag med pa tsam nyid don dam pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'du byed gyi bdag med pa tsam nyid don dam pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur la /
translated: Well then, the mere selflessness of compounded things would not be the characteristic of the ultimate.

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan mas bcing pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan mas bcing pa rnams kyang /
translated: Those who are bound by the characteristics of compositional activity

original: rnal 'byor pas zil gyis non par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas zil gyis non par mi 'gyur te /
translated: are not overcome by the yogi,

original: de tha dad cing chos kyi dbyings gzhan du rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tha dad cing chos kyi dbyings gzhan du rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are different and because the dharmadhātu is conceived of as something else.

original: de lta bas na dung dang dkar po bzhin du gcig dang tha dad par brjod du med pas de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa'i 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dung dang dkar po bzhin du gcig dang tha dad par brjod du med pas de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa'i 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, like a conch and its whiteness, they are inexpressible as either the same or different. Thus, they are related in the sense of being inexpressible as either the same or different.

original: zhes zer na /🔽de la smras pa /
analyzed: zhes zer na / de la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: de nyid dang gzhan du brjod pa ni skyon 'ong la /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan du brjod pa ni skyon 'ong la /
translated: The claim that they are the same or different is flawed.

original: de gnyis su ma brjod pas grub pa gcig la 'brel pa ni skyon med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis su ma brjod pas grub pa gcig la 'brel pa ni skyon med pa ma yin te /
translated: The claim that they are related in the sense of being inexpressible as either of those two is also flawed.

original: gcig dang tha dad pa'i skyon de ni chos dngos por 'gyur ba la 'thad do //
analyzed: gcig dang tha dad pa'i skyon de ni chos dngos por 'gyur ba la 'thad do //
translated: The flaws of being the same or different are tenable only if phenomena are real things.

original: chos nyid spros pa dang bral ba chos can dang gcig par skyon yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: chos nyid spros pa dang bral ba chos can dang gcig par skyon yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not flawed to say that the freedom from elaborations, the dharmatā, is the same as the phenomena that possess it.

original: med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not nonexistent.🔽It is not flawed to say that they are different.

original: tha dad par skyon yod pa yang ma @235b yin med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: tha dad par skyon yod pa yang ma @235b yin med pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not nonexistent.

original: brjod du med pa bya ba chos can dang 'brel par gzhag rgyu cig kyang yang dag par grub nas 'brel pa gsum par khas blang rgyu yang med de 'brel pa ni de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba'i 'brel pa las gzhan med par /
analyzed: brjod du med pa bya ba chos can dang 'brel par gzhag rgyu cig kyang yang dag par grub nas 'brel pa gsum par khas blang rgyu yang med de 'brel pa ni de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba'i 'brel pa las gzhan med par /
translated: There is no third type of relation that is to be accepted, for relation is either the identity of that or the relation of origination from that.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon chos kyi grags pa la sogs pa rnams kyis bstan to //🔽'o na slob dpon ka ma la sh'i las /
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon chos kyi grags pa la sogs pa rnams kyis bstan to // 'o na slob dpon ka ma la sh'i las /
translated: This has been taught by the former masters such as Dharmakirti.

original: dbu ma snang ba las //
analyzed: dbu ma snang ba las //
translated: Well, then, what about the statement in the master Kamalasila's Aloka?🔽The Aloka says, The selflessness of phenomena is taught to be inexpressible as either the same as or different from the aggregates.

original: de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med par bstan to snyam pa la bden mod kyi de ni gang zag dang chos de nyid yang dag pa'i shes pas gang zag dang chos su ma grub pa tsam la gang zag dang chos de nyid chos nyid du gdags pas
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med par bstan to snyam pa la bden mod kyi de ni gang zag dang chos de nyid yang dag pa'i shes pas gang zag dang chos su ma grub pa tsam la gang zag dang chos de nyid chos nyid du gdags pas
translated: It is true that this is what he thinks, but he is referring to the mere non establishment of the person and phenomena by a person and phenomena that are real in themselves by a correct consciousness. He is referring to the fact that the person and phenomena themselves are designated as the reality of the person and phenomena.

original: de tsam ma la bdag nyid gcig pa'i 'brel pa zhes btags pa yin la /
analyzed: de tsam ma la bdag nyid gcig pa'i 'brel pa zhes btags pa yin la /
translated: He is saying that this is a relation of identity.

original: de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pas cir yang ma grub par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pas cir yang ma grub par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since it is inexpressible as either identical with or different from that, it is shown to be not established as anything at all.

original: de lta bas na chos can de nyid spros pa dang bral ba tsam chos nyid yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na chos can de nyid spros pa dang bral ba tsam chos nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, that very possessor of attributes, which is merely free from elaborations, is reality.

original: de yang sgro btags pas bkag ste /
analyzed: de yang sgro btags pas bkag ste /
translated: And that is refuted by superimposition.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis mngon sum du mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis mngon sum du mi mthong ngo //
translated: Naive, ordinary beings do not see it directly.

original: de skad du //
analyzed: de skad du //
translated: As is said:

original: dbu ma'i rgyan las //
analyzed: dbu ma'i rgyan las //
translated: In the Ornament of the Middle Way:

original: ma yin thog med rgyud lci bar //
analyzed: ma yin thog med rgyud lci bar //
translated: Not so. Due to the power of the imprints of beginningless continuum,

original: dngos por sgro btags dbang byas pas /🔽de phyir srog chags thams cad kyi //
analyzed: dngos por sgro btags dbang byas pas / de phyir srog chags thams cad kyi //
translated: one is dominated by the superimposition of entities.🔽Therefore, it is not realized

original: mngon sum rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon sum rtogs par mi 'gyur ro // zhes gsungs so //
translated: directly by any living being.

original: rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen pos sa dang po thob yan chad nas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen pos sa dang po thob yan chad nas /
translated: The great lord of yogis, having attained the first bhumi and above,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ni gsal bar rtogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ni gsal bar rtogs so //
translated: directly realizes it.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi gtan tshigs kyi sgo nas sgro btags pa gcod pa tsam du bas kyi mngon sum du byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi gtan tshigs kyi sgo nas sgro btags pa gcod pa tsam du bas kyi mngon sum du byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For naive, ordinary beings, it is merely cut through by means of reasoning; it is not directly realized.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As is said:

original: de nyid las /
analyzed: de nyid las /
translated: The same text says:

original: de la sgro btags gcod byed pa //
analyzed: de la sgro btags gcod byed pa //
translated: The yogins and yoginīs who cut through exaggeration

original: shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyis //
analyzed: shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyis //
translated: with the reasoning that brings understanding

original: rjes su dpag rnams dpog par byed //
analyzed: rjes su dpag rnams dpog par byed //
translated: infer the nonexistence of entities.

original: rnal 'byor dbang rnams mngon sum gsal //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dbang rnams mngon sum gsal //
translated: The masters of yoga directly perceive it.

original: zhes gsungs so //🔽bden pa gnyis la log par rtog / chos nyid mthong la log rtog dang // chos dang chos can 'brel pa la //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // bden pa gnyis la log par rtog / chos nyid mthong la log rtog dang // chos dang chos can 'brel pa la //
translated: The summary verse says:

original: log par rtog pa sun dbyung ba //
analyzed: log par rtog pa sun dbyung ba //
translated: Misconceptions about the two truths, seeing reality, and misconceptions about the relationship between phenomena and their true nature🔽are refuted.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //🔽kha cig na re so so'i skye bos sgro btags pas gcod pa na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o // kha cig na re so so'i skye bos sgro btags pas gcod pa na /
translated: This is the summary verse.

original: gtan tshigs kyi sgo nas shes te 'di @236a * //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi sgo nas shes te 'di @236a * //
translated: Some say that when ordinary beings cut through exaggeration, they do so through understanding the reasoning that goes like this:

original: skad du / gang gcig dang du ma dang bral ba de ni don dam par rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: skad du / gang gcig dang du ma dang bral ba de ni don dam par rang bzhin med de /
translated: “Whatever is free from being one or many is ultimately essenceless.🔽The things that are said by ourselves and others are free from being one or many.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyis smras pa 'di dag kyang gcig dang du ma dang bral ba smras pa tsam gyis 'grub bya rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyis smras pa 'di dag kyang gcig dang du ma dang bral ba smras pa tsam gyis 'grub bya rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
translated: By merely saying this, the object to be established is understood.”

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: dbang po rnon po sbyor ba la goms pa rnams kyis rtogs pa ni rigs na chos mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la sogs pa bya dgos pa'i rigs cig yin na ni /
analyzed: dbang po rnon po sbyor ba la goms pa rnams kyis rtogs pa ni rigs na chos mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la sogs pa bya dgos pa'i rigs cig yin na ni /
translated: If it is reasonable that those of sharp faculty who are habituated to practice realize it, then it is reasonable that one must engage in practice that has the same properties.

original: sbyor ba de kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin nam gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin gang grub ma nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyor ba de kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin nam gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin gang grub ma nges pa'i phyir /
translated: But since it is not ascertained whether that practice is of the nature of the imputed or the dependent nature,

original: thun mong gi ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs lta bur snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thun mong gi ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs lta bur snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it would seem to be a common inconclusive reason.

original: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba spyir btang nas dper na gzugs brnyan lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba spyir btang nas dper na gzugs brnyan lta bu'o //
translated: But if you say that it is a general entailment and give the example of a reflection,

original: zhes smras pas skyon med do zhes zer na /
analyzed: zhes smras pas skyon med do zhes zer na /
translated: then there is no fault.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that we say:

original: mthun pa'i dpe de la 'brel ba gtan la phab bam ma phab /
analyzed: mthun pa'i dpe de la 'brel ba gtan la phab bam ma phab /
translated: Is the connection in that concordant example established or not?

original: ma phab na ni dpe smros pa la don med do //
analyzed: ma phab na ni dpe smros pa la don med do //
translated: If it is not established, then there is no point in giving an example.

original: 'on te phab po zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'on te phab po zhes zer na /
translated: But if you say that it is established,

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: then we say this:

original: dgag pa'i sgrar sbyar nas gtan tshigs don dam dang / bsgrub bya don dam par rang bzhin med pa gnyis 'brel par gtan la phab bam /
analyzed: dgag pa'i sgrar sbyar nas gtan tshigs don dam dang / bsgrub bya don dam par rang bzhin med pa gnyis 'brel par gtan la phab bam /
translated: If you apply the term negation to the reason and the ultimate to the predicate, then the reason and the predicate are established in relation to each other.

original: 'on te ma yin par dgag pa'i sgra sbyar nas /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin par dgag pa'i sgra sbyar nas /
translated: Or, if you apply the term negation to the predicate,

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa cig la 'brel pa gtan la phab /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa cig la 'brel pa gtan la phab /
translated: then the reason and the predicate are established in relation to each other in terms of conventional truth.

original: de phyogs dang po ltar na /🔽smras pa / 'brel pa de mngon sum gyis grub pa'am /
analyzed: de phyogs dang po ltar na / smras pa / 'brel pa de mngon sum gyis grub pa'am /
translated: In the first case,🔽you might say that the relation is established by perception.

original: rjes su dpag pas grub /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas grub /
translated: Or is it established by inference?

original: de la mngon sum gyis grub bo zhes zer na /🔽'on te chos nyid mngon sum du mthong bas /
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyis grub bo zhes zer na / 'on te chos nyid mngon sum du mthong bas /
translated: If you say that it is established by perception,

original: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyis ka 'phags pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyis ka 'phags pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ro /
translated: then it follows that both the proponent and the opponent are āryas because they see reality directly.

original: des na grub par bya ba'i chos kyi rtags kyi rjes su 'brang ba don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na grub par bya ba'i chos kyi rtags kyi rjes su 'brang ba don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would be pointless for the proponent to follow the reason in order to establish the predicate.

original: de bas na so so'i skye bos chos nyid mngon sum du mthong mi srid pas /
analyzed: de bas na so so'i skye bos chos nyid mngon sum du mthong mi srid pas /
translated: Therefore, it is impossible for ordinary beings to see reality directly.

original: mi srid pa'i don smras na bdag nyid nyams par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi srid pa'i don smras na bdag nyid nyams par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that it is impossible, then you undermine your own position.

original: de'i phyir dpe de ni ma grub pa'i dpe ltar snang ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dpe de ni ma grub pa'i dpe ltar snang ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, that example is like an unestablished example.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la yod par khas blangs pas de ni gtan tshigs kyi rang gi ngo bo ma grub pas ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la yod par khas blangs pas de ni gtan tshigs kyi rang gi ngo bo ma grub pas ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is accepted that it exists in the subject of the proposition, it is a nonestablished reason, like an unestablished reason.

original: 'brel pa de la ni mngon sum gyis gnod de /
analyzed: 'brel pa de la ni mngon sum gyis gnod de /
translated: That relation is contradicted by perception,

original: rtag tu gzugs brnyan du snang ba las gzugs brnyan du yang mi mthong mi @236b srid do //
analyzed: rtag tu gzugs brnyan du snang ba las gzugs brnyan du yang mi mthong mi @236b srid do //
translated: because it is impossible that a reflection never appears when a reflection appears.

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang bsal te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang bsal te /
translated: It is also refuted by inference,

original: gang khas blangs kyang ma mthong ba de ni tha snyad gdags su mi rung ste /
analyzed: gang khas blangs kyang ma mthong ba de ni tha snyad gdags su mi rung ste /
translated: because that which is not seen, even though accepted, is not suitable to be designated.

original: dper na / bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na / bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a place that is empty of pots.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa 'di yang mngon sum du ma mthong bas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa 'di yang mngon sum du ma mthong bas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This ultimate truth that is the basis of the dispute is also pervaded by not being seen by direct perception, and that is the nonobservation of a pervader.

original: gzugs brnyan snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yang 'gal bas khyab pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yang 'gal bas khyab pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
translated: “Because of the appearance of a reflection” is also the observation of a pervasion by contradiction.

original: grags pas kyang gsal te /🔽brda shes pa grub pa'i mthas blo ma bsgyur ba cig la /
analyzed: grags pas kyang gsal te / brda shes pa grub pa'i mthas blo ma bsgyur ba cig la /
translated: It is also clear through renown.

original: me long gi nang la ci 'dug ces dris na /
analyzed: me long gi nang la ci 'dug ces dris na /
translated: If one asks someone who knows sign-gestures but whose mind is not affected by tenets, “What is inside the mirror?”

original: bzhin kho na 'dra ba cig 'dug ces zer ba las /
analyzed: bzhin kho na 'dra ba cig 'dug ces zer ba las /
translated: They will say, “A reflection of a face is there.”

original: ci yang ma mthong zhes zer mi srid do //
analyzed: ci yang ma mthong zhes zer mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible for them to say, “I do not see anything at all.”

original: rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yang yin te /
analyzed: rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yang yin te /
translated: It also contradicts your own words.

original: don dam pa mthong zhes bya ba gzugs brnyan la zer ram /
analyzed: don dam pa mthong zhes bya ba gzugs brnyan la zer ram /
translated: When you say, “The ultimate is seen,” are you referring to a reflection?

original: lung gis gsal ba yang yin te /
analyzed: lung gis gsal ba yang yin te /
translated: It is also clear through scripture.

original: 'phags pa mi'am ci'i rgyal po ljon pas zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa mi'am ci'i rgyal po ljon pas zhus pa las /
translated: In the Questions of the Divine King of the Kinnaras,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Bhagavat said:

original: dper na rang bzhin stong pa yi //
analyzed: dper na rang bzhin stong pa yi //
translated: For example, in a completely pure

original: me long dkyil 'khor yongs dag la //
analyzed: me long dkyil 'khor yongs dag la //
translated: round mirror,

original: gzugs brnyan snang ba de bzhin du //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan snang ba de bzhin du //
translated: the appearance of a reflection is seen.

original: ljon pa chos rnams shes par gyis //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ljon pa chos rnams shes par gyis // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Jñānaka, know phenomena in that way.

original: gzugs brnyan mi snang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan mi snang zhes gsungs so //
translated: He said that a reflection does not appear.

original: de bas na mngon sum gyis grub mi srid do //
analyzed: de bas na mngon sum gyis grub mi srid do //
translated: Therefore it is impossible to establish it through direct perception.

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pa grub po zer na /
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pa grub po zer na /
translated: Well then, you may say, “It is established through inference.”

original: de yang mi rigs te de lta bu'i dpe mi srid do //
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te de lta bu'i dpe mi srid do //
translated: This is also illogical, because such an example is impossible.

original: gal te srid na rtags mngon sum gyis ma grub pas 'brel pa mngon sum du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gal te srid na rtags mngon sum gyis ma grub pas 'brel pa mngon sum du mi 'grub ste /
translated: If it were possible, then since the evidence would not be established by direct perception, the relation would not be established by direct perception.

original: des na de yang rjes su dpag pa cig gis grub dgos pas dpe thug pa med pa dang / rtags thug pa med pa'i skyon 'ong ngo //
analyzed: des na de yang rjes su dpag pa cig gis grub dgos pas dpe thug pa med pa dang / rtags thug pa med pa'i skyon 'ong ngo //
translated: Therefore, since that also must be established by inference, the fault of an infinite regress of examples and an infinite regress of evidence would ensue.

original: 'on te de'i skyon mi 'ong ste /🔽dbu ma'i rgyan las /
analyzed: 'on te de'i skyon mi 'ong ste / dbu ma'i rgyan las /
translated: However, if one says that those faults do not occur,🔽then the Ornament of the Middle Way says:

original: mu stegs rgyal dpog pa na re /🔽gdong nyid der dmigs pa las /🔽gzugs brnyan zhes tha snyad 'dogs zer ba dang / bye brag tu smra ba na re /
analyzed: mu stegs rgyal dpog pa na re / gdong nyid der dmigs pa las / gzugs brnyan zhes tha snyad 'dogs zer ba dang / bye brag tu smra ba na re /
translated: The tīrthika Jaimini says,🔽“The reflection is designated as such because the face itself is observed there.”🔽The Vaibhāṣika says, “Another form arises there.” The Sautrāntika says, “Consciousness appears in that way.”

original: gzugs gzhan zhig der byung ngo zhes zer ba dang / mdo sde pa na re shes pa kho na de ltar snang zhes zer ba dang / rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas dpe rang bzhin med par bsgrubs pas de bas na dpe thug pa med par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzugs gzhan zhig der byung ngo zhes zer ba dang / mdo sde pa na re shes pa kho na de ltar snang zhes zer ba dang / rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas dpe rang bzhin med par bsgrubs pas de bas na dpe thug pa med par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Since the example is established as lacking intrinsic existence by way of inference, therefore there is no infinite regress of examples.

original: thams cad du mthun pa'i dpe la don dam pa gtan la 'bebs @237a * //🔽so zhes zer na /
analyzed: thams cad du mthun pa'i dpe la don dam pa gtan la 'bebs @237a * // so zhes zer na /
translated: In all cases, the ultimate is determined by means of an example that is concordant with it.

original: de la smras pa /🔽der yang gang dag sngar sgrub pa'i mthas blo ma 'gyur tsam na /
analyzed: de la smras pa / der yang gang dag sngar sgrub pa'i mthas blo ma 'gyur tsam na /
translated: To this we reply:🔽Even in that case, when one’s mind has not yet been transformed by the study of tenets, one does not apprehend the reflection as being the face.

original: de ltar mi 'dzin yang phyis grub pa'i mthas blo bslad nas don med pa'i bzhin cig yin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'dzin yang phyis grub pa'i mthas blo bslad nas don med pa'i bzhin cig yin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: Later, however, when one’s mind has been corrupted by the study of tenets, one comes to say that the reflection is not the face.

original: don byed nus pa'i bzhin ma yin no zhes dgag pa tsam byed kyi gzugs brnyan de don dam par rang bzhin med par sgrub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don byed nus pa'i bzhin ma yin no zhes dgag pa tsam byed kyi gzugs brnyan de don dam par rang bzhin med par sgrub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: One is simply refuting the claim that the reflection is the face, which is capable of functional performance. One is not proving that the reflection is ultimately devoid of intrinsic existence.

original: des na rtags dang dpe thug pa med pa'i skyon med pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rtags dang dpe thug pa med pa'i skyon med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault of infinite regress in terms of the reason and the example.

original: 'di ltar dang po de don byed nus pa'i rang bzhin ma yin par dgag par dgongs nas 'di skad gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dang po de don byed nus pa'i rang bzhin ma yin par dgag par dgongs nas 'di skad gsungs te /
translated: The first statement was made with the intention of refuting the claim that the reflection is not the nature that is capable of functional performance.

original: sbyor ba ni rnam par shes pa gang zhig gang dang / mtshan nyid mi mthun par snang ba de ni de'i dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rnam par shes pa gang zhig gang dang / mtshan nyid mi mthun par snang ba de ni de'i dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: “The object of consciousness is not the face because it appears to be different in kind from the face.”

original: dper na sgra shes pa gzugs dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgra shes pa gzugs dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par snang ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the consciousness of sound appears as having a nature incompatible with form.🔽Also, the consciousness of a reflection appears as having a nature incompatible with the object, such as a face, that is situated in a certain place.

original: gzugs brnyan gyis shes pa yang gdong la sogs pa yul ji lta ba bzhin gnas pa dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par snang ba yin pas khyab pa byed pas 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyis shes pa yang gdong la sogs pa yul ji lta ba bzhin gnas pa dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par snang ba yin pas khyab pa byed pas 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, the reason is contradictory because it proves the opposite of the probandum.

original: de ni don byed pa'i gzugs ma yin zhes bkag la /
analyzed: de ni don byed pa'i gzugs ma yin zhes bkag la /
translated: This is a refutation of the claim that the reflection is a form that performs a function.

original: der gzugs brnyan don dam par med par ma gsungs so //
analyzed: der gzugs brnyan don dam par med par ma gsungs so //
translated: But it does not say that the reflection is ultimately nonexistent.

original: gnyis pa las gzugs can don byed nus pa lhan cig gnas pa dgag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa /🔽'di skad du sbyor ba ni dngos po lus can gang dag yin pa de dag ni yul phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i rang bzhin dag yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa las gzugs can don byed nus pa lhan cig gnas pa dgag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa / 'di skad du sbyor ba ni dngos po lus can gang dag yin pa de dag ni yul phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i rang bzhin dag yin te /
translated: The second is stated from the perspective of refuting the possibility of a simultaneous form that is able to perform a function.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: The syllogism is stated as follows: “Those things that have physical form are of a nature that mutually excludes the existence of two in one place, like a pot, and so on.”

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i dngos po 'di dag kyang lus can yin pas /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i dngos po 'di dag kyang lus can yin pas /
translated: These things that are the basis of dispute have bodies.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, they are natural reasons.

original: der yang don byed pa'i gzugs lhan cig gnas pa bkag pa las gzugs brnyan don dam pa'i rang bzhin med par ni ma bsgrubs so //
analyzed: der yang don byed pa'i gzugs lhan cig gnas pa bkag pa las gzugs brnyan don dam pa'i rang bzhin med par ni ma bsgrubs so //
translated: Moreover, in that passage, the form that performs a function is refuted as coexistent. It does not establish that the reflection lacks ultimate intrinsic nature.🔽The third position is stated in order to clarify this.

original: phyogs gsum pa gsal ba'i phyir gsungs pa 'di skad du /
analyzed: phyogs gsum pa gsal ba'i phyir gsungs pa 'di skad du /
translated: It says:

original: pha rol po'i gzugs brnyan la sogs pa 'di dag rnam par shes pa'i ngo bor rdzas su yod par khas blangs mod kyi /
analyzed: pha rol po'i gzugs brnyan la sogs pa 'di dag rnam par shes pa'i ngo bor rdzas su yod par khas blangs mod kyi /
translated: “Although you accept that these reflections and so forth are substantially existent in the nature of consciousness,

original: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa de dag ni dpe nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa de dag ni dpe nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: you do not assert that these reflections and so forth are the very example.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /🔽gzugs brnyan la sogs par shes @237b pa la ;
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / gzugs brnyan la sogs par shes @237b pa la ;
translated: What is it then?

original: snang ba can gyi ngo bo gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba can gyi ngo bo gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the nature that appears to the consciousness that perceives a reflection and so forth.

original: de yang brdzun pa'i phyir dpe grub pa kho na yin no //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang brdzun pa'i phyir dpe grub pa kho na yin no //🔽zhes gsungs te /
translated: Since that is false, the example is established.”

original: der yang phyi rol du kun brtags pa'i don byed nus pa'i gzugs bkag pa las /
analyzed: der yang phyi rol du kun brtags pa'i don byed nus pa'i gzugs bkag pa las /
translated: Moreover, in that case, the external object, which is the imagined object that is able to perform a function, is refuted.

original: gzugs brnyan nyid kyang rang bzhin med par ni ma bsgrubs te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan nyid kyang rang bzhin med par ni ma bsgrubs te /
translated: However, the reflection itself is not established as lacking intrinsic nature.

original: mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it contradicts direct perception.

original: gal te zlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma gcig gis don dam par rang bzhin med par grub bo zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te zlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma gcig gis don dam par rang bzhin med par grub bo zhes zer na /
translated: If you refute that, then you are saying that a single valid cognition that contradicts it establishes that ultimately there is no intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar na brda shes pa'i gang zag tshad ma'i bstan bcos la thos pa kun gyis gzugs brnyan la bzhin yang dag par 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na brda shes pa'i gang zag tshad ma'i bstan bcos la thos pa kun gyis gzugs brnyan la bzhin yang dag par 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it follows that all persons who understand signs and have studied the treatises on valid cognition would apprehend a reflection as a face.

original: de lta bas na mthun pa'i dpe la gtan tshigs don dam pa dang / bsgrubs pa don dam pa 'brel par mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas ma grub ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na mthun pa'i dpe la gtan tshigs don dam pa dang / bsgrubs pa don dam pa 'brel par mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas ma grub ste /
translated: Therefore, in a concordant example, the reason and the probandum are not established by direct perception or inference in the ultimate,

original: gang du smos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang du smos pa bzhin no //
translated: just as it is stated.

original: gal te ma yin par dgag pa'i skra sbyar bar byas nas kun rdzob kyi bden pa gzugs brnyan de nyid la 'brel pa mngon sum du grub pas de dper byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma yin par dgag pa'i skra sbyar bar byas nas kun rdzob kyi bden pa gzugs brnyan de nyid la 'brel pa mngon sum du grub pas de dper byed do zhe na /
