translated: If you say that you take the negation as a qualification and that you use the example of a reflection because the relationship between the object and the reflection is established by direct perception,

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: then we reply as follows.

original: 'o na ni 'brel pa grub pa la don med de /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'brel pa grub pa la don med de /
translated: If that were the case, then it would be pointless to establish the relationship,

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la ni gtan tshigs don dam par gcig dang du ma dang bral ba dang / bsgrub bya don dam par rang bzhin med par gnyis 'brel par go dgos la /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la ni gtan tshigs don dam par gcig dang du ma dang bral ba dang / bsgrub bya don dam par rang bzhin med par gnyis 'brel par go dgos la /
translated: because in the case of the subject that is to be proven, the reason must be understood to be related to the probandum in the ultimate, in that it is free from being one or many, and the probandum must be understood to be related to the probandum in the ultimate, in that it is free from being ultimately existent.

original: de dang mi mthun pa kun rdzob kyi snang ba gcig la 'brel par grub pas don dam pa'i 'brel pa ni sngar gtan la ma phab la kun rdzob ni snga nas grub pas grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa kun rdzob kyi snang ba gcig la 'brel par grub pas don dam pa'i 'brel pa ni sngar gtan la ma phab la kun rdzob ni snga nas grub pas grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: But since the relationship is established in the case of a single appearance of the relative, which is incompatible with that, the relationship in the ultimate is not established earlier, and the relative is already established, so it would be the establishment of what is already established.

original: yang don dam pa rang bzhin med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun rdzob kyi bden pa la gtan tshigs zhugs pas 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang don dam pa rang bzhin med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun rdzob kyi bden pa la gtan tshigs zhugs pas 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since the ultimate, which is the absence of intrinsic existence, is the logical reason that engages the relative, which is its contradictory counterpart, it would be a fallacious reason that is contradictory.

original: gal te kun rdzob kyi bden pa gcig la 'brel pa sgrub bo zhes brgya la zer na /🔽de lta na yang 'brel pa grub pa don med pa'i nyes pa dang / gtan tshigs dang thun mong ma yin pa'i nges pa'am /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob kyi bden pa gcig la 'brel pa sgrub bo zhes brgya la zer na / de lta na yang 'brel pa grub pa don med pa'i nyes pa dang / gtan tshigs dang thun mong ma yin pa'i nges pa'am /
translated: If you say that the relative truth is the related object to be established,

original: 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'i nyes pa yod de /🔽bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la ni gtan tshigs don dam par gcig dang du ma dang bral ba zhugs nas 'dug la mthun pa'i dpe la ni kun rdzob kyi /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'i nyes pa yod de / bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la ni gtan tshigs don dam par gcig dang du ma dang bral ba zhugs nas 'dug la mthun pa'i dpe la ni kun rdzob kyi /
translated: then you would have the fallacy that the establishment of the relationship is pointless, and the fallacy that the reason is not ascertained as being the property of the subject or that it is a fallacious reason that is contradictory.🔽For the predicate of the probandum is the ultimate, which is free from being a unity or plurality, and the reason is engaged in that.

original: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba zhugs pa'i phyir @238a * //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba zhugs pa'i phyir @238a * //
translated: The concordant example is the relative, which is free from being a unity or plurality.

original: ro ; / gal te ji ltar gyur kyang rung ste /
analyzed: ro ; / gal te ji ltar gyur kyang rung ste /
translated: If you say that it does not matter how it is,

original: dbu ma'i rgyan las /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rgyan las /
translated: then the Ornament of the Middle Way says:

original: bdag dang gzhan smras dngos 'di dag / yang dag tu na gcig pa dang // du ma'i rang bzhin bral ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan smras dngos 'di dag / yang dag tu na gcig pa dang // du ma'i rang bzhin bral ba'i phyir //
translated: are, in reality, devoid of a nature of oneness and plurality.

original: rang bzhin med de gzugs brnyan bzhin //🔽zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: rang bzhin med de gzugs brnyan bzhin // zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Therefore, they are essenceless, like a reflection.

original: yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa la dgos pa yin te /🔽de bas na med pa dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa la dgos pa yin te / de bas na med pa dgag pa yin no //
translated: Here, “reality” refers to the ultimate.

original: zhes zer na /
analyzed: zhes zer na /
translated: Therefore, this is a nonimplicative negation.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: gtan tshigs la don dam pa'i sgra ma zhugs pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gtan tshigs la don dam pa'i sgra ma zhugs pa yang yod de /
translated: There are also reasons that do not contain the term ultimate.

original: de kho na nyid la 'jug pa las /
analyzed: de kho na nyid la 'jug pa las /
translated: For example, the Avatārabhāṣya says:

original: phyi rol nang na gnas 'di kun //
analyzed: phyi rol nang na gnas 'di kun //
translated: All of these, external and internal,

original: yang dag tu na rang bzhin med //🔽gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: yang dag tu na rang bzhin med // gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin nyid //
translated: in reality, are essenceless.🔽Because they are devoid of a nature of oneness and plurality,

original: bral ba'i phyir na gzugs brnyan bzhin //
analyzed: bral ba'i phyir na gzugs brnyan bzhin //
translated: like a reflection.

original: gang zhig gcig dang du ma dang bral ba de ni don dam par na rang bzhin med de dper na gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gcig dang du ma dang bral ba de ni don dam par na rang bzhin med de dper na gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
translated: That which is devoid of oneness and plurality is ultimately essenceless, like a reflection.

original: phyi rol nang na gnas pa'i dngos po 'di dag thams cad kyang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas na rang bzhin med do zhes gsungs pa dang / yang dag pa'i sgra yod kyang de ni ma yin pa dgag pa'i sgrar sbyar te /
analyzed: phyi rol nang na gnas pa'i dngos po 'di dag thams cad kyang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas na rang bzhin med do zhes gsungs pa dang / yang dag pa'i sgra yod kyang de ni ma yin pa dgag pa'i sgrar sbyar te /
translated: And although the term “real” is used, it is applied as a term that is a negation of nonexistence.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus,

original: dbu ma'i rgyan de nyid kyi t'ik'a las /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rgyan de nyid kyi t'ik'a las /
translated: in the Ornament of the Middle Way Autocommentary it says,

original: sbyor ba de ni 'di lta bu yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba de ni 'di lta bu yin te /
translated: “The syllogism is like this:

original: gang dag gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de dag ni don dam par rang bzhin med de dper na gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
analyzed: gang dag gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de dag ni don dam par rang bzhin med de dper na gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
translated: Whatever is not of the nature of one or many is ultimately devoid of intrinsic nature, like a reflection.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyis smras pa'i dngos po rnams kyang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyis smras pa'i dngos po rnams kyang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And things spoken of by ourselves and others are not of the nature of one or many” is the nonobservation of a pervader.

original: gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid kyi rang bzhin la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid kyi rang bzhin la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because being one or many pervades having an intrinsic nature.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas 'brel pa ma grub pa de ni gtan la phab ces tha snyad gdags su med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas 'brel pa ma grub pa de ni gtan la phab ces tha snyad gdags su med de /
translated: Thus, that which is not established by perception or inference cannot be said to be established.

original: dper na me dang du ba'i 'brel ba gtan la phab pa'i dus su don dam pa'i bden pa'i gtan la phab ces tha snyad gdags su mi 'dod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na me dang du ba'i 'brel ba gtan la phab pa'i dus su don dam pa'i bden pa'i gtan la phab ces tha snyad gdags su mi 'dod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when the relation between fire and smoke is established, it cannot be said that the ultimate truth is established.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i don dam pa la 'brel pa 'jog pa 'di yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag par ma grub pas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i don dam pa la 'brel pa 'jog pa 'di yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag par ma grub pas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This establishment of the relation in the ultimate truth, which is the basis of the dispute, is a non-observation of the pervader, since it is not established by perception or inference.

original: gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i 'brel pa de ni gtan la @238b phab pas phyogs kyi chos rtogs pa la dgos pa med de /
analyzed: gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i 'brel pa de ni gtan la @238b phab pas phyogs kyi chos rtogs pa la dgos pa med de /
translated: That relation which is not similar to the predicate of the proposition is not necessary for the understanding of the property of the subject by the establishment.

original: dper na byas pa dang mi rtag pa gtan la phab pa las rgyab kyi me rtogs pa la dgos pa med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na byas pa dang mi rtag pa gtan la phab pa las rgyab kyi me rtogs pa la dgos pa med pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the establishment of the impermanence of sound is not necessary for the understanding of the property of the subject, the sound of a conch.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa kho na la 'brel pa gtan la 'bebs zhes bya ba 'di yang phyogs kyi chos dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pas khyab par byed pas mi dmigs pa'o //🔽de bas na bye brag ni don dam pa'i bden pa'am //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa kho na la 'brel pa gtan la 'bebs zhes bya ba 'di yang phyogs kyi chos dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pas khyab par byed pas mi dmigs pa'o // de bas na bye brag ni don dam pa'i bden pa'am //
translated: The so-called “establishment of the relation” in the conventional truth that is the basis of the dispute is also a non-observation of the pervasion because the property of the position and the definition are not similar.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang la yang gtan la dbab tu mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang la yang gtan la dbab tu mi 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, the distinction is not accepted as established in either the ultimate truth or the conventional truth.

original: 'o na bden pa gnyis su ma 'dus pa med pas 'brel pa mi 'grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bden pa gnyis su ma 'dus pa med pas 'brel pa mi 'grub bo zhe na /
translated: Well, if there is nothing not included in the two truths, then the relation is not established.

original: bden te / 'on kyang rigs mi mthun pa la sogs pa rtag pa'i spyi zhes bya ba dang / rigs mthun pa la sogs pa rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni khas blangs dgos te /
analyzed: bden te / 'on kyang rigs mi mthun pa la sogs pa rtag pa'i spyi zhes bya ba dang / rigs mthun pa la sogs pa rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni khas blangs dgos te /
translated: That is true, but still, one must accept such things as the “universal of the permanent” in dissimilar types and such things as the “abiding in its own nature” in similar types.

original: 'di ltar sdod /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdod /
translated: It is like this:

original: gcig dang du ma dang / rang bzhin las log pa'i gcig dang du ma dang bral ba dang / rang bzhin med pa gnyis ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la yang 'jug / don dam pa'i bden pa la yang 'jug ste /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dang / rang bzhin las log pa'i gcig dang du ma dang bral ba dang / rang bzhin med pa gnyis ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la yang 'jug / don dam pa'i bden pa la yang 'jug ste /
translated: One and many, and free from one and many, which is the opposite of intrinsic reality, and the two kinds of absence of intrinsic reality apply to the conventional truth and also apply to the ultimate truth.

original: thun mong du 'jug go //
analyzed: thun mong du 'jug go //
translated: They apply in common.

original: 'o na spyi de la 'brel pa sgrub bam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na spyi de la 'brel pa sgrub bam zhe na /
translated: Well, is that generality established as related?

original: smras pa de yang ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa de yang ma yin no //
translated: It is said that it is not.

original: 'o na ci ltar bsgrub ce na /🔽'di ltar gang dag gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de dag ni zhes smras pa na gtan tshigs spyir smos pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar bsgrub ce na / 'di ltar gang dag gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de dag ni zhes smras pa na gtan tshigs spyir smos pa'o //
translated: Well, how is it established?🔽When it is said, “Those that are not of the nature of one or many,” the reason is stated in general.

original: don dam par rang bzhin med do zhes smras pa dang / gtan tshigs spyi'i rjes su bsgrub bya spyi 'gro bar smras pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam par rang bzhin med do zhes smras pa dang / gtan tshigs spyi'i rjes su bsgrub bya spyi 'gro bar smras pa yin te /
translated: When it is said, “Ultimately, they are without intrinsic reality,” and when it is said that the probandum in general follows from the reason in general,

original: ma rig pas ldongs pa'i 'jig rten pa dag mtshan nyid kyi yang dag pa'i kun rdzob yin pa'i lta ba dang / bsgom pa dang / myang ba can gyi don byed nus pa'i rang bzhin 'di la don dam par 'dzin la /
analyzed: ma rig pas ldongs pa'i 'jig rten pa dag mtshan nyid kyi yang dag pa'i kun rdzob yin pa'i lta ba dang / bsgom pa dang / myang ba can gyi don byed nus pa'i rang bzhin 'di la don dam par 'dzin la /
translated: The worldly who are blinded by ignorance apprehend this nature, which is the correct relative that has characteristics, as ultimately real, and they engage in the view, meditation, and conduct that are based on that.

original: grub pa'i mtha' las ni rigs pas grub pa la don dam pa zhes zer bas de gnyis ka rjes su 'gro ba bstan to //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' las ni rigs pas grub pa la don dam pa zhes zer bas de gnyis ka rjes su 'gro ba bstan to //
translated: In the philosophical tenet systems, what is established by reasoning is called “ultimate,” and so both of those are taught to be included in the relative.

original: dper na gzugs brnyan bzhin no //🔽zhes smras pa /
analyzed: dper na gzugs brnyan bzhin no // zhes smras pa /
translated: For example, it is like a reflection.

original: spyi de bye brag kun rdzob kyi bden pa la zhugs par bstan to //
analyzed: spyi de bye brag kun rdzob kyi bden pa la zhugs par bstan to //
translated: Thus it is taught that the universal is included in the relative truth of particulars.

original: des na gzugs brnyan de nyid don byed nus pa'i bzhin gcig dang du ma ma yin pas don byed nus pa'i bzhin gyi rang bzhin ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: des na gzugs brnyan de nyid don byed nus pa'i bzhin gcig dang du ma ma yin pas don byed nus pa'i bzhin gyi rang bzhin ma yin par bstan to //
translated: Therefore, since that reflection is neither one with nor many from the face that is able to perform a function, it is taught that it is not the nature of a face that is able to perform a function.

original: phyir rgol bas ni shes pa rtog med mngon sum du 'khrul pa gcig gis de @239a * //
analyzed: phyir rgol bas ni shes pa rtog med mngon sum du 'khrul pa gcig gis de @239a * //
translated: The opponent may think, “The nonconceptual consciousness is mistaken, and so it is not valid cognition.

original: de ltar rtogs so //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs so //
translated: Thus it is understood.

original: de ltar spyi bye brag dang bcas pa de dper grub nas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la gtan tshigs yod par bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar spyi bye brag dang bcas pa de dper grub nas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la gtan tshigs yod par bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Having thus established the example along with the general and specific points, in order to demonstrate that the reason exists in regard to the subject to be proven, he says:

original: bdag dang gzhan gyis smras pa'i dngos po rnams kyang zhes smras pas /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyis smras pa'i dngos po rnams kyang zhes smras pas /
translated: “The things spoken of by ourselves and others…”

original: chos can gzugs brnyan dang mi 'dra bar don byed nus pa ni 'jig rten pas /
analyzed: chos can gzugs brnyan dang mi 'dra bar don byed nus pa ni 'jig rten pas /
translated: The subject, which is not like a reflection in that it is able to perform a function, is what the worldly accept as real.

original: yang dag par 'dod pa 'di nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dod pa 'di nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pas zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pas zhes smras pa ni /
translated: “Because it is not of the nature of one or many…”

original: gtan tshigs de bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can don byed nus pa gzhan gyis dbang don dam par 'dod pa 'di nyid la yod par bstan to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can don byed nus pa gzhan gyis dbang don dam par 'dod pa 'di nyid la yod par bstan to //
translated: This demonstrates that the reason exists in regard to the subject to be proven, which is the ability to perform a function, and which is accepted by others as being ultimately real.

original: des na spyir don dam pa'i gcig dang du ma ma yin pa de bye brag tu gzugs brnyan du zhugs pa de tsam zhig bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can thams cad la yang yod par rgol bas kyang smras pa //
analyzed: des na spyir don dam pa'i gcig dang du ma ma yin pa de bye brag tu gzugs brnyan du zhugs pa de tsam zhig bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can thams cad la yang yod par rgol bas kyang smras pa //
translated: Therefore, the general fact that it is neither ultimately one nor many is applied to the specific case of the subject to be proven, and the opponent accepts that it is also able to perform a function.

original: phyir rgol bas kyang de tsam yod par go'o //
analyzed: phyir rgol bas kyang de tsam yod par go'o //
translated: and the opponent also understands it to be just that much.

original: de skad du ;
analyzed: de skad du ;
translated: Thus it is said:

original: bam po lnga pa las kyang /
analyzed: bam po lnga pa las kyang /
translated: In the fifth chapter it says:

original: mthun pa'i dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyi dang don mthun no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mthun pa'i dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyi dang don mthun no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The concordant example is concordant in meaning with the generality of the probandum.

original: de tsam la dgongs nas chos can dang / gtan tshigs la sogs pa mthun par snang ba 'jog ces gsungs pa dang / rgol ba gnyi ga'i shes pa la ;
analyzed: de tsam la dgongs nas chos can dang / gtan tshigs la sogs pa mthun par snang ba 'jog ces gsungs pa dang / rgol ba gnyi ga'i shes pa la ;
translated: With just that much in mind, it is said that the subject, reason, and so forth are posited as appearing in common, and it is said:

original: / ji tsam snang ba'i cha yod pa //
analyzed: / ji tsam snang ba'i cha yod pa //
translated: Whatever part appears to the consciousness🔽of both parties in a debate,

original: de tsam de la brten nas ni //
analyzed: de tsam de la brten nas ni //
translated: to that extent, based on that,

original: chos can chos la sogs pa rtogs //
analyzed: chos can chos la sogs pa rtogs //
translated: the subject, predicate, and so forth are understood.🔽And it is said:

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / bsgrub pa dang sgrub pa'i dngos 'di ni //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / bsgrub pa dang sgrub pa'i dngos 'di ni //
translated: This entity of proof and probandum

original: gzhung gis bskyed pa'i bye brag gis //
analyzed: gzhung gis bskyed pa'i bye brag gis //
translated: is due to the distinctions generated by the text.🔽Having abandoned the subject,

original: chos can spangs nas mkhas pa dang // bud med byis pa'i bar dag gis //🔽shes par gyur pa'i dngos rnams la //
analyzed: chos can spangs nas mkhas pa dang // bud med byis pa'i bar dag gis // shes par gyur pa'i dngos rnams la //
translated: the wise and even women and children🔽will without exception

original: ma lus yang dag 'jug par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ma lus yang dag 'jug par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: correctly engage with the entities that are known.

original: rtags de bum pa lta bu bye brag cig la phyir rgol ba mkhas pas ni mngon sum dang cha shas bcur snang ste /
analyzed: rtags de bum pa lta bu bye brag cig la phyir rgol ba mkhas pas ni mngon sum dang cha shas bcur snang ste /
translated: The sign is established by inference for the unwise, such as those whose minds are corrupted by habituation to false treatises.🔽The wise, such as the opponent, perceive the pot, a particular, directly as having ten parts.

original: gcig ma yin par rtogs la bstan bcos log pa la goms pas blo bslad pa la sogs pa mi mkhas pa rnams kyis rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas 'grub ste /🔽'di ltar brtags te mthun par snang ba'i chos can la bzhag pas khas blang na dgos //
analyzed: gcig ma yin par rtogs la bstan bcos log pa la goms pas blo bslad pa la sogs pa mi mkhas pa rnams kyis rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas 'grub ste / 'di ltar brtags te mthun par snang ba'i chos can la bzhag pas khas blang na dgos //
translated: They understand it to be not one.

original: mthong ba tsam gyis nges pa ni ma skyes pa de the @239b tshom za na rags pa bum pa nas rdul phra rab la thug gi bar du yid rab tu btud nas /🔽phyogs cha bcu'am //
analyzed: mthong ba tsam gyis nges pa ni ma skyes pa de the @239b tshom za na rags pa bum pa nas rdul phra rab la thug gi bar du yid rab tu btud nas / phyogs cha bcu'am //
translated: If one is uncertain about that mere non-arising, one should thoroughly focus the mind on the coarse pot down to the subtle particles.🔽One should examine whether it is one or many.

original: drug gam / bzhir brtags nas gcig dang bral bas nges pa skyed la /
analyzed: drug gam / bzhir brtags nas gcig dang bral bas nges pa skyed la /
translated: If one examines it as having ten, six, or four parts, one should generate certainty that it is free from being one.

original: de la yang the tshom za na yid rab tu btud nas bltas la /
analyzed: de la yang the tshom za na yid rab tu btud nas bltas la /
translated: If one is uncertain about that, one should thoroughly focus the mind and look.

original: phyogs cha bcur phye bas gcig tu ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: phyogs cha bcur phye bas gcig tu ma mthong ngo //
translated: Since it is divided into ten parts, one does not see it as one.

original: de mi snang bas cha shas med par du mar the tshom za ba'i rgyu med de /
analyzed: de mi snang bas cha shas med par du mar the tshom za ba'i rgyu med de /
translated: Since it does not appear, there is no reason to doubt that it is partless.

original: de ma mthong bas gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i rtags rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ma mthong bas gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i rtags rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas grub pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not seen, the reason that it is free from being one or many is established by inference.

original: don dam pa'i gcig dang du ma zhes bya ba dang / cha shas med pa'i gcig dang du ma zhes bya ba don tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i gcig dang du ma zhes bya ba dang / cha shas med pa'i gcig dang du ma zhes bya ba don tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: The so-called ultimate one and many and the so-called partless one and many are not different in meaning.

original: de ma mthong ba'i shes pa ma bskyed pas bdag nyid kyang gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i shes pa'i tha snyad mi skye la /
analyzed: de ma mthong ba'i shes pa ma bskyed pas bdag nyid kyang gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i shes pa'i tha snyad mi skye la /
translated: Since the cognition that does not see them is not produced, the convention of the cognition that is free from being one or many is not produced in itself.

original: gzhan la sgra'i tha snyad kyang mi brjod de /
analyzed: gzhan la sgra'i tha snyad kyang mi brjod de /
translated: One does not even utter the sound convention to others.

original: de ni nges pa sngon du 'gro bar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ni nges pa sngon du 'gro bar bstan zin to //
translated: That is taught to be preceded by ascertainment.

original: kha cig de la 'o na ni gtan tshigs don dam pa la gzhag par 'gro ste /
analyzed: kha cig de la 'o na ni gtan tshigs don dam pa la gzhag par 'gro ste /
translated: Some say: Well then, the reason is posited in the ultimate,

original: des na bsgrub pa'i mtha' spangs nas //
analyzed: des na bsgrub pa'i mtha' spangs nas //
translated: and therefore the conclusion is refuted.

original: ji tsam snang ba'i cha la gzhag pa dang // 'gal ba dang / rang bzhin med pa dang / tha dad ma yin pa'i dam bcas pa'i phyogs gcig gtan tshigs su blangs pas yang na ma grub /
analyzed: ji tsam snang ba'i cha la gzhag pa dang // 'gal ba dang / rang bzhin med pa dang / tha dad ma yin pa'i dam bcas pa'i phyogs gcig gtan tshigs su blangs pas yang na ma grub /
translated: and the one part of the thesis that is devoid of intrinsic nature and not different from the reason is taken as the reason.

original: grub na rtags kyi rjes su 'brang bar don med par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: grub na rtags kyi rjes su 'brang bar don med par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa yod do zhe na /
translated: If it is established, then the fault arises that it is pointless to follow the reason.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: ji tsam snang ba'i cha la 'jog / ces bya ba yang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i dus su mthun par snang ba la sgra sbyor gyis rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni chos can mngon sum du snang ba la ni /
analyzed: ji tsam snang ba'i cha la 'jog / ces bya ba yang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i dus su mthun par snang ba la sgra sbyor gyis rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni chos can mngon sum du snang ba la ni /
translated: As for the statement, “It is posited in terms of what appears to the other,” in the context of an inference for the sake of others, the term “appears” is applied to what appears compatibly. In an inference for oneself, the subject appears by way of perception.

original: gtan tshigs kyang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas gcig dang du ma dang bral bar nges pa skye ba yod //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas gcig dang du ma dang bral bar nges pa skye ba yod //
translated: In that case, the reason is ascertained as being free from being one or many by means of perception or inference.

original: mthun par snang ba ma yin pa la chos can dang gtan tshig 'jog pa yang yod de //
analyzed: mthun par snang ba ma yin pa la chos can dang gtan tshig 'jog pa yang yod de //
translated: In the case of what does not appear compatibly, the subject and reason are posited.

original: dper na rdul phra rab lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rdul phra rab lta bu'o //
translated: For example, this is like the case of a subtle particle.

original: de dngos po la gnas pas mthun par snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dngos po la gnas pas mthun par snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because it is based on a real entity that it appears in common,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: nye zer gyi ni rdul gcig la //
analyzed: nye zer gyi ni rdul gcig la //
translated: In the case of a single particle of light

original: phra rab rdul ni 'bum phrag brgyad //
analyzed: phra rab rdul ni 'bum phrag brgyad //
translated: there are 84,000 subtle particles,

original: khri phrag gnyis dang stong phrag gsum //
analyzed: khri phrag gnyis dang stong phrag gsum //

original: brgya phrag lnga dang bzhi bcu gsum //
analyzed: brgya phrag lnga dang bzhi bcu gsum //

original: de lta bu'i cha de mthun par snang ba yin nam /
analyzed: de lta bu'i cha de mthun par snang ba yin nam /
translated: Do those parts appear in common?

original: @240a * // de lta bas na dgos pa ni rnal 'byor pa'i rtogs pa bsal bar bya ba dang / the tshom gyi zug rngu dbyung ba'i dgos pa yod la /
analyzed: @240a * // de lta bas na dgos pa ni rnal 'byor pa'i rtogs pa bsal bar bya ba dang / the tshom gyi zug rngu dbyung ba'i dgos pa yod la /
translated: Therefore, the purpose is to eliminate the realization of the yogi and to remove the pain of doubt.

original: dgos pa ni mngon sum du ma gyur pa blo gzhigs pa'i dum bu shin tu phra ba la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ni mngon sum du ma gyur pa blo gzhigs pa'i dum bu shin tu phra ba la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The purpose is to consider the extremely subtle parts of the mind that do not appear directly.

original: dam bcas pa'i phyogs gcig ces bya ba 'di yang nyes pa med de //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i phyogs gcig ces bya ba 'di yang nyes pa med de //
translated: This is also faultless in terms of the one-sided thesis.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: gtan tshigs 'di la ni dam bcas pa'i phyogs gcig pa yang med de /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di la ni dam bcas pa'i phyogs gcig pa yang med de /
translated: This reason is also not one-sided in terms of the thesis.

original: grub pa'i yul gyis yul can shes pa dang / sgra dang tha snyad rnams bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: grub pa'i yul gyis yul can shes pa dang / sgra dang tha snyad rnams bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they establish the object of the term and the consciousness that apprehends it, as well as the terms and conventions themselves.

original: dper na 'di ni ba glang ste /
analyzed: dper na 'di ni ba glang ste /
translated: For example, it is like saying, “This is a cow🔽because it is the nature of a collection of a dewlap and so on.”

original: lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar ji skad smras pa'i 'thad pa rnams kyi gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bar bstan du zin kyang /
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar ji skad smras pa'i 'thad pa rnams kyi gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bar bstan du zin kyang /
translated: Although it has been shown that the things spoken of are free from the nature of being one or many through the previously mentioned reasonings,

original: gang dag thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas phyin ci log gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de /
analyzed: gang dag thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas phyin ci log gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de /
translated: those who have been continuously habituated to error since beginningless time in samsara

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa yongs su 'phel ba spang bar dka' ba dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pas goms par mi byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa yongs su 'phel ba spang bar dka' ba dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pas goms par mi byed pa'i phyir /
translated: and who have increased their attachment to things, which is difficult to abandon, and who do not meditate on them with proper mental attention

original: yang dag par dngos po mtha' dag la khyab pa'i rang bzhin med pa nges par mi sems mi brjod cing /
analyzed: yang dag par dngos po mtha' dag la khyab pa'i rang bzhin med pa nges par mi sems mi brjod cing /
translated: do not think or say that things are ascertained to be without a nature that pervades all of reality.

original: gzhan dag la yang nges pa bskyed par 'dod pas tha snyad 'dogs par mi byed pa de dag la /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang nges pa bskyed par 'dod pas tha snyad 'dogs par mi byed pa de dag la /
translated: Those who do not use conventions to generate such an ascertainment in others

original: 'di lta de ltar shes pa sgra dang tha snyad kyi yul nyid grub ste dmigs su yod pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa las /
analyzed: 'di lta de ltar shes pa sgra dang tha snyad kyi yul nyid grub ste dmigs su yod pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa las /
translated: Thus, consciousness is established as the object of words and conventions, and it becomes a characteristic that can be observed.

original: mi dmigs pas med ces bya ba lta bu'o //🔽zhes gsungs kyi /🔽gtan tshigs ni ma yin par dgag pa yin pas snang ba yin la /
analyzed: mi dmigs pas med ces bya ba lta bu'o // zhes gsungs kyi / gtan tshigs ni ma yin par dgag pa yin pas snang ba yin la /
translated: But since it is not observed, it is said to be nonexistent.🔽But he does not say that the reason is an implicative negation and the appearance is an

original: bsgrub bya ni med par dgag pa yin pas nyes pa med ces ni mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: bsgrub bya ni med par dgag pa yin pas nyes pa med ces ni mi gsung ngo //
translated: exclusion negation, and that there is no error because the probandum is an exclusion negation.

original: de lta ma yin na bdag nyid gcig pa yang ji ltar rung /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na bdag nyid gcig pa yang ji ltar rung /
translated: If that were not so, how could they be identical?

original: 'o na mthun pa'i dpe la ni ma yin par dgag pa'i sgrar sbyor la /
analyzed: 'o na mthun pa'i dpe la ni ma yin par dgag pa'i sgrar sbyor la /
translated: Well, in the case of a concordant example, the word “exclusion” is used,

original: de dang mthun pas phyogs kyi chos smos pas khyad par du med pa yin pas cis rtogs she na /
analyzed: de dang mthun pas phyogs kyi chos smos pas khyad par du med pa yin pas cis rtogs she na /
translated: but since the property of the subject is mentioned in accordance with that, there is no difference. How is it understood?

original: gzugs brnyan la ni don byed nus pa'i gcig dang du ma dang bral bar bsgrubs la /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la ni don byed nus pa'i gcig dang du ma dang bral bar bsgrubs la /
translated: In the case of a reflection, it is established as devoid of a single or multiple entity that is able to perform a function.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la ni dgag rgyu de nyid las te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la ni dgag rgyu de nyid las te /
translated: And in the case of the subject of the probandum, it is the same cause of negation.

original: kun brtags pa ni gzhan gyis bkag zin to //
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni gzhan gyis bkag zin to //
translated: Imagined reality has already been refuted by others.

original: de bas na bsdus pa @240b dang shugs kyis go ba'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na bsdus pa @240b dang shugs kyis go ba'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is called a “condensed” or “implied” syllogism.

original: ming de lta bu ni theg pa bsdus pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: ming de lta bu ni theg pa bsdus pa las gsungs so //
translated: Such a name is stated in the Compendium of the Mahāyāna.

original: shugs ni 'brel ba'i shugs so //
analyzed: shugs ni 'brel ba'i shugs so //
translated: “ Implied” means implied by the connection.

original: don dam par rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: don dam par rang bzhin med do //
translated: Ultimately, there is no intrinsic nature.

original: zhes smras pas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bstan zin to //
analyzed: zhes smras pas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bstan zin to //
translated: By stating this, the probandum has been stated.

original: de yang yang dag pa'i shes pa bsam pa'i dbang gis 'di nyid rang bzhin med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa'i shes pa bsam pa'i dbang gis 'di nyid rang bzhin med pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, this is the absence of intrinsic existence from the perspective of correct knowledge.

original: kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not from the perspective of conventional knowledge.

original: de la kha cig na re rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rtag pa rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa /
analyzed: de la kha cig na re rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rtag pa rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa /
translated: In this regard, some say, “What is called ‘intrinsic nature’ is permanent, not produced by causes and conditions,

original: rigs pas mi gnod pa blos ma brtags pa la zer ba yin te ;
analyzed: rigs pas mi gnod pa blos ma brtags pa la zer ba yin te ;
translated: not undermined by reasoning, and not imagined by the mind.

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis /
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis /
translated: Ārya Nāgārjuna said:

original: gal te rang bzhin gyis yod na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyis yod na /
translated: If something exists due to intrinsic nature,

original: de ni med pa nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni med pa nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: it will not become nonexistent.🔽It is never tenable

original: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni /🔽nam yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni /🔽nam yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: that intrinsic nature transforms into something else.

original: rang bzhin dag ni ji lta bur //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag ni ji lta bur //
translated: How could a nature be fabricated?

original: byas pa can zhes bya bar 'gyur //
analyzed: byas pa can zhes bya bar 'gyur //
translated: How could it be called “fabricated”?

original: rang bzhin byas pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin byas pa ma yin pa //
translated: A nature is not fabricated.

original: pha rol pa yang ltos pa med //
analyzed: pha rol pa yang ltos pa med //
translated: Nor does it depend on another.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas de med kyi /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas de med kyi /
translated: Since it is said that “it does not exist,”

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni snang ngo zhe na /
translated: dependent origination appears.

original: de la smras pa bden te /
analyzed: de la smras pa bden te /
translated: To this we reply: It is true that

original: 'on kyang rigs pa bya ba ci la bya /
analyzed: 'on kyang rigs pa bya ba ci la bya /
translated: but what is the point of this reasoning?

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is right knowledge,🔽then when asked, “Does it appear?”

original: de la snang ngam zhes dris pa na snang zhes zer na /
analyzed: de la snang ngam zhes dris pa na snang zhes zer na /
translated: if you say, “It appears,”

original: de nyid rigs pas mi gnod ci grub pa don dam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid rigs pas mi gnod ci grub pa don dam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: then how could it be established as ultimate, since it is not undermined by reasoning?

original: kun rdzob ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not conventional.

original: 'on te bsgrub bya khong du chud par byed pa'i dus su spyi rjes su dpag pa yin pas snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bsgrub bya khong du chud par byed pa'i dus su spyi rjes su dpag pa yin pas snang ngo zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it appears because at the time of understanding the probandum, the universal is inferred,

original: dam bcas pa dang / phyogs dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba ni gcig ste /
analyzed: dam bcas pa dang / phyogs dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba ni gcig ste /
translated: then the thesis, the subject, the probandum, and the reason would be the same.

original: don dam par rang bzhin med pa dang / kun rdzob tu snang ba gnyis su dam bcas pa la sogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam par rang bzhin med pa dang / kun rdzob tu snang ba gnyis su dam bcas pa la sogs pa yin gyi /
translated: The two truths are posited as ultimate naturelessness and conventional appearance.

original: shes pa gcig la gnyis snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gcig la gnyis snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that two appear to a single consciousness.

original: chos can snang ba na chos nyid ces ji skad du bya /
analyzed: chos can snang ba na chos nyid ces ji skad du bya /
translated: When the apparent phenomenon appears, how can one say that it is the reality?

original: mi rtag pa ni dngos po yin pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni dngos po yin pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since impermanence is a thing, there is no contradiction.

original: chos can med na chos nyid de gang yin snyam na /🔽gtan la 'bebs tsam na 'di chos nyid spros pa dang bral zhe'am /
analyzed: chos can med na chos nyid de gang yin snyam na / gtan la 'bebs tsam na 'di chos nyid spros pa dang bral zhe'am /
translated: If there is no phenomenon, what is its reality?

original: rang bzhin med ces tha snyad 'dogs kyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin med ces tha snyad 'dogs kyi /
translated: When one is merely ascertaining, one designates it with the term “reality free from fabrication” or “essencelessness.”

original: gtan la 'bebs te rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa skyes tsam na /🔽chos nyid @241a * //
analyzed: gtan la 'bebs te rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa skyes tsam na / chos nyid @241a * //
translated: But when the inferential consciousness is merely produced,🔽one does not apprehend reality.

original: du mi 'dzin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: du mi 'dzin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore there is no fault.

original: 'on kyang chos can de nyid spros pa dang bral bas bye brag tu byas pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i sgo nas spyi zhes bya ba 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos can de nyid spros pa dang bral bas bye brag tu byas pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i sgo nas spyi zhes bya ba 'gal ba med do //
translated: However, since that phenomenon is free from fabrication, there is no contradiction in calling it a universal, since it is the object of a phenomenon that is distinguished in that way.

original: de bas na kun rdzob de nyid yang dag pa'i shes pa rang bzhin med par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na kun rdzob de nyid yang dag pa'i shes pa rang bzhin med par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, that conventional reality is realized to be essenceless by a correct consciousness.

original: gzhan du na 'di kun rdzob yin par cis grub /
analyzed: gzhan du na 'di kun rdzob yin par cis grub /
translated: Otherwise, how could this be established as conventional reality?

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'jam dpal gnas pa las /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gnas pa las /
translated: In the Manjusrivikrīdita🔽Sutra it says:🔽The expression of phenomena

original: 'das pa gang dang ma 'ongs dang // da ltar byung chos brjod pa ni //
analyzed: 'das pa gang dang ma 'ongs dang // da ltar byung chos brjod pa ni //
translated: In the past, future, and present

original: don gyis ma yin tha snyad tsam //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: don gyis ma yin tha snyad tsam // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Is not in fact so, but is merely conventional.

original: des ni don dam par ma grub pas kun rdzob tsam yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: des ni don dam par ma grub pas kun rdzob tsam yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is saying that because it is not established ultimately, it is merely conventional.🔽The statement

original: gcig dang sna tshogs pa mtshan nyid min //
analyzed: gcig dang sna tshogs pa mtshan nyid min //
translated: It is neither singular nor manifold

original: zhes gsungs pa des ni don ni don dam par na kun rdzob de nyid gcig dang du ma dang bral zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa des ni don ni don dam par na kun rdzob de nyid gcig dang du ma dang bral zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: is saying that ultimately that conventional reality is free from singularity and multiplicity.

original: de bas na de nyid rang bzhin med do zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de nyid rang bzhin med do zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is saying that it is essenceless.

original: 'o na yod pa bkag nas med pa 'dzin no zhen /🔽mtshan nyid med par gang rtogs pa //
analyzed: 'o na yod pa bkag nas med pa 'dzin no zhen / mtshan nyid med par gang rtogs pa //
translated: Well, if existence is refuted, then nonexistence is apprehended.🔽The statement🔽Those who understand the absence of characteristics

original: de dag nyid ni mtshan nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag nyid ni mtshan nyid 'gyur //
translated: Have the characteristics themselves

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: is saying that

original: des na med pa zhes bya ba cir yang ma grub ces bstan te /
analyzed: des na med pa zhes bya ba cir yang ma grub ces bstan te /
translated: Therefore, “non-existent” is taught to be “not established as anything at all.”

original: 'phags pa chos kun 'gro ba las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa chos kun 'gro ba las kyang /
translated: The noble Sūtra on the Progress of Dhāraṇī says,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rtsom pa med kyis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rtsom pa med kyis /
translated: “The bodhisattva is not a beginning.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros rnam par gnon pa la smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros rnam par gnon pa la smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Subāhu said to the bodhisattva Vikrāntagāmin,

original: de la ji ltar na bdag med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na bdag med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: “How should one understand emptiness through selflessness?”

original: stong pa nyid ni dngos po yang ma yin dngos po med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni dngos po yang ma yin dngos po med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Vikrāntagāmin replied, “Emptiness is neither a thing nor a non-thing.

original: gal te stong pa nyid dngos po yin du zin ni /
analyzed: gal te stong pa nyid dngos po yin du zin ni /
translated: If emptiness were a thing,

original: stong pa nyid du 'dus byas dang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du 'dus byas dang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: emptiness would be compounded and impermanent.

original: 'on te stong pa nyid dngos po med pa nyid yin du zin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te stong pa nyid dngos po med pa nyid yin du zin na ni /
translated: If emptiness were a non-thing,

original: stong pa mi stong par 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong pa mi stong par 'gyur te /
translated: emptiness would not be empty.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid dngos po ma yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid dngos po ma yin /
translated: Therefore, emptiness is not a thing

original: dngos po med pa yang ma yin te /🔽de ltar na bdag med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ma yin te / de ltar na bdag med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: and also not a non-thing.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, one should understand emptiness through selflessness.”

original: 'o na cir yang ma grub pa'i mi gsung bar med ces mi gsungs ba snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na cir yang ma grub pa'i mi gsung bar med ces mi gsungs ba snyam pa la /
translated: But if it is not established as anything, then it is not spoken of as not existing.

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis /
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis /
translated: The noble Nagarjuna says:

original: 'di ni de nyid 'gog pa ste //
analyzed: 'di ni de nyid 'gog pa ste //
translated: This is the refutation of reality.

original: med pa nyid du mi bzung ngo //🔽dkar po min zhes bstan pa na //
analyzed: med pa nyid du mi bzung ngo // dkar po min zhes bstan pa na //
translated: Do not hold it as nonexistence.🔽Just as it is taught, It is not white,

original: nag po yin zhes ma brjod bzhin //🔽zhes @241b gsungs so //
analyzed: nag po yin zhes ma brjod bzhin // zhes @241b gsungs so //
translated: but it is not said, It is black.

original: 'brel pa la ni log rtog bzhin //
analyzed: 'brel pa la ni log rtog bzhin //
translated: The four misconceptions about the relation are:🔽Misconceptions about the logical reason to be established,

original: bsgrub bya'i gtan tshigs log rtog dang // bsgrub bya nyid la log rtog dang // de dag sun dbyung mdor bstan pa //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i gtan tshigs log rtog dang // bsgrub bya nyid la log rtog dang // de dag sun dbyung mdor bstan pa //
translated: misconceptions about the object to be established,

original: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: and a brief presentation of their refutations.

original: de la sgom pa la log par rtog pa 'di gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sgom pa la log par rtog pa 'di gnyis te /
translated: The two misconceptions about meditation are:

original: bsgom pa dang / de'i rtags so //
analyzed: bsgom pa dang / de'i rtags so //
translated: meditation and its signs.

original: gong ma la gnyis te /
analyzed: gong ma la gnyis te /
translated: The two misconceptions about the higher are:

original: dmigs pa dang shes pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang shes pa'o //
translated: the object and the consciousness.

original: de la dmigs pa la ni kha cig na re da lta ni rgyu'i dus tshigs yin te /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa la ni kha cig na re da lta ni rgyu'i dus tshigs yin te /
translated: Regarding the object, some say, Now is the time of the cause.

original: thos bsam bya ste bsgom du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: thos bsam bya ste bsgom du mi 'dod do //
translated: One should listen and reflect, but not meditate.

original: dper na rdo'i steng du sa bon 'debs pa dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na rdo'i steng du sa bon 'debs pa dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: It is like planting seeds on a rock.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this it is replied:

original: de bas na khyad par can gyi rgyu la nan tan bya dgos pas bsgom mo //
analyzed: de bas na khyad par can gyi rgyu la nan tan bya dgos pas bsgom mo //
translated: Therefore, since it is necessary to practice with a special cause, one should meditate.

original: 'on te nga'i sems 'dug tu mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'on te nga'i sems 'dug tu mi 'dod do //
translated: But if you do not want my mind to stay,

original: zhe na / de tsam gyis gzhan bdag tu mi 'dod do //
analyzed: zhe na / de tsam gyis gzhan bdag tu mi 'dod do //
translated: then I do not want to be the other.

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa yid ches pa'i snga na nyams su myong ba smra ba las rjes su dpag par nus so ;
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa yid ches pa'i snga na nyams su myong ba smra ba las rjes su dpag par nus so ;
translated: One who is rational can infer from the statements of those who have had the experience.

original: /'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las kyang /
analyzed: /'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las kyang /
translated: And the noble Samādhirāja says,

original: lnga brgya tha ma'i dbang du mdzad nas ni //
analyzed: lnga brgya tha ma'i dbang du mdzad nas ni //
translated: With an eye to the last five hundred years,🔽At that time, there will be no less than five hundred

original: de yi tshe na ting 'dzin 'dzin pa dag / lnga brgya las ni mi nyung 'byung bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de yi tshe na ting 'dzin 'dzin pa dag / lnga brgya las ni mi nyung 'byung bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Who will hold this samadhi.

original: kha cig na re chos dang chos can gnyis kho na bsgom mo zhes zer te ;
analyzed: kha cig na re chos dang chos can gnyis kho na bsgom mo zhes zer te ;
translated: Some say that one should meditate on the mere object and the mere subject.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this it is replied:

original: de ni mi rtag pa tsam shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni mi rtag pa tsam shes pa yin gyi /
translated: That is the knowledge of mere impermanence.

original: spros pa dang bral ba ye ma go ba yin pas /
analyzed: spros pa dang bral ba ye ma go ba yin pas /
translated: It is not the understanding of freedom from fabrication.

original: re zhig gzhag ste zab mo'i snod ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig gzhag ste zab mo'i snod ma yin no //
translated: For the time being, it is not a vessel for the profound.

original: kha cig na re chos nyid kyi rang bzhin mtshan nyid kho na bsgom mo //
analyzed: kha cig na re chos nyid kyi rang bzhin mtshan nyid kho na bsgom mo //
translated: Some say: One meditates only on the nature and characteristics of reality.

original: de bas na je gsal je gsal skyed 'byung ba yin te ;
analyzed: de bas na je gsal je gsal skyed 'byung ba yin te ;
translated: Therefore, it is said that the clarity of the aspect increases more and more.

original: spyi'i rnam pa la gsal ba med do zhes zer te /
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa la gsal ba med do zhes zer te /
translated: But there is no clarity in the general aspect.

original: rnam pa la 'gal ba med do zhes te /
analyzed: rnam pa la 'gal ba med do zhes te /
translated: There is no contradiction in the aspect.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that it is said:

original: de ni mi rtag pa tsam shes pa yin /
analyzed: de ni mi rtag pa tsam shes pa yin /
translated: That is the mere knowledge of impermanence.

original: 'o na bden pa mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na bden pa mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Well then, it follows that one would see the truth.

original: de yon tan gyis mi mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: de yon tan gyis mi mnyam pa yin no //
translated: That is not equal in terms of qualities.

original: zhes zer na /
analyzed: zhes zer na /
translated: If one says that,🔽then for that very reason, do not accept it.

original: de nyid kyi phyir khas ma len cig / spyi'i rnam pa la yang je gsal je gsal 'gro bar lung las kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khas ma len cig / spyi'i rnam pa la yang je gsal je gsal 'gro bar lung las kyang gsungs te /
translated: Also, the scriptures state that clarity increases more and more in the general aspect.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs thos pa sems la gzhag pas mthong ba dang 'dra bar 'ong zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs thos pa sems la gzhag pas mthong ba dang 'dra bar 'ong zhes gsungs la /
translated: It is said: The Tathāgata’s form is heard and placed in the mind, and it comes to be like seeing it.

original: rigs pas kyang tshul khrims rnam par dag pa yid @242a * //
analyzed: rigs pas kyang tshul khrims rnam par dag pa yid @242a * //
translated: Also, it is reasonable that pure ethics

original: brtan pa'i tshig las rjes su dpag par nus so //
analyzed: brtan pa'i tshig las rjes su dpag par nus so //
translated: One can infer this from the words of the master himself.

original: 'on te rigs pa drug cu pa las spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa la bsgom pa'i skyor ba grub pa'i ngo bo'i yul rang gi mtshan nyid mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'on te rigs pa drug cu pa las spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa la bsgom pa'i skyor ba grub pa'i ngo bo'i yul rang gi mtshan nyid mi 'thad de /
translated: But if you say that in the Yuktisastika it is not tenable to cultivate the generic image of the object of refutation, because it is the nature of the established object,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /🔽de'i tshig ni 'brel pa med ces gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir / de'i tshig ni 'brel pa med ces gsungs so zhe na /
translated: then it follows that there would be an overextension of this principle,🔽for the Yuktisastika states that it is not tenable to cultivate the generic image of the object of refutation because it is unrelated to the object.

original: de la dngos por smra ba la skyon smras pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la dngos por smra ba la skyon smras pa ma yin te /
translated: We do not say that the realists are at fault,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rdzas su grub pa dang / dngos kyi spyi rdzas su ma grub pa gnyis tha dad pas gzhan bsgoms pas gzhan 'thob par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rdzas su grub pa dang / dngos kyi spyi rdzas su ma grub pa gnyis tha dad pas gzhan bsgoms pas gzhan 'thob par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but if the generic image is not substantially established, then it follows, absurdly, that by cultivating one thing, one attains another, for the generic image is different from the object of refutation, which is substantially established.

original: kha cig na re don gyi spyi'i rnam pa kho na bsgom mo zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re don gyi spyi'i rnam pa kho na bsgom mo zhes zer te /
translated: Some say that one cultivates only the generic image of the object.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: rnam pa ji lta bu zhig yin /
analyzed: rnam pa ji lta bu zhig yin /
translated: What is the generic image like?

original: cir yang ma grub pa snyam pa de tsam zhig yod par 'jog ste /
analyzed: cir yang ma grub pa snyam pa de tsam zhig yod par 'jog ste /
translated: It is posited as the mere fact that nothing is established at all.

original: de chos nyid kyi rnam pa yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: de chos nyid kyi rnam pa yin no zhes zer na /
translated: If you say that this is the generic image of reality,

original: de chos nyid kyi rnam pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de chos nyid kyi rnam pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not the aspect of reality,

original: spros pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spros pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a conceptual elaboration.

original: kha cig na re don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba ye med de /
analyzed: kha cig na re don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba ye med de /
translated: Some say that what is called ultimate truth does not exist at all,

original: kun rdzob rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ji ltar gnas pa bzhin bsgom mo zhes zer te /
analyzed: kun rdzob rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ji ltar gnas pa bzhin bsgom mo zhes zer te /
translated: and that one should meditate on the relative just as it is, as dependently originated.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To them we reply:

original: 'o na ci'i phyir kun rdzob zhes bya /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir kun rdzob zhes bya /
translated: Why is it called the relative?

original: rigs pas dpyad na ma grub pas kun rdzob ces zer na /
analyzed: rigs pas dpyad na ma grub pas kun rdzob ces zer na /
translated: If you say that it is called the relative because it is not established when analyzed by reasoning,

original: 'o na don dam pa'ang ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'o na don dam pa'ang ma grub ste /
translated: then the ultimate is also not established,

original: rigs pas gang zag dang chos ma grub pa tsam de nyid don dam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs pas gang zag dang chos ma grub pa tsam de nyid don dam pa ma yin no //
translated: because the mere nonestablishment of persons and phenomena when analyzed by reasoning is not the ultimate.

original: 'on te rigs pas ye mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'on te rigs pas ye mi 'jug ste /
translated: If you say that reasoning does not apply at all,

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa ye ma grub zer na /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa ye ma grub zer na /
translated: and that the selflessness of persons and phenomena is not established at all,

original: 'o na kun rdzob ces kyang ma zer cig / khyod byis pa bsten pa chos ma thos pa dang bye brag med do //
analyzed: 'o na kun rdzob ces kyang ma zer cig / khyod byis pa bsten pa chos ma thos pa dang bye brag med do //
translated: then do not even say “relative.” You are no different from a child who has not studied the Dharma.

original: de bsgom par bya mi dgos so //🔽de skad du /
analyzed: de bsgom par bya mi dgos so // de skad du /
translated: It is not necessary to meditate on that.

original: zla ba'i snying po'i le'u las 'byung ba /
analyzed: zla ba'i snying po'i le'u las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the chapter on Candragarbha:

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
translated: The ultimate truth is unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin no //
translated: It is not shared in common with any of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de bas na kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang gis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs kyi mchog bsgrub mi nus so //
analyzed: de bas na kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang gis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs kyi mchog bsgrub mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, no matter what conventional truth is, it cannot accomplish the supreme accumulation of roots of virtue for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: zla ba'i snying po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zla ba'i snying po 'di lta ste /
translated: Candra[kīrti]’s heart, it is like this.

original: dper na me stag gang gis rgya mtsho chen po zab mo skem mi nus so //
analyzed: dper na me stag gang gis rgya mtsho chen po zab mo skem mi nus so //
translated: For example, a spark cannot dry up the deep great ocean.

original: zla ba'i snying po de bzhin du kun rdzob kyi bden @242b pa gang gis kyang rang gi nyon mongs pa'i rgya mtsho skem par mi nus /
analyzed: zla ba'i snying po de bzhin du kun rdzob kyi bden @242b pa gang gis kyang rang gi nyon mongs pa'i rgya mtsho skem par mi nus /
translated: Candra[kīrti]’s heart, likewise, no matter what conventional truth is, it cannot dry up the ocean of one’s own afflictions,

original: sems can gzhan rnams kyis lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can gzhan rnams kyis lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs so //
translated: let alone those of other sentient beings.

original: kha cig na re don dam pa'i bden pa ni ye mi bsgoms te /
analyzed: kha cig na re don dam pa'i bden pa ni ye mi bsgoms te /
translated: Some say, “The ultimate truth is never meditated upon.

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa las /
translated: In the noble Akṣayamati-nirdeśa-sūtra,🔽it says:

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni gang la sems rgyu ba yang med na zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni gang la sems rgyu ba yang med na zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Ultimate truth is that in which the mind does not move.

original: sems kyi bsgom du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: sems kyi bsgom du mi 'dod do //

analyzed: zhes zer te /

analyzed: de la smras pa /

translated: It is said that the domain of nonconceptual wisdom is the same as the object of knowledge, and it is said that the ascertainment of the object by the power of the reason will not be deceived.

analyzed: gal te yin no zhe na /

analyzed: med pa de don dam pa'i bden pa yin nam /

original: 'on te kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin /

original: gal te don dam pa'i bden pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don dam pa'i bden pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: chos thams cad bsam du med cing sems pa med pa /

analyzed: rin po che bsags pa bstan pa'i mdo las /

analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa //

analyzed: gang ci la yang mi gnas pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa lags so // zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: yod pa bkag nas med pa don dam pa yin pa ni mdo sde gang na yang mi bzhugs so //

analyzed: med pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin te /

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /

analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis /

analyzed: dngos po gzhan du gyur pa ni //

analyzed: dngos po med ces skye bo smra //🔽zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: de skad du /

analyzed: gnas brtan gzhon nu ma legs kyi //

analyzed: @243a * // 'o ma dag la zho sogs med //

analyzed: de ni snga nas med ces bya //

original: zho la 'o ma med pa ni //
analyzed: zho la 'o ma med pa ni //

analyzed: zhig nas med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: because it is characterized by destruction.🔽The abandonment of the parts of the head,

analyzed: mgo yi yan lag 'jong ba dang // skyed dang sran pa rnams spangs pa //

analyzed: ri bong ra la sogs dngos su //
translated: the rabbit, the horn, and so on

analyzed: de ni gtan med brjod pa yin //

analyzed: de ni gcig la gcig med brjod //

analyzed: ces smras so //

analyzed: de dag las gang zhig yin par 'dod /

analyzed: gang khas blangs kyang chos nyid ma yin no //

original: 'on te kun rdzob kyi med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te kun rdzob kyi med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is nonexistence in the conventional sense,

analyzed: de mngon sum dang 'gal ba skur pa 'debs pa smra bas re zhig gzhag go //
translated: then that is a contradiction of direct perception. The proponent of nihilism should be set aside for the time being.

analyzed: de bas na bden pa gnyis kyis ma bsdus pa bka' dang bstan bcos dang 'gal ba smra ba de la zlog par byed pa su zhig yod /
translated: Therefore, who would refute the one who speaks of what is not included in the two truths as being in contradiction with the scriptures and the treatises?

analyzed: kha cig na re kun rdzob kyi bden pa brdzun pa skyon dang bcas pa bsgoms te /

analyzed: des mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye zhes zer te /

analyzed: de la smras pa ci'i phyir kun rdzob brdzun pa skyon dang bcas pa zhes bya /

analyzed: gal te rigs pas gang zag dang chos ma grub pas snang ba 'di brdzun pa dang kun rdzob yin zhe na /

analyzed: 'o na rigs pas gang zag dang chos ma grub pa tsam de don dam pa'i bden pa yin pas de bsgom mo //

original: 'on te ma grub na ci'i phyir kun rdzob ces bya /
analyzed: 'on te ma grub na ci'i phyir kun rdzob ces bya /

original: de ni yang dag par kho na snang ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: de ni yang dag par kho na snang ba'i rigs so //

analyzed: gzhan yang nyan thos mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba yang 'dus pa rdzas su mi 'dod do //

original: dbu ma par khas 'ches nas 'dus pa rigs pa'i shes pas goms par byed dam /
analyzed: dbu ma par khas 'ches nas 'dus pa rigs pa'i shes pas goms par byed dam /

original: de goms pas bden pa mthong na byis pa kun gyis bden pa mthong ste /
analyzed: de goms pas bden pa mthong na byis pa kun gyis bden pa mthong ste /

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis /
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis /

original: ji ltar byis pa rnams brtag bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa rnams brtag bzhin //
translated: Just as the childish conceive,

original: dngos po des te bden 'gyur na //
analyzed: dngos po des te bden 'gyur na //
translated: If things were true in that way,

original: de dag dngos med rnams thur du //
analyzed: de dag dngos med rnams thur du //

original: gang phyir mi 'dod rgyu de ci //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang phyir mi 'dod rgyu de ci // zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: spyir sun dbyung ba gang goms par byas pa de ni de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /

analyzed: dper na dngos po la mngon par zhen pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: yod pa dang med pa la goms par byed pa 'di dag kyang de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te //

original: zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: @243b des ni so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'das par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: @243b des ni so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'das par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus one does not transcend the stage of the ordinary person.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: slob dpon nyid kyis /
analyzed: slob dpon nyid kyis /
translated: The master himself says:

original: yod pas rnam par mi grol te //
analyzed: yod pas rnam par mi grol te //
translated: One is not liberated by existence.

original: med pas srid pa 'di las min //
analyzed: med pas srid pa 'di las min //
translated: But since it does not exist, it is not from that.🔽

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Not from this existence, since it does not exist.🔽Again,

original: yang ; so so'i skye bo dngos bdag can //
analyzed: yang ; so so'i skye bo dngos bdag can //

analyzed: yod dang med par phyin ci log nyes pas nyon mongs dbang gyur pa //
translated: He is overpowered by faults and afflictions,

original: rang gi sems kyis bslus par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyis bslus par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: And is deceived by his own mind.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: blo chung gang dag dngos rnams la //
analyzed: blo chung gang dag dngos rnams la //
translated: Those of little intelligence,

analyzed: yod pa nyid dang med nyid du // lta ba des ni blta bya ba //
translated: Who view things as existent or non-existent,🔽Do not see the pacification of views,

analyzed: nye bar zhi ba mi mthong ste //
translated: Which is to be seen.

analyzed: dper na bum pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la gtan tshigs the chom za ba'i ma grub pa yin no zhe na /

analyzed: 'on te rang gi mtshan nyid yin //

translated: The Acarya Kamalasila says in the
