translated: To that we say:

original: 'o na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang gzhan gyi dbang tha mi dad pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bsgoms par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang gzhan gyi dbang tha mi dad pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bsgoms par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Well then, it follows that one meditates on dependent origination, since it is not different from the dependent nature.

original: gal te thal bar mi 'gyur te /🔽mdo las rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba nges chos mthong //
analyzed: gal te thal bar mi 'gyur te / mdo las rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba nges chos mthong //
translated: If you say that does not follow,🔽then it follows that one who sees dependent origination sees the Dharma,

original: chos mthong ba zer na /
analyzed: chos mthong ba zer na /
translated: since a sutra declares: One who sees dependent origination sees the Dharma.

original: de la smras pa /🔽mthong zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la smras pa / mthong zhes gsungs so //
translated: To that we say:

original: zhe na / de ni kun rdzob la dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhe na / de ni kun rdzob la dgongs pa yin no //
translated: That is stated from the perspective of the conventional.

original: don dam pa mthong nas langs pa'i gnas skabs su rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / chos dang sangs rgyas la sogs pa 'jog go //🔽mnyam par gzhag pa'am /
analyzed: don dam pa mthong nas langs pa'i gnas skabs su rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / chos dang sangs rgyas la sogs pa 'jog go // mnyam par gzhag pa'am /
translated: When one rises from seeing the ultimate, one posits dependent origination, the Dharma, the Buddha and so on.🔽But one does not posit them when equipoised

original: don dam pa'i gnas skabs su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i gnas skabs su ni ma yin no //
translated: in the state of the ultimate.

original: @244b de skad du /
analyzed: @244b de skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos bstan pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos bstan pa las /
translated: In the Teaching of Sāgaramati,

original: gang dag rten cing 'brel 'byung ba //🔽de dag dngos nyid ci yang min //
analyzed: gang dag rten cing 'brel 'byung ba // de dag dngos nyid ci yang min //
translated: Whatever is dependently arisen🔽Has no essence.

original: gang dag ngo bo nyid med pa //🔽de dag gang du'ang 'byung ba med //
analyzed: gang dag ngo bo nyid med pa // de dag gang du'ang 'byung ba med //
translated: Whatever has no essence

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Does not arise.

original: 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las /
translated: And in the Marvelous Array Sutra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Tathāgata said:

original: 'jam dpal dbugs 'byin pa lnga po 'di dag rnyed na //
analyzed: 'jam dpal dbugs 'byin pa lnga po 'di dag rnyed na //
translated: Mañjuśrī, when bodhisattvas find these five kinds of relief,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dang po yongs su sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /🔽bdag gis chos rnams brten te mi 'byung bar mos pa gnas pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dang po yongs su sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas / bdag gis chos rnams brten te mi 'byung bar mos pa gnas pa ste /
translated: they will be able to engage in the first level of thorough preparation.🔽I will be patient and not give rise to the afflictions.

original: gzhan dag kyang chos rnams brten te mi 'byung bar mos pa la dgod par bya'o snyam nas dbugs 'byin pa rab tu rnyed de /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang chos rnams brten te mi 'byung bar mos pa la dgod par bya'o snyam nas dbugs 'byin pa rab tu rnyed de /
translated: I will establish others in patience and the nonarising of the afflictions.

original: de la rkyen rnams skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas chos rnams te mi 'byung zhes bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la rkyen rnams skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas chos rnams te mi 'byung zhes bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The conditions are not produced, and so the phenomena do not arise.

original: chos thams cad 'byung ba med par bstan pa las kyang /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'byung ba med par bstan pa las kyang /
translated: And the Teaching of Non-Origination of All Things says:

original: sangs rgyas med cing chos dang dge 'dun med //
analyzed: sangs rgyas med cing chos dang dge 'dun med //
translated: There are no Buddhas, no Dharma, no Sangha.

original: de ltar gang shes de ni mkhas par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar gang shes de ni mkhas par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: One who knows this is wise.

original: kha cig na re yongs su grub pa kho na bsgom ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re yongs su grub pa kho na bsgom ste /
translated: Some say that only the perfected is cultivated,

original: de don dam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de don dam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the ultimate.

original: de lta ma yin na kun rdzob gcig bsgom bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na kun rdzob gcig bsgom bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer te /
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that one would cultivate the conventional.

original: de la smras pa /🔽yongs su grub pa gang la bya ba /
analyzed: de la smras pa / yongs su grub pa gang la bya ba /
translated: To this we say:🔽What is the perfected that is cultivated?

original: gal te mi 'gyur bar yongs su 'grub pa la bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi 'gyur bar yongs su 'grub pa la bya'o zhe na /
translated: If it is the unchanging perfected,

original: de nyid mi shes so //
analyzed: de nyid mi shes so //
translated: that is not known.

original: gal te kun brtags las byis pa'i gnas skabs dang / 'phags pa'i gnas skabs su stong par 'dra bas na mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: gal te kun brtags las byis pa'i gnas skabs dang / 'phags pa'i gnas skabs su stong par 'dra bas na mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: If it is the perfected that is the same in emptiness in the childish state and in the ārya state, because of being different from the imagined,

original: thag pa la sbrul du 'khrul ba'i gnas skabs dang / thag par mthong ba'i gnas skabs pa gnyis sbrul med par 'dra ba bzhin no //
analyzed: thag pa la sbrul du 'khrul ba'i gnas skabs dang / thag par mthong ba'i gnas skabs pa gnyis sbrul med par 'dra ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the two situations of the error of a rope being a snake and the situation of seeing the rope.

original: kun brtags pa'i zhes bya ba ji lta bu de yang mi shes sam /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i zhes bya ba ji lta bu de yang mi shes sam /
translated: Do you not know that the imagined is also like that?

original: bdag dang bdag gis dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa la sogs pa tshad mas gnod bzhin du byis pas yod par kun brtags pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gis dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa la sogs pa tshad mas gnod bzhin du byis pas yod par kun brtags pa'o //
translated: The childish imagine the existence of self and what belongs to self, the apprehended and the apprehender, etc., even though they are undermined by valid cognition.

original: 'o na ni dbu ma bsgom zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na ni dbu ma bsgom zhes mi bya ste /
translated: Well then, it is not called the cultivation of the middle way,

original: sems tsam bsgom pa yin no //🔽gal te ma yin te /
analyzed: sems tsam bsgom pa yin no // gal te ma yin te /
translated: but the cultivation of mind only.

original: des ni gzhan gyi dbang don dam par 'dod /🔽dbu ma pas ni @245a * //
analyzed: des ni gzhan gyi dbang don dam par 'dod / dbu ma pas ni @245a * //
translated: That is not so, because they assert the dependent to be ultimate.

original: sgyu ma tsam du 'dod pa khyad che'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma tsam du 'dod pa khyad che'o //
translated: But the Madhyamikas assert it to be mere illusion.🔽What is the meaning of illusion?

original: sgyu ma bya ba don dam par shes rab dang ye shes kyis ma grub pas kun rdzob du snang ba la zer ram /
analyzed: sgyu ma bya ba don dam par shes rab dang ye shes kyis ma grub pas kun rdzob du snang ba la zer ram /
translated: Is it said to be the appearance of the conventional, since it is not established by wisdom and gnosis ultimately?

original: 'on te rigs pa'i shes pa la snang ba la yang bya /
analyzed: 'on te rigs pa'i shes pa la snang ba la yang bya /
translated: Or is it said to appear to the knowledge of reasoning?

original: de lta'o zhe na /
analyzed: de lta'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is like that,

original: smras pa / de kun brtags pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / de kun brtags pa kho na yin te /
translated: we reply: That is only the imagined.

original: rigs pas gnon bzhin du yod par 'dod pa'i phyir gang zag gi bdag bzhin no //
analyzed: rigs pas gnon bzhin du yod par 'dod pa'i phyir gang zag gi bdag bzhin no //
translated: because they assert that it exists, even though it is refuted by reasoning, like the self of the person.

original: de lta bas na sgyu ma la sogs pa yang don dam par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na sgyu ma la sogs pa yang don dam par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even such things as illusions would be ultimate.

original: gal te rigs pas gnod pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang ni mi bsgom ste /
analyzed: gal te rigs pas gnod pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang ni mi bsgom ste /
translated: If you say that you do not meditate on the relative because it is refuted by reasoning,

original: de dag gis chos nyid ye nas grub pa ni bsgom ste /
analyzed: de dag gis chos nyid ye nas grub pa ni bsgom ste /
translated: then you should meditate on the perfect, because it is established by reasoning.

original: des na sems tsam dang mi 'dra ste /
analyzed: des na sems tsam dang mi 'dra ste /
translated: Therefore, this is not the same as the Mind-Only system.

original: de dag ni kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gis stong pa la mi bsgom gyi /
analyzed: de dag ni kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gis stong pa la mi bsgom gyi /
translated: They do not meditate on emptiness of the imagined and the relative,

original: kun brtags pas stong pa gcig pu ye nas grub pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: kun brtags pas stong pa gcig pu ye nas grub pa bsgom mo //
translated: but they meditate on the primordial establishment of the emptiness of the imagined.

original: de ni bden te /
analyzed: de ni bden te /
translated: That is true,

original: 'on kyang gzhan gyi dbang gis chos nyid la dmigs pas de yang yongs su grub pas bsgom par 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan gyi dbang gis chos nyid la dmigs pas de yang yongs su grub pas bsgom par 'dra'o //
translated: but since they focus on the reality of the relative, they also meditate on the perfect, which is empty of the imagined.

original: de lta bas na dbu ma ni yongs su grub pa la yang dmigs te /
analyzed: de lta bas na dbu ma ni yongs su grub pa la yang dmigs te /
translated: Therefore, the Middle Way is also focused on the perfect.

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: The noble Unraveling the Intention Sūtra says:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces /
translated: The Bhagavat said this:

original: don dam yang dag 'phags /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags /
translated: Paramarthasamudgata,

original: ngas ngo bo nyid med pa gsum la dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par bstan te /
analyzed: ngas ngo bo nyid med pa gsum la dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par bstan te /
translated: I taught that all phenomena are natureless with the intention directed toward the three non-natures.

original: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa dang / skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa'o //🔽de la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa dang / skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa'o // de la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa ni /
translated: They are the imaginary nature, the other-dependent nature, and the real nature.

original: kun brtags ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: Among them, the imaginary nature is natureless in terms of character.

original: skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa ni gzhan gyi dbang ba ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa ni gzhan gyi dbang ba ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: The other-dependent nature is natureless in terms of production.

original: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa ni /
analyzed: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa ni /
translated: The real nature is natureless in terms of the ultimate.

original: de dag gis stong par 'dzin pa de yang ngo bo nyid med pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag gis stong par 'dzin pa de yang ngo bo nyid med pa'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The apprehension of those as empty of their own entity is also natureless.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las kyang /
translated: The noble Descent into Laṅkā Sūtra also says:

original: blo yis rnam par bshigs pa ni //
analyzed: blo yis rnam par bshigs pa ni //
translated: When the mind is destroyed

original: brtags pa med cing gzhan dbang med ;
analyzed: brtags pa med cing gzhan dbang med ;
translated: there is no imaginary and no other-dependent,

original: / grub pa'i dngos po yang med na //
analyzed: / grub pa'i dngos po yang med na //
translated: and if there are no established things,

original: blo yis ji ltar rnam par brtag / ces gsungs so //
analyzed: blo yis ji ltar rnam par brtag / ces gsungs so //
translated: how can the mind be imagined?

original: kha cig na re slob dpon klu sgrub kyi dbu ma chen po bya ba yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re slob dpon klu sgrub kyi dbu ma chen po bya ba yin te /
translated: Some say: It is the Great Middle Way of the master Nagarjuna.

original: de bsgoms pa ni thabs kyang ma bsten /
analyzed: de bsgoms pa ni thabs kyang ma bsten /
translated: Those who meditate on it do not rely on methods.

original: ci la yang mi bya bar zab mo kho nar yid la bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: ci la yang mi bya bar zab mo kho nar yid la bya'o zhes zer te /
translated: They should not do anything at all, but only mentally engage in the profound.

original: @245b de la smras pa /
analyzed: @245b de la smras pa /
translated: Reply:

original: dbu ma la che chung ni ma gsungs la /
analyzed: dbu ma la che chung ni ma gsungs la /
translated: The master Nagarjuna did not teach a great and a small middle way.

original: slob dpon nyid kyis mdo kun las btus las /
analyzed: slob dpon nyid kyis mdo kun las btus las /
translated: The master himself said in his Compendium of Sutras:

original: byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa dang bral bas chos zab mo la brtson par mi bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa dang bral bas chos zab mo la brtson par mi bya ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas who lack skill in means should not strive in the profound teachings.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it says:

original: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa las /
translated: In the teaching of the noble one Vimalakirti:

original: thabs med pas bcings pa'i shes rab bcing ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs med pas bcings pa'i shes rab bcing ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the wisdom that is bound by the absence of means?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa nges par rtogs shing /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa nges par rtogs shing /
translated: The realization of emptiness, signlessness and wishlessness.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la nges par mi rtog pa 'di ni thabs med pas bcings pa'i shes rab bcing ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la nges par mi rtog pa 'di ni thabs med pas bcings pa'i shes rab bcing ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par bstan to //
translated: The absence of definite conception of the signs and exemplary acts, the adornment of the Buddha-land, and the development of living beings is the bondage of wisdom without means.

original: kha cig na re theg pa mchog gi gnas skabs na yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa cir yang mi bsgom zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re theg pa mchog gi gnas skabs na yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa cir yang mi bsgom zhes zer te /
translated: Some say that in the state of the supreme vehicle, one should not cultivate anything at all, such as existence and nonexistence.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that we say:

original: de nyid kyi dbu ma la yod med du bsgom pa med par smras pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dbu ma la yod med du bsgom pa med par smras pa yin te /
translated: In the Madhyamaka, it is said that there is no cultivation of existence and nonexistence.

original: dbu ma la ni theg pa mchog dang mchog ma yin par phye ba ni chos gang la yang med do //
analyzed: dbu ma la ni theg pa mchog dang mchog ma yin par phye ba ni chos gang la yang med do //
translated: In the Madhyamaka, there is no distinction of the supreme and non-supreme vehicle in any phenomenon.

original: kha cig na re khye'us khye'u dbyung ba'i tshul du zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: kha cig na re khye'us khye'u dbyung ba'i tshul du zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Some say that since it is said to be like a boy pulling out a boy,

original: sngon la med pa bsgom /
analyzed: sngon la med pa bsgom /
translated: one should first cultivate nonexistence,

original: de nas ci yang ma yin pa la bsgom zer te /
analyzed: de nas ci yang ma yin pa la bsgom zer te /
translated: and then cultivate nothing at all.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that we say:

original: don dam pa bden pa la rim gyis 'jug pa'i phyir med pa bsgom pa la gsungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa bden pa la rim gyis 'jug pa'i phyir med pa bsgom pa la gsungs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not said that one meditates on non-existence in order to enter into ultimate truth gradually.

original: sgom pa'i rim pa dang por mdzad pa las nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sgom pa'i rim pa dang por mdzad pa las nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the paths of the Sravakas, etc. in the first stage of meditation

original: gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs nas /
analyzed: gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs nas /
translated: is intended as an introduction,

original: khye'us khye'u dbyung ba bzhin du bstan par zad do //
analyzed: khye'us khye'u dbyung ba bzhin du bstan par zad do //
translated: like the drawing of a boy by a boy.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag ni phung po la sogs pa chos tsam du zad de bdag med par bsgoms pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag ni phung po la sogs pa chos tsam du zad de bdag med par bsgoms pas /
translated: Thus, these are only dharmas such as aggregates, etc. , and one meditates on their selflessness.

original: nyan thos gang zag la bdag med pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: nyan thos gang zag la bdag med pa la 'jug go //
translated: The Sravaka enters into the selflessness of the person.

original: khams gsum rnam par shes pa tsam du bsgoms pas /
analyzed: khams gsum rnam par shes pa tsam du bsgoms pas /
translated: Meditating on the three realms as only consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa smra ba'i phyir don med pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa smra ba'i phyir don med pa la 'jug go //
translated: he enters into the non-existence of objects, because consciousness is said to exist.

original: tshul 'dis ni gnyis su med pa'i shes pa de yang bdag med pa nyid du 'jug pas bdag med pa nyid mchog la zhugs pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshul 'dis ni gnyis su med pa'i shes pa de yang bdag med pa nyid du 'jug pas bdag med pa nyid mchog la zhugs pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: By this method, he enters into the selflessness of that non-dual consciousness, and so he enters into the highest selflessness.

original: de lta bas na de lta bu la khye'us khye'u dbyung ba'i tshul du gsungs pa las /🔽dbu ma ba sgom @246a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na de lta bu la khye'us khye'u dbyung ba'i tshul du gsungs pa las / dbu ma ba sgom @246a * //
translated: Therefore, it is taught in that way, like a boy pulling out a boy.🔽The Madhyamaka

original: pa la med pa bsgom pas rigs kyi 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: pa la med pa bsgom pas rigs kyi 'jug pa ni /
translated: The Madhyamaka meditation on the absence of intrinsic existence is the opposite of the meditation on the middle way.

original: bka' dang bstan bcos mtha' dag las mi srid do //
analyzed: bka' dang bstan bcos mtha' dag las mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible according to all the scriptures and treatises.

original: kha cig na re dbu ma pa ni mtha' rnams spangs nas dbus la bsgom ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re dbu ma pa ni mtha' rnams spangs nas dbus la bsgom ste /
translated: Some say that the Madhyamaka abandons the extremes and meditates on the middle.

original: des ni chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin bsgom pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des ni chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin bsgom pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not the meditation on the nature of reality as it is.

original: des ni gsang sngags na legs par yod do //🔽zhes zer te /
analyzed: des ni gsang sngags na legs par yod do // zhes zer te /
translated: That is well established in the secret mantra.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that, I say:

original: gsang sngags ni dgag pa mi byed mod kyi /
analyzed: gsang sngags ni dgag pa mi byed mod kyi /
translated: The secret mantra does not make negations.

original: 'on kyang dbu ma ni dbus la mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang dbu ma ni dbus la mi gnas pa ste /
translated: However, the Madhyamaka does not abide in the middle.

original: 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las /
analyzed: 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las /
translated: As the noble King of Samādhi Sūtra teaches:

original: yod ces med ces gnyi ga mtha' //
analyzed: yod ces med ces gnyi ga mtha' //
translated: Existence and nonexistence are both extremes.

original: dag dang ma dag gnyi ga mtha' //
analyzed: dag dang ma dag gnyi ga mtha' //
translated: Purity and impurity are both extremes.

original: de bas de gnyis rab spangs nas //
analyzed: de bas de gnyis rab spangs nas //
translated: Therefore, having abandoned those two,

original: mkhas pa dbus la 'ang gnas mi byed //🔽ces gsungs te /
analyzed: mkhas pa dbus la 'ang gnas mi byed //🔽ces gsungs te /
translated: the wise do not abide even in the middle.

original: de ni dbu ma'i mkhan po rnams kyis dbu ma'i bstan bcos kun tu drangs so //
analyzed: de ni dbu ma'i mkhan po rnams kyis dbu ma'i bstan bcos kun tu drangs so //
translated: This is cited in all the Madhyamaka treatises by the masters of the Madhyamaka.

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis kyang /
translated: Ārya Nāgārjuna also says:

original: rigs pa drug cu pa las /🔽gang blo yod dang med pa las //
analyzed: rigs pa drug cu pa las / gang blo yod dang med pa las //
translated: In the Yuktiṣaṣṭikā,🔽Those whose minds transcend existence and nonexistence

analyzed: de la smras pa /

translated: In the noble Descent into Laṅkā,

translated: “After my nirvāṇa,

analyzed: yod dang med pa'i phyogs 'jig cing //

original: bla med theg chen rab bshad de //
analyzed: bla med theg chen rab bshad de //
translated: The unsurpassed Great Vehicle will be well explained,

original: rab tu dga' ba'i sa bsgrubs pas //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i sa bsgrubs pas //
translated: and having accomplished the ground of Supreme Joy,

original: bde ba can gyi zhing du 'gro //
analyzed: bde ba can gyi zhing du 'gro //

original: tshul rnams 'dzin par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: tshul rnams 'dzin par 'gyur ba ste //

analyzed: blo gros chen po khyod shes byos //

translated: This is a prophecy that the destruction of the positions of existence and nonexistence and the explanation of the Great Vehicle just as it is will occur and that the former masters such as Kamalaśīla

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gsal bar mdzad pa zhes gsungs pa las /

original: ci la 'khrul /
analyzed: ci la 'khrul /

original: 'on te sems skye ba med par ston pas stong pa skad du bya na /🔽'o na ni sems tsam bsgom pa yin pas grub pa'i mtha' rim gyis drang pa'i ched du bstan pa la dad pa yin pas bden te /

translated: But if you say that it is called emptiness because it teaches that the mind is not produced,🔽then since you are meditating on the mind only, you are teaching the tenets gradually in order to lead [students].

original: re zhig gzhag go /
analyzed: re zhig gzhag go /

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /

analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi dgongs pa'i rjes su 'jug ste / de ni sems yong med du mi bsgom mo zhe na /
translated: I follow the thought of the noble Nāgārjuna.🔽He does not meditate on the mind as nonexistent.

original: de sems don dam par yod med du ma grub pa la zer ram /
analyzed: de sems don dam par yod med du ma grub pa la zer ram /

analyzed: 'on te phyi ma yin na ni /

analyzed: med pa ma grub pa la zer ram /

analyzed: 'on te kun rdzob tu yang med pa de bka' dang bstan bcos las kyang ma gsungs la /

analyzed: med pa de la nor pa dang / ma nor ba yang brtsir mi 'dod de mo gsham gyi bu'i sems bzhin no //
translated: And it is not acceptable to count as either mistaken or non-mistaken that which does not exist, just like the son of a barren woman.

original: de lta bas na don dam par ni sems stong par lta na /
analyzed: de lta bas na don dam par ni sems stong par lta na /
translated: Thus, if one sees the mind as empty in the ultimate sense,

original: de yang sgro 'dogs pa yin la /🔽yod par lta na de yang sgro 'dogs pa yin cing yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin par ltar /
analyzed: de yang sgro 'dogs pa yin la / yod par lta na de yang sgro 'dogs pa yin cing yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin par ltar /

original: de yang sgro 'dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang sgro 'dogs pa yin te /
translated: If one sees it as neither existent nor nonexistent, that is also reification.

original: zag pa med par bltas kyang sgro 'dogs @247a * //🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med par bltas kyang sgro 'dogs @247a * // pa yin no //
translated: If one sees it as uncontaminated, that is also reification.

analyzed: ye nas rnam par dag ces bya ba yang chos la dgongs nas gsungs pa las /
translated: It is also said that “it is pure from the beginning,” but that is said with reference to the ultimate,

original: chos can la dgongs nas gsungs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos can la dgongs nas gsungs pa ni ma yin te /

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: In the noble Descent into Laṅkā,

analyzed: blo gros chen pos zhus pa la bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo gzhan brjod pa las /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po gsungs pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rnam par dag pas thog ma nas rnam par dag pa nyid mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa sems can rnams kyi lus kyi nang na mchis par brjod de
translated: The Tathāgata Essence Sūtra says that the Tathāgata’s nature is naturally luminous, pure from the beginning, endowed with the thirty-two excellent marks, and present within the bodies of sentient beings.

original: / bcom ldan 'das kyi rin po che rin thang chen po gos dri ma can gyis yongs su dkris pa ltar /
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das kyi rin po che rin thang chen po gos dri ma can gyis yongs su dkris pa ltar /
translated: The Bhagavān says that just as a very valuable jewel is completely wrapped in dirty rags,

analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi gos kyis yongs su dkris pa /

analyzed: 'di mu stegs byed kyi bdag tu smra ba dang ji ltar mi 'dra ba lags /
translated: Bhagavān, how is what is called the Tathāgata Essence different from the self propounded by the tīrthikas?

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mu stegs byed rnams kyang rtag pa byed pa /
translated: Bhagavān, the tīrthikas also teach a self that is permanent,

analyzed: yon tan byed pa /
translated: an agent,

analyzed: khyad par mi 'jog pa'o // zhes bdag smra ba ston par bgyid do // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: and without distinctions.”

analyzed: blo gros chen po nga'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa ni mu stegs kyi bdag tu smra ba dang mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Mahāmati, my teaching of the tathāgatagarbha is not the same as the tīrthikas’ teaching of a self.

analyzed: blo gros chen po de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni stong pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: Mahāmati, the tathāgatas, arhats, and samyaksaṃbuddhas, in order to teach the meaning of the words emptiness, the perfect limit, nirvāṇa, non-arising, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa la sogs pa'i tshig gi don rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por bstan pa byas nas /
analyzed: smon pa med pa la sogs pa'i tshig gi don rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por bstan pa byas nas /
translated: wishlessness, and so on, have taught the tathāgatagarbha.

analyzed: byis pa rnams bdag med pas 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i gnas rnam par spang ba'i don du /
translated: In order to cause the childish to abandon the view of a self and the fear of selflessness,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i sgo bstan pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas snang ba med pa'i spyod yul ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i sgo bstan pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas snang ba med pa'i spyod yul ston te /
translated: By teaching the gateway to the Tathagata essence, he teaches the nonconceptual state, the domain of nonappearance.

original: 'di la blo gros chen po ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis bdag tu @247b mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la blo gros chen po ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis bdag tu @247b mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: In this regard, Mahamati, future and present bodhisattva mahasattvas should not cling to a self.

analyzed: blo gros chen po dper na rdza mkhan ni 'jim pa'i rdul gyi phung po gcig las lag pa dang / bzo dang / lag gzung dang / chu dang / srad bu dang / nan tan dang ldan pa las snod rnam pa sna tshogs byed do //
translated: Mahamati, for example, a potter, from a single lump of clay, by means of his knowledge, hands, tools, a rope, water, and effort, makes various kinds of vessels.

original: blo gros chen po de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang chos la bdag med pa rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad rnam par log pa de nyid shes rab dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang / ldan pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por bstan pa'am /
analyzed: blo gros chen po de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang chos la bdag med pa rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad rnam par log pa de nyid shes rab dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang / ldan pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por bstan pa'am /
translated: “Mahāmati, the tathāgatas, too, with their wisdom and skill in means, teach the suchness of the selflessness of phenomena, the reversal of all conceptual characteristics, as the tathāgatagarbha,

original: bdag med par bstan pas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: bdag med par bstan pas kyang rung ste /
translated: or as selflessness.

original: rdza mkhan bzhin du tshig dang yi ge'i rnam grangs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bstan te /
analyzed: rdza mkhan bzhin du tshig dang yi ge'i rnam grangs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bstan te /
translated: Like a potter, they teach with various terms and expressions.

original: des na de'i phyir blo gros chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa mu stegs byed kyi bdag tu smra ba'i bstan pa dang mi 'dra'o //
analyzed: des na de'i phyir blo gros chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa mu stegs byed kyi bdag tu smra ba'i bstan pa dang mi 'dra'o //
translated: Therefore, Mahāmati, the teaching of the tathāgatagarbha is not the same as the tīrthikas’ teaching of self.

original: blo gros chen po de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni mu stegs byed kyi bdag tu smra ba la mngon par zhen pa rnam grangs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ston te /🔽yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bdag tu rnam par rtog pa'i lta ba ltung ba'i bsam pa can dag rnam par thar pa gsum gyi spyod yul la gnas pa bsam pa dang ldan zhing myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par
analyzed: blo gros chen po de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni mu stegs byed kyi bdag tu smra ba la mngon par zhen pa rnam grangs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ston te / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bdag tu rnam par rtog pa'i lta ba ltung ba'i bsam pa can dag rnam par thar pa gsum gyi spyod yul la gnas pa bsam pa dang ldan zhing myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par
translated: Mahāmati, in this way, the tathāgatas teach the essence of the tathāgata in order to cause those who are attached to the tīrthikas’ assertions of self to enter into the tathāgatas’ essence.

original: 'tshang rgya bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'tshang rgya bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that those who have the intention to fall into the view that conceives of an unreal self will quickly awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment, endowed with the intention to abide in the domain of the three liberations?

original: blo gros chen po de'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ston pa mdzad do //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ston pa mdzad do //
translated: Mahāmati, it is for that purpose that the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly complete buddhas teach the essence of the tathāgata.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni mu stegs byed bdag tu smra ba dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni mu stegs byed bdag tu smra ba dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not the same as the tīrthikas’ assertion of a self.

original: blo gros chen po de lta bas na mu stegs byed kyi lta ba rnam par zlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: blo gros chen po de lta bas na mu stegs byed kyi lta ba rnam par zlog pa'i phyir /
translated: Mahāmati, therefore, in order to reverse the views of the tīrthikas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bdag med pa'i rjes su 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bdag med pa'i rjes su 'jug par bya'o //
translated: you should follow the tathāgatagarbha, which is without a self.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: chos stong pa nyid dang / skye ba med pa dang / gnyis ma yin pa dang / rang bzhin med par bstan pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' bla na med pa'o zhes gsungs so //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa la log par rtog pa ni kha cig na re don dam pa'i bden pa ni cir yang ma grub pas shes pa snga ma bas gsal ba cig kho na @248a * //
analyzed: chos stong pa nyid dang / skye ba med pa dang / gnyis ma yin pa dang / rang bzhin med par bstan pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' bla na med pa'o zhes gsungs so // de bzhin gshegs pa la log par rtog pa ni kha cig na re don dam pa'i bden pa ni cir yang ma grub pas shes pa snga ma bas gsal ba cig kho na @248a * //
translated: This teaching on the emptiness, nonarising, nonduality, and essencelessness of phenomena is the unexcelled philosophy of the bodhisattvas.”

original: bsgom mo zhes zer te /
analyzed: bsgom mo zhes zer te /
translated: Some say that since the ultimate truth is not established as anything at all, it is cultivated as a mere clarity that is more vivid than the previous cognition.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that we say:

original: gang shes pa la dmigs pa de ni don dam pa'i bden pa bsgom pa yin te /
analyzed: gang shes pa la dmigs pa de ni don dam pa'i bden pa bsgom pa yin te /
translated: That which is the object of cognition is the cultivation of the ultimate truth.

original: dper na yid kyi rnam shes chos kyi skye mched 'dus byas bzhi'i yul can lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na yid kyi rnam shes chos kyi skye mched 'dus byas bzhi'i yul can lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the mental consciousness is the subject of four of the conditioned sense-spheres of factors.

original: rnam 'byor pa 'di yang shes pa snga ma bas gsal ba la dmigs pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam 'byor pa 'di yang shes pa snga ma bas gsal ba la dmigs pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But this yogi does not have the contradictory observation of a more evident object than the previous consciousness.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa mi bsgom pas ni so so'i skye bo sa las 'da' bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa mi bsgom pas ni so so'i skye bo sa las 'da' bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one does not cultivate the ultimate truth, one will not transcend the stage of ordinary person.

original: spros pas chog go //
analyzed: spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this elaboration!

original: kha cig na re rang rig pa gcig pa kho na bsgom zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re rang rig pa gcig pa kho na bsgom zhes zer te /
translated: Some say that one should only cultivate the single reflexive awareness.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that, we reply:

original: bdag nyid rig pa yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag nyid rig pa yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is self-aware,

original: sems spyod yul du gyur pa'i shes //
analyzed: sems spyod yul du gyur pa'i shes //
translated: The consciousness that is the object of the mind

original: rnam par dag pa'ang yang dag tu //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'ang yang dag tu //
translated: Is also truly pure.

original: rigs sam 'on te mi rigs sam //
analyzed: rigs sam 'on te mi rigs sam //
translated: Is that logical or not?

original: zhes bya bas sun dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas sun dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: This should be refuted with that verse.

original: kha cig na re rang rig pa las bsgom pa zhes ji skad bya /
analyzed: kha cig na re rang rig pa las bsgom pa zhes ji skad bya /
translated: Some say: How can it be called cultivation of reflexive awareness?

original: shes pa gzhan cig rigs par bya ste /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan cig rigs par bya ste /
translated: Another consciousness should be logically posited.

original: de bas na chos nyid kho na rig par bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: de bas na chos nyid kho na rig par bya'o zhes zer te /
translated: Therefore, only reality should be known.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this it is replied:

original: 'o na ni gnyis su rtog pa'i phyir chos nyid bsgom pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni gnyis su rtog pa'i phyir chos nyid bsgom pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is so, then it is not meditation on reality because of the conception of duality,

original: bum pa dang de 'dzin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa dang de 'dzin pa bzhin no //
translated: like a pot and its holder.

original: de bas na de gnyi gal /
analyzed: de bas na de gnyi gal /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: shes bya med phyir gzhan rig min //
analyzed: shes bya med phyir gzhan rig min //
translated: Since there is no object of cognition, there is no cognition of other.

original: gnyis su med phyir bdag rig min //
analyzed: gnyis su med phyir bdag rig min //
translated: Since there is no duality, there is no cognition of self.

original: gal te brtags na yang dag min //
analyzed: gal te brtags na yang dag min //
translated: If it is imagined, it is not real.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun phyung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun phyung ngo //
translated: and so on.

original: kha cig na re shes pa rig pa med pa cig kho na bsgom mo zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re shes pa rig pa med pa cig kho na bsgom mo zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: One meditates on consciousness alone, which is without awareness.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this it is replied:

original: des ni mu stegs dpyod pa pa'i lta ba khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: des ni mu stegs dpyod pa pa'i lta ba khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: By that, one accepts the view of the Tīrthika Mīmāṃsaka.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: For it is said:

original: shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi rang rig pa yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi rang rig pa yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: “Not only is consciousness not with aspects, it is also not reflexive awareness.”

original: de ni rnal 'byor par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni rnal 'byor par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could that be a yogin?

original: spros pas chog go //
analyzed: spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this elaboration!

original: kha cig na re mnyam par bzhag pas yul du byed pa kho na'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re mnyam par bzhag pas yul du byed pa kho na'o zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: It is only by being in equipoise that one takes it as an object.

original: de las smras pa /
analyzed: de las smras pa /
translated: To this it is replied:

original: gang yul du byed pa de ni don dam pa'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yul du byed pa de ni don dam pa'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: That which takes it as an object is not a subject of the ultimate,

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, the visual consciousness.

original: rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa 'di yang yul du byed pas rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa 'di yang yul du byed pas rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: Since this consciousness of the yogi takes it as an object, it is a perception of a contradictory nature.

original: kha cig na re yul du mi byed pa kho na yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re yul du mi byed pa kho na yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: It does not take it as an object at all.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that it is said:

original: gang de kho na yul du ye mi byed pa de ni kho na mthong bar @248b mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang de kho na yul du ye mi byed pa de ni kho na mthong bar @248b mi 'gyur te /
translated: That which never takes reality as an object does not see reality at all,

original: dper na mi tha mal pa'i shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mi tha mal pa'i shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, the consciousness of an ordinary person.

original: rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa 'di yang de kho na ye yul du ye mi byed pas khyab par byed pa'i mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa 'di yang de kho na ye yul du ye mi byed pas khyab par byed pa'i mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Since this consciousness of the yogi never takes reality as an object, it is a nonperception of a pervader.

original: kha cig na re rtsol ba byas na chos nyid dang 'gal te ye mi bcos par gzhag ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re rtsol ba byas na chos nyid dang 'gal te ye mi bcos par gzhag ste /
translated: Some say: If one makes effort, it contradicts reality, so one should rest without modifying it at all.

original: ma brtsal bar bzhag na bsgom par 'gyur /
analyzed: ma brtsal bar bzhag na bsgom par 'gyur /
translated: If one rests without making effort, it becomes meditation.

original: zhes 'byung bas go ba tsam gyis chog zer te /
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas go ba tsam gyis chog zer te /
translated: Since this is stated, mere understanding is sufficient.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that it is said:

original: mngon sum dang 'gal ba kun tu spyod pa chu yod par go bas skom pa sel bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: mngon sum dang 'gal ba kun tu spyod pa chu yod par go bas skom pa sel bar 'gyur ram /
translated: One should reply, Would one be able to quench one's thirst by knowing that there is water, without actually drinking it?

original: zas yod par go bas bkres pa sel lam zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: zas yod par go bas bkres pa sel lam zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan gdab par bya'o //
translated: Or would one be able to satisfy one's hunger by knowing that there is food, without actually eating it?

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs su lhan ne 'dug bzhin du rtsol ba skyon du 'gyur ba la dgongs nas gsungs pa ma go bar tshig gi rjes su 'brang nas smra ba yin te /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs su lhan ne 'dug bzhin du rtsol ba skyon du 'gyur ba la dgongs nas gsungs pa ma go bar tshig gi rjes su 'brang nas smra ba yin te /
translated: One should reply, You have not understood the intention of the statement that effort is a fault in the context of meditative concentration. You are just following the words.

original: bde bar gshegs pas ni /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas ni /
translated: The Sugata

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: has said in the Perfection of Wisdom

original: sems g-yengs pa la ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan bskyed pa yang dkon na /
analyzed: sems g-yengs pa la ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan bskyed pa yang dkon na /
translated: that it is difficult for one whose mind is distracted to generate even the mundane meditative concentrations,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsam gtan lta ci smos de bas na sems bskyed ma thag nas mi g-yengs par bya'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsam gtan lta ci smos de bas na sems bskyed ma thag nas mi g-yengs par bya'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: let alone the supramundane ones. Therefore, one should not be distracted from the moment the mind is generated.

original: kha cig na re mngon sum bsgom mo zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re mngon sum bsgom mo zhes zer te /
translated: Some say, We cultivate meditative concentration directly.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To them we reply,

original: dbang po'i mngon sum ni dngos po'i yul can yin pas de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i mngon sum ni dngos po'i yul can yin pas de ni ma yin no //
translated: The direct perception of the sense faculties is not that, because it has a real object.

original: yid kyi mngon sum ni de dang skad cig gcig la 'jog par byed pas mi srid do //
analyzed: yid kyi mngon sum ni de dang skad cig gcig la 'jog par byed pas mi srid do //
translated: The direct perception of the mental faculty is not that, because it is impossible for it to be established in one moment.

original: rang rig pa ni bems po las log pa tsam yin pas de mi srid do //
analyzed: rang rig pa ni bems po las log pa tsam yin pas de mi srid do //
translated: Self-awareness is not that, because it is merely the opposite of matter.

original: rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum 'jig rten pa'i sa ni mi srid do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum 'jig rten pa'i sa ni mi srid do //
translated: The direct perception of yoga is not that, because it is impossible on the worldly level.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa yin na ni 'phags pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas sun dbyung ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa yin na ni 'phags pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas sun dbyung ngo //
translated: If it is supramundane, it would follow that it is ārya.

original: kha cig na re nga la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i man ngag yod de /
analyzed: kha cig na re nga la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i man ngag yod de /
translated: Some say, “I have the esoteric instructions of the inconceivable.

original: de las blo gnas pa ni mi tha mal ba'i shes pa ngal dum ma khyer ba'i shes pa lhang nge ba cig yod pa de ni 'dra ba de bsgom pa yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: de las blo gnas pa ni mi tha mal ba'i shes pa ngal dum ma khyer ba'i shes pa lhang nge ba cig yod pa de ni 'dra ba de bsgom pa yin no zhes zer te /
translated: The mind that is placed in that is the ordinary mind of a normal person. The mind that is carried along a little is the vivid mind. That is the meditation on suchness.”

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that I say:

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa bya ba de ci la bya /🔽gal te sems sam /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa bya ba de ci la bya / gal te sems sam /
translated: What is the inconceivable that is to be done?🔽If it is the mind,

original: gal te sems kyi chos nyid de la zer te /
analyzed: gal te sems kyi chos nyid de la zer te /
translated: or if it is the dharmatā of the mind,

original: de gsang sngags na yod pa yin te /🔽mdo sde 'am /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa nas de mi ston te /
analyzed: de gsang sngags na yod pa yin te / mdo sde 'am / pha rol tu phyin pa nas de mi ston te /
translated: This is found in the secret mantra.🔽It is not taught in the sutras

original: chos @249a * //
analyzed: chos @249a * //
translated: or in the perfection vehicle.🔽The sutras merely posit that all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic existence,

original: thams cad rang bzhin med bya ba tsam la 'jog pa las rang gi sems kyi chos nyid yin par ni mi 'jog go zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad rang bzhin med bya ba tsam la 'jog pa las rang gi sems kyi chos nyid yin par ni mi 'jog go zhe na /
translated: but they do not posit that the ultimate reality of one’s mind is the ultimate reality of all phenomena.

original: gsang sngags la ni dgag pa mi byed mod kyi /
analyzed: gsang sngags la ni dgag pa mi byed mod kyi /
translated: The secret mantra does not deny this,

original: 'on kyang de ni mdo las kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni mdo las kyang gsungs te /
translated: but it does teach it.

original: chos thams cad dmigs su med cing sems pa med pa rin po che brtsegs pa bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su med cing sems pa med pa rin po che brtsegs pa bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Sutra Teaching the Inconceivable Dharma of the Tathagatas states:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'jam dpal la smras pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'jam dpal la smras pa /
translated: The tathagata said to Manjushri:

original: 'jam dpal bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba de gang yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba de gang yin /
translated: “Manjushri, what is meant by the ‘inconceivable realm’?🔽”

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol ba /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol ba /
translated: Manjushri replied:

original: bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zhes bgyi ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zhes bgyi ba ni /
translated: “Bhagavat, the ‘inconceivable realm’

original: dbyings gang sems ma mchis pa /
analyzed: dbyings gang sems ma mchis pa /
translated: is the realm that is not mind,

original: sems grol bar bgyi ba ma lags pa /
analyzed: sems grol bar bgyi ba ma lags pa /
translated: that is not liberated by the mind,

original: sems dgag par bgyi ba ma lags pa bsam pas rab tu dbye ba bgyi ba ma lags mod kyi /
analyzed: sems dgag par bgyi ba ma lags pa bsam pas rab tu dbye ba bgyi ba ma lags mod kyi /
translated: It is not that the mind is to be stopped, nor is it to be differentiated by thought.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das sems nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags so //
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das sems nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags so //
translated: Nevertheless, Blessed One, the mind itself is the inconceivable realm.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems la sems ma mchis pa lags kyis /
analyzed: sems la sems ma mchis pa lags kyis /
translated: Because the mind is devoid of mind.

original: sems nyid sems ma lags pas sems ni ngo bo nyid kyis ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: sems nyid sems ma lags pas sems ni ngo bo nyid kyis ma mchis pa'o //
translated: Since the mind itself is not mind, the mind does not exist by its own intrinsic reality.

original: sems ji lta ba bzhin pas sems ma mchis pa nyid sems lags te //
analyzed: sems ji lta ba bzhin pas sems ma mchis pa nyid sems lags te //
translated: Since the mind is just as it is, the absence of mind is the mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags so zhes gsungs te /
translated: Blessed One, this is the inconceivable realm.

original: de ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dbu ma'i khungs yin te /
analyzed: de ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dbu ma'i khungs yin te /
translated: This is the source of the Yogācāra Madhyamaka.

original: bye brag med do //🔽'on kyang sems tha mal ba'i sems de lta bu ni lung du ma bstan pa'i sems yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bye brag med do // 'on kyang sems tha mal ba'i sems de lta bu ni lung du ma bstan pa'i sems yin pa'i phyir /
translated: There is no difference.🔽Nevertheless, such an ordinary mind is a neutral mind,

original: chos nyid bsgom pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos nyid bsgom pa ma yin no //
translated: and therefore it is not the meditation on reality.

original: kha cig na re rang gi kun gzhi byang chub kyi sems dus gsum du 'dus ma byas pa mi 'gyur ba rtag pa de ngo shes na /
analyzed: kha cig na re rang gi kun gzhi byang chub kyi sems dus gsum du 'dus ma byas pa mi 'gyur ba rtag pa de ngo shes na /
translated: Some say: If one recognizes one’s own ground-of-all, the mind of enlightenment, which is uncompounded in the three times, unchanging, and permanent,

original: byang chub dang chos nyid la sogs pa de la zer bas /
analyzed: byang chub dang chos nyid la sogs pa de la zer bas /
translated: that is called enlightenment, the nature of reality, and so forth.

original: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa ltar ha cang ches gsang sngags zab mo nas kyang mi ston to //
analyzed: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa ltar ha cang ches gsang sngags zab mo nas kyang mi ston to //
translated: That is not taught even in the profound Secret Mantra Vehicle, which is much more secret than the Perfection Vehicle.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yin /🔽bstan pa'i snying po yin pas de rtag go //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yin / bstan pa'i snying po yin pas de rtag go //
translated: This is the essence of the Tathāgata,

original: zhes zer te /
analyzed: zhes zer te /
translated: the essence of the teachings, and therefore it is permanent.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that I say:

original: gsang sngags pa ni dgag pa mi byed mod kyi /
analyzed: gsang sngags pa ni dgag pa mi byed mod kyi /
translated: The Secret Mantra Vehicle does not deny that.

original: 'on kyang rim gyis drang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang rim gyis drang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: However, in order to gradually lead people,

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: the noble Sutra on Entering Lanka

original: theg pa gsum du @249b yang gsungs pa //
analyzed: theg pa gsum du @249b yang gsungs pa //
translated: teaches the three vehicles.

original: ji srid 'du shes yod kyi bar //
analyzed: ji srid 'du shes yod kyi bar //
translated: As long as there are conceptual thoughts,

original: theg pa'i mtha' la thug pa med //
analyzed: theg pa'i mtha' la thug pa med //
translated: there is no end to the vehicles.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa yang gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa yang gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: yang sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: yang sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las /
translated: Also, the Array of Stalks Sutra says:

original: theg pa bcu bzhi gsungs pa la /
analyzed: theg pa bcu bzhi gsungs pa la /
translated: The fourteen vehicles are taught.

original: nges pa'i don du ni theg pa gcig las med par gsungs chos kyi dbyings gcig las med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i don du ni theg pa gcig las med par gsungs chos kyi dbyings gcig las med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the definitive meaning, there is only one vehicle, because there is only one basic element of phenomena.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As is said:

original: 'dus pa chen po'i le'u las /
analyzed: 'dus pa chen po'i le'u las /
translated: In the Chapter of the Great Assembly:

original: theg pa gcig tu yang dag par 'du ba ni theg pa thams cad theg pa gcig tu mnyam pa nyid du yang dag par 'du ste /
analyzed: theg pa gcig tu yang dag par 'du ba ni theg pa thams cad theg pa gcig tu mnyam pa nyid du yang dag par 'du ste /
translated: The perfect inclusion in one vehicle is the perfect inclusion of all vehicles in the equality of one vehicle.

original: chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa la 'jug par tshul gcig go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa la 'jug par tshul gcig go zhes gsungs so //
translated: The single method is the entry into the indivisible basic element of phenomena.

original: de lta bas na chos nyid la dgongs pa'i dbang gis sems nyid ye nas rnam par dag pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na chos nyid la dgongs pa'i dbang gis sems nyid ye nas rnam par dag pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the intention is the nature of phenomena, and the mind itself is taught to be primordially pure.

original: blo gros chen pos zhus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: blo gros chen pos zhus pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the request of Mahāmati.

original: de ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dbu ma pas yang 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dbu ma pas yang 'dod do //
translated: That is also asserted by the Yogācāra-Mādhyamikas.

original: bye brag med do //
analyzed: bye brag med do //
translated: There is no difference.

original: 'on te nged 'dus ma byas su rtog /
analyzed: 'on te nged 'dus ma byas su rtog /
translated: If you think that we are unconditioned,

original: dbu ma pa ni de lam 'dod pa byed par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: dbu ma pa ni de lam 'dod pa byed par yod do zhe na /
translated: the Mādhyamika asserts that the path is the existence of the doer.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal rnam par 'phrul pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal rnam par 'phrul pa las /
translated: In the Noble Descent into Laṅkā:

original: 'dus ma byas la gang rtog dang // mya ngan 'das la gang rtog pa //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la gang rtog dang // mya ngan 'das la gang rtog pa //
translated: and whoever conceives of nirvana,

original: gnyi ga bdud kyi spyod yul yin //
analyzed: gnyi ga bdud kyi spyod yul yin //
translated: both are in the domain of Mara.

original: de ni mkhas pa rnams kyis bshad //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni mkhas pa rnams kyis bshad // ces gsungs so //
translated: This is explained by the wise.

original: 'on te chos can rang de ltar yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te chos can rang de ltar yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the subject is just like that,

original: mu stegs rig byed kyi mtha' gsang bar smra ba khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: mu stegs rig byed kyi mtha' gsang bar smra ba khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: then you accept the secret teaching of the Vedanta of the tirthikas.

original: de dag ni 'di skad ces /
analyzed: de dag ni 'di skad ces /
translated: They say this:

original: bdud rtsi'i thigs pa gsang ba las bstan pa /
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i thigs pa gsang ba las bstan pa /
translated: It is taught in the Secret Drop of Nectar:🔽Mere consciousness is always pure,

original: rnam rig tsam ni rtag tu rnam par dag /'di ltar sangs rgyas rtag tu 'gro ba yin ;
analyzed: rnam rig tsam ni rtag tu rnam par dag /'di ltar sangs rgyas rtag tu 'gro ba yin ;
translated: and thus the Buddha is always in the world.

original: / blang dang dor ba med ces rab brtag pa //🔽tshangs pa mya ngan med ces rta ga gnas byos //
analyzed: / blang dang dor ba med ces rab brtag pa // tshangs pa mya ngan med ces rta ga gnas byos //
translated: It is imagined that there is no accepting or rejecting.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Brahma is said to be in a state of no sorrow.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa ma go bar tshig tsam gyis gzhan la rlom par byar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa ma go bar tshig tsam gyis gzhan la rlom par byar mi 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, without understanding the intention of the Tathagata, it is not acceptable to be arrogant about the mere words.

original: spros pas chog go //
analyzed: spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough with this elaboration.

original: kha cig na re ci la yang mi rtog mod kyi /
analyzed: kha cig na re ci la yang mi rtog mod kyi /
translated: Some say: We do not conceive of anything at all.

original: 'on kyang don dam pa byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang don dam pa byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa yin te /
translated: However, it is the cultivation of ultimate bodhicitta.

original: byang chub ni spros pa dang bral ba nam mkha' lta bu yin la /
analyzed: byang chub ni spros pa dang bral ba nam mkha' lta bu yin la /
translated: Enlightenment is like space, free from conceptual elaborations.

original: de las sems dpas don dam pa byang chub kyi bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de las sems dpas don dam pa byang chub kyi bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The one who cultivates that is called a bodhisattva.

original: de skad du /🔽byang chub nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: de skad du / byang chub nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: As it is said:
Enlightenment has the characteristic of space,

original: tu rtog pa thams cad spangs //
analyzed: tu rtog pa thams cad spangs //
translated: free from all conceptual thought.

original: gang zhig de rtogs 'dod pa ni //
analyzed: gang zhig de rtogs 'dod pa ni //
translated: One who wishes to realize that

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o // zhes gsungs te /
translated: is called a bodhisattva.

original: de dbu ma ba la med do zhes zer na /
analyzed: de dbu ma ba la med do zhes zer na /
translated: If you say that this is not the case for Madhyamikas,

original: de la smras pa /🔽ngo bo'i sgo nas smra'am /
analyzed: de la smras pa / ngo bo'i sgo nas smra'am /
translated: we reply:🔽Are you speaking from the perspective of the essence of enlightenment,

original: brtags nas smra /
analyzed: brtags nas smra /
translated: or are you speaking after analysis?

original: gong ma ltar ro zhe na /
analyzed: gong ma ltar ro zhe na /
translated: If it is the former,

original: 'o na ni 'phags par khas blangs pas re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: 'o na ni 'phags par khas blangs pas re zhig gzhag go //
translated: then you have accepted that you are an ārya, and so we will leave it at that.

original: 'on te brtags pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te brtags pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is the latter,

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: we reply:

original: dbu ma pa yang de 'dod de /
analyzed: dbu ma pa yang de 'dod de /
translated: Madhyamikas also accept that.

original: slob dpon ka ma la sh'i las don dam pa byang chub kyi sems de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa spros pa'i mtha' dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs gsungs te /
analyzed: slob dpon ka ma la sh'i las don dam pa byang chub kyi sems de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa spros pa'i mtha' dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs gsungs te /
translated: Master Kamalaśīla says, “That ultimate thought of awakening is supramundane, free from the extremes of conceptual elaboration,” and so on.

original: de 'grub pa'i rgyu la yang rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang bral zhes gsungs pas bye brag med do //
analyzed: de 'grub pa'i rgyu la yang rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang bral zhes gsungs pas bye brag med do //
translated: Since he also says that the cause for accomplishing it is “free from investigation and analysis,” there is no difference.

original: kha cig na re thos pa'i dus su bsam pa byed pa de bsam pa'i shes rab yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re thos pa'i dus su bsam pa byed pa de bsam pa'i shes rab yin te /
translated: Some say, “When listening, one should contemplate; that is the wisdom of contemplation.

original: phyi nas zhi gnas la bslabs nas de phyin chad bsgom pa gcig pu yin no //🔽zhes zer te /
analyzed: phyi nas zhi gnas la bslabs nas de phyin chad bsgom pa gcig pu yin no // zhes zer te /
translated: Later, after training in śamatha, from then on it is solely meditation.”

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that I say:

original: sngar thos pa'i dus su bsam pa de ni thos pa'i grangs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: sngar thos pa'i dus su bsam pa de ni thos pa'i grangs su 'gro ste /
translated: The contemplation that occurs during the time of listening is counted as listening.

original: gzhan du na thos pa chud zos pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na thos pa chud zos pa yin no //
translated: Otherwise, listening would be wasted.

original: phyi nas kyang bsam dgos te /
analyzed: phyi nas kyang bsam dgos te /
translated: Later, one must also contemplate,

original: bsam pa'i shes rab kyi skabs su bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam pa'i shes rab kyi skabs su bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: as explained in the section on the wisdom of contemplation.

original: de bas na bsgom pa gcig pu byed pa yin zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na bsgom pa gcig pu byed pa yin zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable to say, “I will do only meditation.”

original: kha cig na re de la gnyis te /
analyzed: kha cig na re de la gnyis te /
translated: Some say: There are two:

original: so sor rtog pa'i lhag mthong bsgom pa dang // rnam par mi rtog pa'i lhag mthong bsgom pa'o //🔽zhes zer te /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i lhag mthong bsgom pa dang // rnam par mi rtog pa'i lhag mthong bsgom pa'o // zhes zer te /
translated: cultivating discerning insight and cultivating non discerning insight.

original: de la ni nyes pa med kyi /
analyzed: de la ni nyes pa med kyi /
translated: There is no fault in that explanation.

original: 'on kyang de so sor rtog pa'i lhag mthong de ni bsam pa'i shes rab tu bsdu ste ;
analyzed: 'on kyang de so sor rtog pa'i lhag mthong de ni bsam pa'i shes rab tu bsdu ste ;
translated: However, discerning insight is subsumed by the wisdom of contemplation.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: bsgom pa'i shes rab kyi lhag mthong gi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i shes rab kyi lhag mthong gi dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of discerning insight that is the wisdom of meditation,

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: the Arya Samdhinirmocana states:🔽Discerning insight arises from the cause of pure hearing and contemplation.

original: lhag mthong ni thos pa dang bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / slob dpon ka ma la sh'i las kyang /
analyzed: lhag mthong ni thos pa dang bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / slob dpon ka ma la sh'i las kyang /
translated: And Master Kamala§ila also says:

original: thos pa dang bsam pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi rtog pa gang yin pa de nyid bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis bsgom par bya ba bzhin du ma yin te /
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi rtog pa gang yin pa de nyid bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis bsgom par bya ba bzhin du ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is conceptualized by the wisdom arising from hearing and contemplation is not to be meditated upon by the wisdom arising from meditation.

original: rta dkyus kyis bstan nas rgyug pa bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rta dkyus kyis bstan nas rgyug pa bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is like a horse that is shown the course and then let loose.

original: kha cig na re rjes su dpag pa kho na bsgom mo zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re rjes su dpag pa kho na bsgom mo zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: Only inference is cultivated.

original: @250b de la smras pa /
analyzed: @250b de la smras pa /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i rgyun yin pas rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa zer ram /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i rgyun yin pas rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa zer ram /
translated: If it is a continuum of inference, is it called the knowledge of inference?

original: 'on te mnyam par gzhag pa na yang rtags la brtan nas yang yang skyed par byed /
analyzed: 'on te mnyam par gzhag pa na yang rtags la brtan nas yang yang skyed par byed /
translated: Or, even in equipoise, it is generated again and again, based on the reason.

original: phyi ma ltar yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyi ma ltar yin no zhe na /
translated: If the latter,

original: de bsgom zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: de bsgom zhes mi bya ste /
translated: it is not called cultivation,

original: bsam pa'i shes rab yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa'i shes rab yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the wisdom of reflection.

original: kha cig na re rtog pa med pa kho na bsgom mo zhes zer na /
analyzed: kha cig na re rtog pa med pa kho na bsgom mo zhes zer na /
translated: Some say: Only non-conception is cultivated.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: We reply:

original: de ni mi srid de /
analyzed: de ni mi srid de /
translated: That is impossible,

original: mngon sum yin par thal 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum yin par thal 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would follow that it is direct perception.

original: kha cig na re bsam pa'i shes rab kho nar goms par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re bsam pa'i shes rab kho nar goms par byed pa yin te /
translated: Some say: One makes habitual only the wisdom of reflection,

original: bsgom zhes bya ba ni sngar mthong ba goms par byed do//
analyzed: bsgom zhes bya ba ni sngar mthong ba goms par byed do//
translated: because cultivation is the habituation to what was previously seen,

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi rjes la bsgom pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi rjes la bsgom pa bzhin no //
translated: like the cultivation subsequent to the path of seeing.

original: da lta ni ma mthong bas bsgom zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: da lta ni ma mthong bas bsgom zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Now, since one does not see it, one should not say, “I am cultivating it.”

original: de bas na 'jig rten chos kyi mchog man chad bsam pa'i shes rab yin no zhes zer na de la smras pa /
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten chos kyi mchog man chad bsam pa'i shes rab yin no zhes zer na de la smras pa /
translated: Therefore, up to the supreme mundane right view, it is said that it is the wisdom of reflection.🔽To that, we reply:

original: bsam pa'i shes rab ni mi spong mod kyi /
analyzed: bsam pa'i shes rab ni mi spong mod kyi /
translated: We do not deny that it is the wisdom of reflection.

original: 'on kyang bsgom pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgom pa yang yod de /
translated: However, there is also cultivation.

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: In the noble Unraveling the Intent,

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi ting nge 'dzin gnyis ni 'jig rten chos kyi mchog man chad la gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi ting nge 'dzin gnyis ni 'jig rten chos kyi mchog man chad la gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is said that the two meditative stabilizations—with and without conceptualization—are up to the supreme mundane right view.

original: slob dpon ka ma la sh'i las kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon ka ma la sh'i las kyang /
translated: Also, the master Kamalaśīla says:

original: 'di ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar 'jug pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: 'di ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar 'jug pa'i lam ste /
translated: This is the path that unites serenity and insight,

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: which focuses on the images with and without conceptualization.

original: yang kha cig na re da lta rnam par mi rtog pa bsgom pa yang zhig gnas kho na bsgom pa yin te /
analyzed: yang kha cig na re da lta rnam par mi rtog pa bsgom pa yang zhig gnas kho na bsgom pa yin te /
translated: Some say that even the present cultivation of non-discursive thought is only the cultivation of a single state of stability.

original: lhag mthong ni mi skye zer te /
analyzed: lhag mthong ni mi skye zer te /
translated: They say that insight does not arise.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To them it is said:

original: gal te so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis brtags nas bsgoms pa yin nam /
analyzed: gal te so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis brtags nas bsgoms pa yin nam /
translated: If it is the cultivation after investigation by discerning wisdom,

original: 'on te ma brtags par bsgom pa la bya /
analyzed: 'on te ma brtags par bsgom pa la bya /
translated: or if it is the cultivation without investigation,

original: gal te 'og ma la zer na rigs kyi /
analyzed: gal te 'og ma la zer na rigs kyi /
translated: if it is the former, it is correct.

original: so sor rtog pa sngon du song nas bsgom pa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel ba'i sgom pa yin par slob dpon ka ma la sh'i las gsungs so //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa sngon du song nas bsgom pa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel ba'i sgom pa yin par slob dpon ka ma la sh'i las gsungs so //
translated: The master Kamalaśīla says that the cultivation after discerning wisdom is the cultivation of the union of śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: kha cig na re da lta nas sa bcu man chad lhag mthong so sor rtog pa'i shes pa kho na bsgom pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re da lta nas sa bcu man chad lhag mthong so sor rtog pa'i shes pa kho na bsgom pa yin te /
translated: Some say that from now on, up to the tenth bhūmi, one cultivates only the discerning wisdom of vipaśyanā.🔽In the noble Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra,

original: 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa chen po @251a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa chen po @251a * //
translated: it says:

original: las ; nyan thos rnams kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs mi mthong ste /
analyzed: las ; nyan thos rnams kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs mi mthong ste /
translated: The śrāvakas do not see the family of the tathāgatas.

original: zhi gnas kyi shas che ba dang / lhag mthong gi shas che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi shas che ba dang / lhag mthong gi shas che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is dominated by serenity and dominated by insight.

original: byang chub sems dpas ni mthong ste mi gsal la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ni mthong ste mi gsal la /
translated: The bodhisattva sees it, but not clearly,

original: lhag mthong gi shas che ba'i phyir dang / zhi gnas kyi shas chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi shas che ba'i phyir dang / zhi gnas kyi shas chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is dominated by insight and not dominated by serenity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni thams cad gzigs te zung du 'brel ba'i phyir ro //🔽zhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni thams cad gzigs te zung du 'brel ba'i phyir ro // zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: The Tathagata sees it all, because he is the union of the two.🔽If you say this,

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: we reply:

original: de ni mi spong ste /
analyzed: de ni mi spong ste /
translated: This is not to be rejected.

original: 'on kyang de ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gyi bye brag bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gyi bye brag bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is a teaching on the difference between the paths of learning and no-more-learning.

original: slob pa'i lam re re nas med par ni ma gsungs te /
analyzed: slob pa'i lam re re nas med par ni ma gsungs te /
translated: It does not say that each of the paths of learning does not exist,

original: zhi gnas shas che ba dang / lhag mthong shas che ba'i sgra yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas shas che ba dang / lhag mthong shas che ba'i sgra yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the terms dominated by serenity and dominated by insight are used.

original: gzhan yang lhag mthong gcig pos bden pa mthong na ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang lhag mthong gcig pos bden pa mthong na ni //
translated: Moreover, if one sees the truth with insight alone,

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba las /
translated: then the noble Saṃdhinirmocana Sūtra would not say:

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba thams cad zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi 'bras bu yin no zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba thams cad zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi 'bras bu yin no zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All supramundane virtue is the result of calm and insight.

original: de lta bas na so so'i skye bos kyang gnyi ga slob dgos par slob dpon ka ma la sh'i las kyang bstan to //🔽kha cig na re zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong zung du 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi zhi gnas bsgoms nas /
analyzed: de lta bas na so so'i skye bos kyang gnyi ga slob dgos par slob dpon ka ma la sh'i las kyang bstan to // kha cig na re zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong zung du 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi zhi gnas bsgoms nas /
translated: Thus, the Master Kamalasila has also taught that even ordinary men should train in both.

original: phyi nas lhag mthong bsgom pa la gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi nas lhag mthong bsgom pa la gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Some say: The union of calm and insight is the cultivation of insight after previously cultivating calm.

original: gang zag cig gi rgyud la ldan zhes pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: gang zag cig gi rgyud la ldan zhes pa'i don yin te /
translated: They say: It means that they exist in the mindstream of one person.

original: de lta ma yin na skad cig la chos mi mthun pa gnyis tshogs mi srid do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na skad cig la chos mi mthun pa gnyis tshogs mi srid do //
translated: Otherwise, it would be impossible for two incompatible factors to be present in an instant.

original: zhes zer te /🔽de la smras pa /
