analyzed: zhes zer te / de la smras pa /
translated: We reply:

original: gang du snga phyi yod pa de dus mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang du snga phyi yod pa de dus mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: Where there is a sequence, there is no simultaneity.

original: dper na dpyid dang ston bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dpyid dang ston bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like winter and summer.

original: dbyar la sogs pa'i dus su zhi gnas bsgoms nas dgun la sogs pa'i dus su lhag mthong bsgom pa 'di yang snga phyi yod pa'i rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dbyar la sogs pa'i dus su zhi gnas bsgoms nas dgun la sogs pa'i dus su lhag mthong bsgom pa 'di yang snga phyi yod pa'i rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradiction in the nature of something that exists at different times, since you cultivate serenity in the summer and so on, and then cultivate insight in the winter and so on.

original: gang skad cig gcig la mi 'chogs pa de ni shas che chung mnyam mi dgos te /
analyzed: gang skad cig gcig la mi 'chogs pa de ni shas che chung mnyam mi dgos te /
translated: It is not necessary that serenity and insight be equal in strength, since they are not cultivated for the same length of time.

original: dper na khyim na 'dug pa'i glang dang / zhing thog na 'dug pa'i glang lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na khyim na 'dug pa'i glang dang / zhing thog na 'dug pa'i glang lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a bull that is kept in a pen and a bull that is used for plowing do not need to be equal in size.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong yang skad cig ma gcig la mi 'tshogs pas khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //🔽@251b de lta'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong yang skad cig ma gcig la mi 'tshogs pas khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o // @251b de lta'o //
translated: Since serenity and insight are not cultivated for the same length of time, it is not contradictory for them to be cultivated in a single moment.

original: zhe na ; 'o na ni gang gi tshe lhag mthong bsgom pas shes rab shin tu shas che bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: zhe na ; 'o na ni gang gi tshe lhag mthong bsgom pas shes rab shin tu shas che bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you say that they are not cultivated in a single moment, then when you cultivate insight, wisdom will be very strong.

original: zhi gnas chung ba'i phyir mar me rlung la bzhag pa bzhin du sems g-yos pas de kho na shin tu gsal bar mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhi gnas chung ba'i phyir mar me rlung la bzhag pa bzhin du sems g-yos pas de kho na shin tu gsal bar mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, since serenity is weak, your mind will be unsteady like a butter lamp in the wind. Therefore, you will not see reality very clearly.

original: de'i phyir de'i tshe zhi gnas de bsgom par bya'o ;
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i tshe zhi gnas de bsgom par bya'o ;
translated: Therefore, at that time, one should cultivate śamatha.

original: / zhi gnas kyi shas che na yang gnyid kyis log pa'i mi bzhin du de kho na shin tu gsal bar mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: / zhi gnas kyi shas che na yang gnyid kyis log pa'i mi bzhin du de kho na shin tu gsal bar mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If śamatha predominates, then just as a sleeping person does not see reality very clearly,

original: de lta bas na de'i tshe yung shes rab bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i tshe yung shes rab bsgom par bya'o //
translated: so too, at that time, one should cultivate prajñā.

original: zhes gsungs pa de ji ltar drang bar bya /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa de ji ltar drang bar bya /
translated: How should this be interpreted?

original: gal te da lta lhag mthong bsgom pas shes rab shas che ba'i phyir sems g-yo ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te da lta lhag mthong bsgom pas shes rab shas che ba'i phyir sems g-yo ba de'i tshe /
translated: If, by cultivating vipaśyanā now, prajñā predominates, and the mind is agitated,

original: sang dgun gyi zhi gnas bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sang dgun gyi zhi gnas bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that one should cultivate śamatha in the winter.

original: de lta bas na gang gi tshe glang gnyis zung du 'brel bar mnyam du zhugs pa de bzhin du gnyis ka mnyam du zhugs par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de lta bas na gang gi tshe glang gnyis zung du 'brel bar mnyam du zhugs pa de bzhin du gnyis ka mnyam du zhugs par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, when the two are engaged equally, just as when two oxen are yoked together,

original: ji srid du lus dang / sems la gnod par ma gyur pa de srid du mngon par 'du byed pa med par gnas par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de yang dus tha dad pa'i sems nyid mnyam du 'jug pa dang / glang gcig khyim na 'dug pa dang /
analyzed: ji srid du lus dang / sems la gnod par ma gyur pa de srid du mngon par 'du byed pa med par gnas par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de yang dus tha dad pa'i sems nyid mnyam du 'jug pa dang / glang gcig khyim na 'dug pa dang /
translated: As long as there is no harm to the body or mind, one should remain without manifest activity.

original: glang gcig zhing thog na 'dug pas zhing rmor 'dod pa la gsungs par thal bar 'gyur ro //🔽chos mi mthun pa gnyis zhes bya ba de yang grub ste /
analyzed: glang gcig zhing thog na 'dug pas zhing rmor 'dod pa la gsungs par thal bar 'gyur ro // chos mi mthun pa gnyis zhes bya ba de yang grub ste /
translated: This is like saying that two different minds enter meditative equipoise simultaneously, or that one elephant is in the house and another is in the field, and that one who wishes to plow should mount the elephant in the field.

original: 'di ltar gang yang rung ba gcig med na ni mi skye la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang yang rung ba gcig med na ni mi skye la /
translated: The two dissimilar states are established because if either is absent, it does not arise.

original: gnyis ka yod la skyed pa de gnyis ni de skyed pa la mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis ka yod la skyed pa de gnyis ni de skyed pa la mthun pa yin te /
translated: When both exist, they generate it, and those two are similar in generating it.

original: dper na mig dang rna ba gnyis gang yang rung ba gcig med na bum pa la sogs pa la mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skye la /
analyzed: dper na mig dang rna ba gnyis gang yang rung ba gcig med na bum pa la sogs pa la mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skye la /
translated: For example, if either the eye or the ear is absent, eye consciousness does not arise with respect to a pot, etc.

original: de gnyis yod na skye ba de skyed pa la mthun pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de gnyis yod na skye ba de skyed pa la mthun pa lta bu'o //
translated: When both exist, it arises, and they are similar in generating it.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de gnyis kyang gang yang rung ba gcig med na ni /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de gnyis kyang gang yang rung ba gcig med na ni /
translated: And if either of these two, calm abiding or insight, is missing,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa chos nyid la gsal bar mi skye la gnyis ka yod na skye ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa chos nyid la gsal bar mi skye la gnyis ka yod na skye ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: the mental consciousness will not arise clearly in regard to reality. But if both are present, it will arise. This is a natural inference.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'phags pa chos kun bgro ba las /
analyzed: 'phags pa chos kun bgro ba las /
translated: In the Noble Discussion of Phenomena,

original: mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said that one will know reality just as it is through meditative equipoise.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ni ting nge 'dzin las gzhan med do //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ni ting nge 'dzin las gzhan med do //
translated: Meditative equipoise is nothing other than meditative stabilization.

original: rigs pa drug cu pa las kyang /
analyzed: rigs pa drug cu pa las kyang /
translated: And in the Yuktisastika it says:

original: sems rtse @252a * //
analyzed: sems rtse @252a * //
translated: From a one-pointed mind

original: gcig pa las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gcig pa las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: one will know reality just as it is.

original: spros pas chog go //
analyzed: spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this elaboration!

original: kha cig na re gang don dang ma phrad par don gyi rnam pa cig 'byung ba de ni rtog bcas yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re gang don dang ma phrad par don gyi rnam pa cig 'byung ba de ni rtog bcas yin te /
translated: Some say that when a mental image of an object occurs without the mind having contacted its object, that is conceptual.

original: dper na du ba la brten nas skyes pa'i shes pa la rgyab kyi mir snang ba rtog bcas yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na du ba la brten nas skyes pa'i shes pa la rgyab kyi mir snang ba rtog bcas yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the cognition that arises in dependence on smoke and appears as fire is conceptual.

original: so so skye bo'i shes pa 'di yang chos nyid dang ma phrad bzhin du chos nyid kyi rnam par 'byung bas rtog bcas yin te rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: so so skye bo'i shes pa 'di yang chos nyid dang ma phrad bzhin du chos nyid kyi rnam par 'byung bas rtog bcas yin te rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This cognition of ordinary beings, even though it does not encounter reality, arises in the aspect of reality and is therefore conceptual. This is a natural inference.

original: chos nyid ni yod med gang yang ma yin pa ci'i rnam par yang ma byung ba cig dgos te /
analyzed: chos nyid ni yod med gang yang ma yin pa ci'i rnam par yang ma byung ba cig dgos te /
translated: Reality must be neither existent nor nonexistent, and it must not occur in any aspect.

original: des spyi rnam pa bsgom zer ba ni brjod pa dang 'brel rung ba'i rtog pa yod par 'gyur bas de ni chos nyid bsgom pa bya bar 'gro'o //
analyzed: des spyi rnam pa bsgom zer ba ni brjod pa dang 'brel rung ba'i rtog pa yod par 'gyur bas de ni chos nyid bsgom pa bya bar 'gro'o //
translated: If it is said that reality is meditated on by means of a general aspect, then it would be a conceptual thought that is suitable to be related to expressions. Therefore, that would be a meditation on reality that is a verbal expression.

original: yang na byis pa chung ngu'i shes pa dang 'dra bar rnal 'byor pas chos nyid bsgom pa tha snyad 'dogs mi shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na byis pa chung ngu'i shes pa dang 'dra bar rnal 'byor pas chos nyid bsgom pa tha snyad 'dogs mi shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Alternatively, like the cognition of a small child, the yogi’s meditation on reality would be unable to impute conventions.

original: de bas na rtog bcas bsgom pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de bas na rtog bcas bsgom pa yang ma yin /
translated: Therefore, it is not a conceptual meditation.

original: chos nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid mthong mi srid pas rtog pa med pa'i shes pa yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid mthong mi srid pas rtog pa med pa'i shes pa yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not a non-conceptual consciousness.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: 'o na ni rtog bcas dang rtog med gnyis kyi shes pa thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na ni rtog bcas dang rtog med gnyis kyi shes pa thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, then since it pervades all consciousnesses, whether conceptual or non-conceptual,

original: shes pa gzhan dag kyang ma 'byung ste /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan dag kyang ma 'byung ste /
translated: other consciousnesses would not arise.

original: khyab par byed pa log na khyab pa yang bsdogs pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa log na khyab pa yang bsdogs pa yin no //
translated: And if the pervader is stopped, the pervaded is also stopped.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Thus,

original: rnal 'byor pas yon tan khyad par can thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas yon tan khyad par can thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: yogis would not attain special qualities.

original: med pa las gang gis rgyu las 'bras bu yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: med pa las gang gis rgyu las 'bras bu yang mi rung ste /
translated: And it is not tenable that an effect arises from a nonexistent cause,

original: ro bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ro bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the horn of an ass.

original: gal te med par khas mi len pa skyon 'dogs sam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te med par khas mi len pa skyon 'dogs sam zhe na /
translated: If you do not accept that it is nonexistent, then what is the fault in positing it?

original: 'o na yod na rtog bcas yin nam rtogs med yin /
analyzed: 'o na yod na rtog bcas yin nam rtogs med yin /
translated: If it exists, is it conceptual or non-conceptual?

original: der smra mi 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: der smra mi 'dod do zhe na /
translated: We do not assert that it is either.

original: gal te gnas skabs de bstan par //
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs de bstan par //
translated: If you say that it is not tenable to teach that state,

original: bya min zhes bya rkang brkyang ste //
analyzed: bya min zhes bya rkang brkyang ste //
translated: then you are just stretching your legs in the air.

original: grags pas dad pa bskyed pa yi //
analyzed: grags pas dad pa bskyed pa yi //
translated: It is a source of beauty for the faithful

original: dad ldan rnams la mdzes pa yin //
analyzed: dad ldan rnams la mdzes pa yin //
translated: who are inspired by the fame of the Buddha.

original: zhes bya bas sun dbyung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya bas sun dbyung ngo //
translated: This is the refutation.

original: 'on te rtog pa dang bcas pa'am rtog pa med par brjod du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'on te rtog pa dang bcas pa'am rtog pa med par brjod du mi 'dod do //
translated: But if you do not accept that it is either conceptual or non-conceptual,

original: shes pa dper na mda' sgro byi ba 'dra ba brkyang ba zor mtho ba cig yin zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa dper na mda' sgro byi ba 'dra ba brkyang ba zor mtho ba cig yin zhe na /
translated: then is consciousness like a bow drawn to its full extent?

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: rtog bcas ma yin rtog med min //
analyzed: rtog bcas ma yin rtog med min //
translated: It is not conceptual, not non-conceptual,

original: rnam pas nye bar ma bsgoms shig / snga na bas ni zor mtho ba'i //
analyzed: rnam pas nye bar ma bsgoms shig / snga na bas ni zor mtho ba'i //
translated: not drawn to its full extent,

original: shes pa yang dag nges par gnas /
analyzed: shes pa yang dag nges par gnas /
translated: and consciousness is correctly ascertained to abide.

original: @252b zhes bstan par 'gyur bas re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: @252b zhes bstan par 'gyur bas re zhig gzhag go //
translated: This is taught, so for now, set it aside.

original: kha cig na re de lhag mthong gi gnas skabs na gsal zhes bya ba ni yul med pa la gsal ba yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: kha cig na re de lhag mthong gi gnas skabs na gsal zhes bya ba ni yul med pa la gsal ba yin no zhes zer na /
translated: Some say that when it is clear in the context of insight, it is clear without an object.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that, we reply:

original: 'o na zhi gnas kyi shes pa dang 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na zhi gnas kyi shes pa dang 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Well then, it follows that it is like the consciousness of serenity.

original: gal te zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa yod med du 'jug la /
analyzed: gal te zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa yod med du 'jug la /
translated: If you say that the object of serenity is engaged with as existent or nonexistent,

original: lhag mthong gi ni de gnyis gang la yang mi 'dzin pa mi 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi ni de gnyis gang la yang mi 'dzin pa mi 'dra zhe na /
translated: But insight does not grasp either of these two.

original: de nyid kyi yul la 'dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi yul la 'dogs pa yin te /
translated: It is the designation of the object of reality.

original: mi rtog ces btags pa dang 'dra'o //🔽kha cig na res dang po yan chad ni mi rtog pa bsgom pa yin gyi 'jig rten chos kyi mchog man chad ni /
analyzed: mi rtog ces btags pa dang 'dra'o // kha cig na res dang po yan chad ni mi rtog pa bsgom pa yin gyi 'jig rten chos kyi mchog man chad ni /
translated: It is like the designation “non-discursive.

original: so sor rtog pa'i shes rab la bsgom pa yin te /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i shes rab la bsgom pa yin te /
translated: Some say: The first meditative stabilization and above is the cultivation of non-discursive thought, but up to the supreme mundane state is the cultivation of discerning wisdom.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las /
translated: In the Sutra of the Mound of Jewels,

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /🔽dper na shing gnyis drud pa las me byung nas shing nyid sreg pa de bzhin du yang dag par so sor rtog pa nyid las ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i me byung na /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste / dper na shing gnyis drud pa las me byung nas shing nyid sreg pa de bzhin du yang dag par so sor rtog pa nyid las ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i me byung na /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:🔽For example, when fire arises from the friction of two sticks, it burns those two sticks.

original: gtsub shing gtsubs pa'i me bzhin du rtog pa'i shing sreg go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gtsub shing gtsubs pa'i me bzhin du rtog pa'i shing sreg go zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the same way, when the fire of knowledge of reality arises from correct discernment, it burns the wood of discursive thought, like the fire from the friction of sticks.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las kyang /
translated: And in the Laṅkāvatāra-sūtra,

original: sems tsam la ni rab brten nas //
analyzed: sems tsam la ni rab brten nas //
translated: Having well relied on mind alone,

original: phyi rol don la mi rtog go //
analyzed: phyi rol don la mi rtog go //
translated: One does not conceive of external objects.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs gnas dang // sems tsam las kyang bzla bar bya //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs gnas dang // sems tsam las kyang bzla bar bya //
translated: And the objective reference of thatness.

original: sems tsam las ni 'das nas su //
analyzed: sems tsam las ni 'das nas su //
translated: Having transcended the stage of mind only,

original: snang ba med las 'da' bar bya //
analyzed: snang ba med las 'da' bar bya //
translated: One should transcend the absence of appearances.

original: snang med gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: snang med gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The yogin who abides in the absence of appearances

original: de yis theg pa chen po mthong //
analyzed: de yis theg pa chen po mthong //
translated: Will see the Great Vehicle.

original: zhi ba lhun gyis grub pa'i gnas //
analyzed: zhi ba lhun gyis grub pa'i gnas //
translated: The abode of peace, spontaneous,

original: smon lam dag gis rnam par sbyangs //
analyzed: smon lam dag gis rnam par sbyangs //
translated: Is purified by the power of aspiration.

original: ye shes dam pa bdag med par //
analyzed: ye shes dam pa bdag med par //
translated: The highest wisdom, which is selflessness,

original: snang ba med par mthong bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snang ba med par mthong bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Will be seen in the absence of appearances.

original: de bas na de dag so sor rtog pa'i shes rab rim gyis bsgom pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na de dag so sor rtog pa'i shes rab rim gyis bsgom pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, these are cultivated by the wisdom of discernment in stages.

original: cir yang mi rtog par bsgom pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: cir yang mi rtog par bsgom pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not cultivated by non-discursive thought.

original: da ltar kha cig yang mi rtog pa bsgom zer ba ni /
analyzed: da ltar kha cig yang mi rtog pa bsgom zer ba ni /
translated: Some these days say that non-discursive thought is cultivated.

original: ston mon mun gyi rjes su slob pa yin te /
analyzed: ston mon mun gyi rjes su slob pa yin te /
translated: They are following the blind and the ignorant.

original: rim gyis 'jug pa'i bsgom lugs ni ma yin no //🔽'o na gzungs 'grel las /
analyzed: rim gyis 'jug pa'i bsgom lugs ni ma yin no // 'o na gzungs 'grel las /
translated: This is not the way to cultivate the stages of entry.

original: bsgom pa'i rim pas ni mi rtog pa skad du gsungs pa zhe na /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rim pas ni mi rtog pa skad du gsungs pa zhe na /
translated: But the Dhāraṇīśvararāja Sūtra says that non-discursive thought is cultivated by the stages of meditation.

original: de ni sa dang po yan chad kyi yin no //
analyzed: de ni sa dang po yan chad kyi yin no //
translated: This is for those on the first ground and above.

original: yang na spros pa'i re bcad pa la dgongs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na spros pa'i re bcad pa la dgongs pa yin te /
translated: Or it is intended to cut off the hope for conceptual elaboration.

original: las dang po ni cir yang mi rtog pa la blo gnas mi srid do //
analyzed: las dang po ni cir yang mi rtog pa la blo gnas mi srid do //
translated: For a beginner, it is impossible for the mind to rest in non-conceptuality.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: bsgom pa'i rim pa tha mar mdzad pa las /🔽yang rnal 'byor pa ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs @253a * //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rim pa tha mar mdzad pa las / yang rnal 'byor pa ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs @253a * //
translated: In the final stage of meditation,🔽it is said:

original: pa las / gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod na ni gdon mi za bar ci zhig la dmigs dgos te /
analyzed: pa las / gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod na ni gdon mi za bar ci zhig la dmigs dgos te /
translated: If the mental consciousness exists for a yogi who has entered into meditative equipoise, then without doubt it must have an object.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi shes pa ni glo bur du dmigs pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi shes pa ni glo bur du dmigs pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For the consciousnesses of ordinary beings do not suddenly become objectless.

original: ci ste med na ni de'i tshe ji ltar chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rtog par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ste med na ni de'i tshe ji ltar chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rtog par 'gyur /
translated: But if it does not exist, then how can the nature of phenomena be conceived?

original: gnyen po gang gis ni nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyen po gang gis ni nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur //
translated: And by what antidote are afflictions abandoned?

original: bsam gtan bzhi po ma thob pa'i so so'i skye bo'i sems ni 'gag par 'gyur mi srid do zhes gsungs so //🔽zhes zer na /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi po ma thob pa'i so so'i skye bo'i sems ni 'gag par 'gyur mi srid do zhes gsungs so // zhes zer na /
translated: It is impossible for the mind of an ordinary being who has not attained the four meditative concentrations to cease.🔽If you say this,

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: we reply:

original: re zhig dang por so sor rtog pa'i shes rab bsgom mo zhes zer ba de ni bden te /
analyzed: re zhig dang por so sor rtog pa'i shes rab bsgom mo zhes zer ba de ni bden te /
translated: It is true that one should first cultivate discerning wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa la /
translated: The Tathagata has said:

original: slob dpon ka ma la sh'i las kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon ka ma la sh'i las kyang /
translated: The Acarya Kamalasila also says:

original: de lta bas na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bskyed par 'dod pas yang dag so sor rtog pa'i mtshan nyid lhag mthong la thog mar bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bskyed par 'dod pas yang dag so sor rtog pa'i mtshan nyid lhag mthong la thog mar bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one who wishes to generate non-conceptual wisdom should first cultivate insight which is characterized by correct analytical discrimination,

original: des mtshan ma rnams yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des mtshan ma rnams yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro // zhes gsungs so //
translated: for by that one abandons signs.

original: 'on kyang spyad par bya ba cung zad yod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang spyad par bya ba cung zad yod do //
translated: However, there is something to be practiced.

original: so sor rtog pa zhes bya ba ni sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gnyis yod de /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa zhes bya ba ni sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two reasons for the occurrence of the term discernment:

original: zhi gnas grub nas gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pa dang tshol bar byed pa bsam pa'i shes rab zer ba dang / mi rtog mi 'byed mi tshol mi tshol ba byed pa'i bsam pa'i shes rab la zer ba dang / mi rtog mi 'byed mi tshol mi 'gyur mi g-yo ba la bya'o ;
analyzed: zhi gnas grub nas gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pa dang tshol bar byed pa bsam pa'i shes rab zer ba dang / mi rtog mi 'byed mi tshol mi tshol ba byed pa'i bsam pa'i shes rab la zer ba dang / mi rtog mi 'byed mi tshol mi 'gyur mi g-yo ba la bya'o ;
translated: The wisdom of reflection is called the wisdom of reflection that does not conceptualize, does not discriminate, does not investigate, and does not seek.🔽It is not conceptualizing, not discriminating, not investigating, not changing, and not wavering.

original: / de la bsam pa'i shes rab kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: / de la bsam pa'i shes rab kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to that, from the perspective of the wisdom of reflection,

original: 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las /
analyzed: 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las /
translated: it says in the noble King of Samādhi Sūtra:🔽If one analyzes the selflessness of phenomena,

original: gal te chos la bdag med pa so sor rtog / so sor de rtag gal te sgom byed na //
analyzed: gal te chos la bdag med pa so sor rtog / so sor de rtag gal te sgom byed na //
translated: if one always analyzes that,

original: de nyid mya ngan 'das thob 'bras bu'i rgyu //
analyzed: de nyid mya ngan 'das thob 'bras bu'i rgyu //
translated: that is the cause for attaining the result of nirvāṇa.

original: rgyu gzhan gang yin des ni zhir mi 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan gang yin des ni zhir mi 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Whatever other causes there are, they will not lead to peace.

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: It says in the noble Unraveling the Intent:

original: de lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa thob nas de nyid la gnas te /
analyzed: de lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa thob nas de nyid la gnas te /
translated: Having attained physical and mental pliancy, one remains in that state.

original: sems kyi rnam pa spangs nas ji ltar bsam pa'i chos de dag nyid nang du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan du so sor rtog par byed do //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam pa spangs nas ji ltar bsam pa'i chos de dag nyid nang du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan du so sor rtog par byed do //
translated: Having abandoned mental activity, he discerns individually, as representations in the domain of samādhi, those very dharmas that are being contemplated.

original: mos par byed do //🔽de ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan de dag la shes bya'i don de rnam par 'byed pa dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang / yongs su dpyod pa dang / bzod pa dang / 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: mos par byed do // de ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan de dag la shes bya'i don de rnam par 'byed pa dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang / yongs su dpyod pa dang / bzod pa dang / 'dod pa dang /
translated: He aspires to them.🔽Thus, that discernment, thorough discernment, full investigation, full analysis, forbearance, aspiration,

original: bye brag 'byed pa dang / lta ba dang rtog pa gang yin pa de ni lhag mthong zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bye brag 'byed pa dang / lta ba dang rtog pa gang yin pa de ni lhag mthong zhes bya ste /
translated: differentiation, view, and thought regarding those representations in the domain of samādhi is called vipaśyanā.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems @253b dpa' lhag mthong la mkhas pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems @253b dpa' lhag mthong la mkhas pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, bodhisattvas are skilled in vipaśyanā.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa'i gzungs kyi 'grel ba las kyang bsdus pa'i don bdun pa'i skabs su der yang ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan ma snang ba la sems bzhag nas bying ba dag rgod pa la sogs pa zhi bar byas te zhi gnas bsgrub la
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa'i gzungs kyi 'grel ba las kyang bsdus pa'i don bdun pa'i skabs su der yang ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan ma snang ba la sems bzhag nas bying ba dag rgod pa la sogs pa zhi bar byas te zhi gnas bsgrub la
translated: The Commentary on the Dhāraṇī of Entering Nonconceptuality also, in the section on the seventh summary point, says that you should place your mind on the appearance of the signs as they are taught there, and then, having pacified laxity, excitation, and so on, you should achieve serenity.

original: yang dag par so sor rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yid la mi byed pa des /
analyzed: yang dag par so sor rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yid la mi byed pa des /
translated: Then, through the characteristic of correct analytical discrimination, you should not attend to those signs.

original: mtshan ma de dag yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: mtshan ma de dag yongs su spong ngo //
translated: You should completely abandon those signs.

original: der yang ji skad thos pa dang bsam pa don la nges pa'i tshul gyis so sor brtag par bya ste /🔽rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bsgom pa'am 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med par so sor brtag pa'am /🔽bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis ka las mi 'byung bar dpyad pa'am /
analyzed: der yang ji skad thos pa dang bsam pa don la nges pa'i tshul gyis so sor brtag par bya ste / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bsgom pa'am 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med par so sor brtag pa'am / bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis ka las mi 'byung bar dpyad pa'am /
translated: There, you should analyze in accordance with the ascertainment of the meaning of what you have heard and contemplated.

original: cha la so sor brtag pa'am /
analyzed: cha la so sor brtag pa'am /
translated: You should analyze the absence of coming and going, or you should analyze the absence of arising from self, from other, or from both, or you should analyze the parts.

original: mdor na ji ltar rtog pas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: mdor na ji ltar rtog pas kyang rung ste /
translated: In brief, it is suitable to analyze in any way that you can imagine.

original: dngos po med pa la nges pa skye bar 'gyur ba de ltar so sor brtag par bya'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la nges pa skye bar 'gyur ba de ltar so sor brtag par bya'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: One should investigate in this way in order to generate certainty about the absence of entities.

original: dngos po med pa ni chos med pa ste chos kyi dbyings la dgongs so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni chos med pa ste chos kyi dbyings la dgongs so //
translated: The absence of entities is the absence of phenomena, and it is the intention to refer to the dharmadhātu.

original: zhes de nyid las gsungs so //🔽mi rtog mi 'byed /🔽mi 'tshol / mi 'gyur /
analyzed: zhes de nyid las gsungs so // mi rtog mi 'byed / mi 'tshol / mi 'gyur /
translated: So it is said in the same text.🔽One does not conceptualize or discriminate.

original: mi g-yo zhing /
analyzed: mi g-yo zhing /
translated: One does not seek, change, or waver.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa'am /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa'am /
translated: One individually cognizes things as they are.

original: rtog pa tsam la lhag mthong dang po so sor rtog pa zhes gsungs pa ni 'phags pa chos thams cad dmigs su med cing sems pa med pa rin po che bsags pa'i bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: rtog pa tsam la lhag mthong dang po so sor rtog pa zhes gsungs pa ni 'phags pa chos thams cad dmigs su med cing sems pa med pa rin po che bsags pa'i bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: Or, mere conceptualization is called “the initial discernment of insight.” This is taught in the noble Sūtra of the Teaching of the Accumulation of Jewels, which states that all phenomena are not observed and are not conceptualized:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: 'jam dpal yang dag par so sor rtog pa zhes bya ba de chos gang gi tshig bla dags yin //
analyzed: 'jam dpal yang dag par so sor rtog pa zhes bya ba de chos gang gi tshig bla dags yin //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, what is the term for ‘correct discernment’?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: bcom ldan 'das yang dag par so sor rtog pa zhes bgyi ba ni so sor rtog pa gang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yang dag par so sor rtog pa zhes bgyi ba ni so sor rtog pa gang /
translated: “Blessed One, what is called ‘correct discernment’ is any discernment.

original: chos gang la yang tha dad par yang mi bgyid gcig tu yang mi bgyid de /
analyzed: chos gang la yang tha dad par yang mi bgyid gcig tu yang mi bgyid de /
translated: He does not make any dharma different or one.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'gyur ba ma mchis pa rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'gyur ba ma mchis pa rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, non-change is non-conceptuality.

original: bcom ldan 'das yang dag par so sor rtog pa zhes bgyi ba de ni yang dag par so sor rtog pa ma mchis pa'i tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yang dag par so sor rtog pa zhes bgyi ba de ni yang dag par so sor rtog pa ma mchis pa'i tshig bla dags so //
translated: Blessed One, what is called ‘correct discrimination’ is a synonym for ‘absence of correct discrimination.’

original: bcom ldan 'das yang dag par so sor rtog pa la brten te /🔽bdag ni so so'i skye bo'am //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yang dag par so sor rtog pa la brten te / bdag ni so so'i skye bo'am //
translated: Blessed One, based on correct discrimination,🔽one does not think, ‘I am an ordinary person’

original: 'phags pa nyan thos snyam du de ltar mi sems so //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos snyam du de ltar mi sems so //
translated: or ‘I am an Ārya Śrāvaka.’

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /🔽'di ltar chos gang so so'i skye bo'am /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na / 'di ltar chos gang so so'i skye bo'am /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because one does not see any dharma that would be an ordinary person

original: 'phags par 'gyur ba'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i slad du'o //
analyzed: 'phags par 'gyur ba'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i slad du'o //
translated: or an Ārya.

original: bcom ldan 'das yang dad par so sor rtog pa la brten nas /🔽rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyis de ltar snang ba lags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yang dad par so sor rtog pa la brten nas / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyis de ltar snang ba lags te /
translated: Blessed One, based on correct discrimination,🔽a son or daughter of good family, by the principle of the dharmadhātu, appears thus.

original: chos @254a * //
analyzed: chos @254a * //
translated: Dharma

original: gang la yang mnyam pa nyid du yang mi bgyid mi mnyam par yang mi bgyid /
analyzed: gang la yang mnyam pa nyid du yang mi bgyid mi mnyam par yang mi bgyid /
translated: He does not make anything the same or not the same.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos ni mi mnyam pa'o zhes rtog par mi bgyid /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos ni mi mnyam pa'o zhes rtog par mi bgyid /
translated: He does not think that the qualities of ordinary beings are not the same.

original: 'phags pa'i chos ni mnyam pa'o zhes rnam par rtog par mi bgyid do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos ni mnyam pa'o zhes rnam par rtog par mi bgyid do //
translated: He does not conceptualize that the qualities of the āryas are the same.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /🔽'di ltar dmigs pa gang mnyam pa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na / 'di ltar dmigs pa gang mnyam pa'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi mnyam par bgyid pa de la mi dmigs pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam par bgyid pa de la mi dmigs pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Because that which is the same or not the same in terms of an observed object does not exist.

original: gang gi mnyam pa'am mi mnyam par bgyid pa de yang dge slong de la ma mchis so //
analyzed: gang gi mnyam pa'am mi mnyam par bgyid pa de yang dge slong de la ma mchis so //
translated: That which is the same or not the same in terms of a monk does not exist.🔽In that way, a monk who is nonconceptual does not think, ‘I am nonconceptual.’

original: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i dge slong ni bdag rnam par mi rtog go snyam du de ltar 'dzin pa yang ma mchis so //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i dge slong ni bdag rnam par mi rtog go snyam du de ltar 'dzin pa yang ma mchis so // zhes gsungs so //
translated: He does not grasp in that way.”

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzungs 'grel de nyid las /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzungs 'grel de nyid las /
translated: The Commentary on the Dhāraṇī of Nonconceptuality says:

original: bsdus pa'i don brgyad pa'i skabs su yang dag pa'i don bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rtog pa'i rnam pa skye zhing rang rig pa dang / bdag nyid kyang ngo bo nyid med par rtog pa skye na /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don brgyad pa'i skabs su yang dag pa'i don bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rtog pa'i rnam pa skye zhing rang rig pa dang / bdag nyid kyang ngo bo nyid med par rtog pa skye na /
translated: And it teaches that when the realization that one’s own self is essenceless arises,

original: rnal 'byor pa'i ye shes kyis mthong ngo zhes bstan to //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i ye shes kyis mthong ngo zhes bstan to // zhes gsungs so //
translated: the yogin sees with wisdom.

original: 'phags pa 'od srungs kyis zhus pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'od srungs kyis zhus pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Thus it is said in the Commentary on the Questions of Pūrṇa.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that “one should discern reality just as it is.”

original: de bas na sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gnyis yod do //
analyzed: de bas na sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gnyis yod do //
translated: Therefore there are two reasons for the use of the term.

original: zhes bya ba de 'grub bo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de 'grub bo //
translated: Thus it is established.

original: 'on te nyi khri snang ba las /
analyzed: 'on te nyi khri snang ba las /
translated: But how do you interpret the passage from the Twenty-Five Thousand?

original: mtha' ma mthong ba'i bya ba bzhin no //🔽zhes gsungs pa de ji ltar drang /
analyzed: mtha' ma mthong ba'i bya ba bzhin no // zhes gsungs pa de ji ltar drang /
translated: It says, “Just like the activity of seeing the end.”

original: de yang mtha' ma mthong nas phyir log ste da ci'i sar 'dug pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de yang mtha' ma mthong nas phyir log ste da ci'i sar 'dug pa bzhin du /
translated: It is like this. Having seen the end, one turns back and sits down where one was.

original: so sor brtags nas ma mthong bas yang so sor rtog ces gsungs pa ni ma yin te /🔽de lta na ni yang ltar 'gro bya bar 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: so sor brtags nas ma mthong bas yang so sor rtog ces gsungs pa ni ma yin te / de lta na ni yang ltar 'gro bya bar 'gyur gyis /
translated: It is not that one should investigate again and again, and then, not seeing anything, one should investigate again.

original: da ci'i sar 'dug ces mi bya'o //
analyzed: da ci'i sar 'dug ces mi bya'o //
translated: If that were so, one would be going, not sitting in the place where one was a moment ago.

original: de lta bas na 'di skad du /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: dper na bya de rgya mtsho'i mtha' bltas pas ma mthong ste 'gro sa med nas 'dug pa de bzhin du bsam pa'i shes rab so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis brtags nas ma mthong ba la ting nge 'dzin gyis grogs byas nas de las mi g-yo bar lhan
analyzed: dper na bya de rgya mtsho'i mtha' bltas pas ma mthong ste 'gro sa med nas 'dug pa de bzhin du bsam pa'i shes rab so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis brtags nas ma mthong ba la ting nge 'dzin gyis grogs byas nas de las mi g-yo bar lhan
translated: Just as a bird, having looked at the edge of the ocean, does not see it, and, having no place to go, sits down, so also, when the wisdom of reflection and the wisdom of discernment investigate and do not see, samādhi assists them, and, not moving from that, they remain in the state of nonseeing.

original: ne yod kyi rnam par shes pa 'dug pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ne yod kyi rnam par shes pa 'dug pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The wisdom of meditation is present.

original: gtsub shing gis gtsubs pa'i mes bsregs pa'i zhes bya ba de yang gtsubs pas me lam gyis 'bar bas bsregs pa bzhin du brtsal phye brtags pas /
analyzed: gtsub shing gis gtsubs pa'i mes bsregs pa'i zhes bya ba de yang gtsubs pas me lam gyis 'bar bas bsregs pa bzhin du brtsal phye brtags pas /
translated: The fire that burns the wood of the object of wisdom is not said to be the fire of the friction of wisdom, but rather the fire that burns by the path of the flame of friction.

original: de'i 'phro kho nas ye shes lhag gis skyes zhes gsungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'phro kho nas ye shes lhag gis skyes zhes gsungs pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, it is not said that by the investigation of discernment, the wisdom of meditation arises from that itself.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what it says.

original: so so'i skye bo sa las rtags la brten nas cir yang ma grub par rtog pa la @254b ting nge 'dzin gyis grogs byas nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong cha mi snyoms na mnyam /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo sa las rtags la brten nas cir yang ma grub par rtog pa la @254b ting nge 'dzin gyis grogs byas nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong cha mi snyoms na mnyam /
translated: When śamatha and vipaśyanā are not balanced, one should rest in equipoise for as long as possible, without exerting, tightening, or forcing oneself.

original: mnyam na ji srid nus kyi bar du 'dug pa las 'bad pa dang / bsgrim pa dang / rtsol ba'i sgo nas 'di lta ste dper na mes me'i bya ba byed 'dod cing me don du gnyer ba'i mi la la zhig gis gtsub gtan gyi steng du gtsub shing gtsubs te de mngon par gtsubs shing 'bad par byed /
analyzed: mnyam na ji srid nus kyi bar du 'dug pa las 'bad pa dang / bsgrim pa dang / rtsol ba'i sgo nas 'di lta ste dper na mes me'i bya ba byed 'dod cing me don du gnyer ba'i mi la la zhig gis gtsub gtan gyi steng du gtsub shing gtsubs te de mngon par gtsubs shing 'bad par byed /
translated: For example, a person who wants to make fire and is seeking fire rubs a fire stick on a wooden surface.

original: sgrim par byed //
analyzed: sgrim par byed //
translated: They rub it,

original: rtsol bar byed na /
analyzed: rtsol bar byed na /
translated: exerting themselves, tightening, and making an effort.

original: des 'bad pa dang / sgrim pa dang / rtsol ba 'di'i sgo nas dang po kho nar gtsub gtan las drod skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des 'bad pa dang / sgrim pa dang / rtsol ba 'di'i sgo nas dang po kho nar gtsub gtan las drod skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through this exertion, tightening, and effort, heat will first arise from the wooden surface.

original: drod de nyid mngon par 'phel ba na rtse mo 'byung zhing du ba 'thul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drod de nyid mngon par 'phel ba na rtse mo 'byung zhing du ba 'thul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When that heat increases, the flame will appear and smoke will emerge.

original: rgya cher mngon par 'phel bar gyur ba na me lce med pa'i me 'phel bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgya cher mngon par 'phel bar gyur ba na me lce med pa'i me 'phel bar 'gyur //
translated: When it has increased greatly, it is a fire without flames.

original: me byung ma thag kho nar me lce 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me byung ma thag kho nar me lce 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As soon as the fire arises, the flames arise.

original: me lce 'byung zhing 'bar ba des me'i bya ba byed do //🔽de bzhin du ji ltar mngon par gtsub shing 'bad pa dang / bsgrim pa dang / rtsol bar byed pa de ltar na dbang po lnga po dag la kun tu brten cing goms par byed /
analyzed: me lce 'byung zhing 'bar ba des me'i bya ba byed do // de bzhin du ji ltar mngon par gtsub shing 'bad pa dang / bsgrim pa dang / rtsol bar byed pa de ltar na dbang po lnga po dag la kun tu brten cing goms par byed /
translated: The arising and burning of the flames performs the function of fire.

original: lan mang du byed par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lan mang du byed par blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, just as the friction stick is the basis for the effort, exertion, and striving, in the same way, the five faculties should be seen as the basis for the cultivation and frequent practice of the five powers.

original: ji ltar dang po kho nar gtsub gtan nas dros skye bar 'gyur ba de ltar ni me lta bu'i gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i chos nyon mongs pa rnams bsreg skye ba'i sngon rol du 'gro zhing rgyur gyur pa'i dro bar 'gyur ba dag blta bar
analyzed: ji ltar dang po kho nar gtsub gtan nas dros skye bar 'gyur ba de ltar ni me lta bu'i gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i chos nyon mongs pa rnams bsreg skye ba'i sngon rol du 'gro zhing rgyur gyur pa'i dro bar 'gyur ba dag blta bar
translated: Just as the friction stick is heated at the very beginning, in the same way, the person who is like a fire, prior to the arising of the fire of the realization of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, has the heat that is the cause for the burning of the afflictions.

original: bya'o // ji ltar drod de nyid mngon par 'phel ba na rtse mo 'byung bar ltar na rtse mo dag blta'o //
analyzed: bya'o // ji ltar drod de nyid mngon par 'phel ba na rtse mo 'byung bar ltar na rtse mo dag blta'o //
translated: As the heat increases, the flame arises.

original: ji ltar du ba 'thul bar 'gyur pa de ltar ni bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa rnams blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar du ba 'thul bar 'gyur pa de ltar ni bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa rnams blta bar bya'o //
translated: As smoke arises, so should the acceptances that are in accord with the truths be seen.

original: ji ltar rgya cher mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ba nas me lce med pa'i me 'byung bar 'gyur ba de lta na ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rgya cher mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ba nas me lce med pa'i me 'byung bar 'gyur ba de lta na ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams blta bar bya'o //
translated: As the fire increases and becomes extensive, the flame arises without smoke. So should the supreme mundane qualities be seen.

original: ji ltar me byung ma thag kho nar me lce 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar me byung ma thag kho nar me lce 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: As soon as the fire arises, the flame arises.

original: me lce 'byung zhing 'bar ba des me'i bya ba byed pa de ltar na gang dag 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gis yang dag par zin pa'i stobs lnga po dag mjug thogs su byung ba 'jig rten las 'das pa spros pa mtha' dag dang bral ba na
analyzed: me lce 'byung zhing 'bar ba des me'i bya ba byed pa de ltar na gang dag 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gis yang dag par zin pa'i stobs lnga po dag mjug thogs su byung ba 'jig rten las 'das pa spros pa mtha' dag dang bral ba na
translated: The flame arises and burns, and by that flame the function of fire is performed. So, immediately after the supreme mundane qualities, the five powers that are embraced by the supreme mundane qualities arise.🔽They are supramundane, free from all conceptual proliferation, and are the antidote to the afflictions.

original: shin tu gsal ba ma mthong ba mthong ba byung bas spyi'i rnam pa la rang gi mtshan nyid du shes pa'i rtsol ba dang / 'bad pa dang bral ba de tsam la sreg ces gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: shin tu gsal ba ma mthong ba mthong ba byung bas spyi'i rnam pa la rang gi mtshan nyid du shes pa'i rtsol ba dang / 'bad pa dang bral ba de tsam la sreg ces gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Since one is free from the effort of knowing the general aspects as one's own characteristics and from striving, one is free from the effort of knowing the general aspects as one's own characteristics and from striving.🔽That is called burning.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid med par ma mthong ba des rtags la brten nas mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral @255a * //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid med par ma mthong ba des rtags la brten nas mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral @255a * //
translated: Since one is free from the effort of knowing the general aspects as one's own characteristics and from striving, one is free from the effort of knowing the general aspects as one's own characteristics and from striving.🔽That is called burning.🔽Since one is free from the effort of knowing the general aspects as one's own characteristics and from striving, one is free from the effort of knowing the general aspects as one's own characteristics and from striving.

original: bar nges pa tsam ma blo gnas pa de 'khrul mnyam pa'i shes pa skye bas sreg ces bya ste /
analyzed: bar nges pa tsam ma blo gnas pa de 'khrul mnyam pa'i shes pa skye bas sreg ces bya ste /
translated: That is called burning.🔽Since one is free from the effort of knowing the general aspects as one's own characteristics and from striving, one is free from the effort of knowing the general aspects as one's own characteristics and from striving.

original: 'od srungs kyis zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'od srungs kyis zhus pa las /
translated: That is called burning.🔽Since one is free from the effort of knowing the general aspects as one's own characteristics and from striving, one is free from the effort of knowing the general aspects as one's own characteristics and from striving.🔽That is called burning.🔽Since one is free from the effort of knowing the general aspects as one's own characteristics and from striving, one is free from the effort of knowing the general aspects as one's own characteristics and from striving.🔽That is called burning.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas tshigs pa dang 'dra ste zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas tshigs pa dang 'dra ste zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since one is free from the effort of knowing the general aspects

original: de bas na me 'byung ba'i mes sreg pa dang 'dra bar mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye ba'i rgyu rtags la brten nas cir yang ma grub par rtog pa de ting nge 'dzin gyis grogs byas nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel ba la goms pas🔽cir yang ma grub pa'am //
analyzed: de bas na me 'byung ba'i mes sreg pa dang 'dra bar mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye ba'i rgyu rtags la brten nas cir yang ma grub par rtog pa de ting nge 'dzin gyis grogs byas nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel ba la goms pas cir yang ma grub pa'am //
translated: That is the meditative concentration that is the support.

original: cir yang ma mthong ba'i ye shes skyes pa na rtags la brten nas nges pa tsam la bsgom mi dgos te /
analyzed: cir yang ma mthong ba'i ye shes skyes pa na rtags la brten nas nges pa tsam la bsgom mi dgos te /
translated: When the wisdom that does not see anything at all arises, it is not necessary to meditate on mere certainty on the basis of signs.

original: de dang bral ba yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de dang bral ba yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: One is free from them.

original: langs pa'i gnas skabs su 'byed pa dang 'tshol ba'i shes pa yang rtag tu mi 'bral bar brten dgos te /
analyzed: langs pa'i gnas skabs su 'byed pa dang 'tshol ba'i shes pa yang rtag tu mi 'bral bar brten dgos te /
translated: In the state of rising from meditative concentration, one must always rely on the knowledge of discernment and investigation.

original: 'phags pa gtsug na rin po che las /
analyzed: 'phags pa gtsug na rin po che las /
translated: The noble Sūtra of Ratnachuda says,

original: stong pa nyid kyi bsam gtan sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi bar du ma bral ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi bsam gtan sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi bar du ma bral ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: “The generosity of the meditative concentration of emptiness is not separate from the perfection of wisdom.”

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: The noble Sutra of the Descent into Lanka

original: shes rab bsgom pa'i rim pa mdor bka' stsal te /
analyzed: shes rab bsgom pa'i rim pa mdor bka' stsal te /
translated: briefly teaches the stages of the practice of wisdom.

original: sems tsam pa ni bab brten nas //
analyzed: sems tsam pa ni bab brten nas //
translated: The Cittamātra school asserts that it is dependent.🔽

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang zhi gnas grub nas bsam pa'i shes rab kyi rim gyis nam yid ches kyi bar du brtag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang zhi gnas grub nas bsam pa'i shes rab kyi rim gyis nam yid ches kyi bar du brtag pa yin gyi /
translated: The Cittamatrins, however, say that one should investigate in this way until one has gained conviction, and that one should then meditate on the ultimate reality by turns, alternating this with the meditation on the conventional.

original: brtags nas chos nyid re mos bsgom pa ma yin te /🔽de skad du /
analyzed: brtags nas chos nyid re mos bsgom pa ma yin te / de skad du /
translated: But this is not the way to meditate on ultimate reality.

original: bsgom pa'i rim pa dang por mdzad pa las /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rim pa dang por mdzad pa las /
translated: As it is said in the first Stages of Meditation:

original: de ltar dmigs pa la sems brtan par byas nas shes rab kyis dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa la sems brtan par byas nas shes rab kyis dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Once you have stabilized your mind on an object of meditation in this way, you should investigate with wisdom.🔽And so on until:

original: zhes bya ba nas ye shes dam pa bdag med par snang ba med pas mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas ye shes dam pa bdag med par snang ba med pas mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: You will see the sublime wisdom of no-self, free from appearances.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i bar du legs par bshad nas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i bar du legs par bshad nas /
translated: And:🔽You should meditate on thatness by means of this meditation process.

original: de ltar bsgom pa'i rim pa 'dis de kho na bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs te des ni bsam pa'i shes rab kyis yid ches par goms par bya zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa'i rim pa 'dis de kho na bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs te des ni bsam pa'i shes rab kyis yid ches par goms par bya zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is saying that you should familiarize yourself with the ultimate reality by means of the wisdom that comes from reflection.

original: des na yid ches pas de'i don la bsgom pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: des na yid ches pas de'i don la bsgom pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: So, with conviction, you should meditate on the meaning of the ultimate reality.

original: de la bying ba dang rgod pa la sogs pa byung na sngar bstan pa bzhin du zhi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas na /
analyzed: de la bying ba dang rgod pa la sogs pa byung na sngar bstan pa bzhin du zhi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas na /
translated: When laxity, excitement, and so forth occur, you should pacify them as previously explained.🔽Thus, just as you pacify laxity, excitement, and so forth when you are cultivating meditative serenity alone, you must also pacify them when you are cultivating insight and serenity in union through discriminating wisdom.🔽The statement, “When you see that you are not engaging in analysis with discriminating wisdom, you should relax your mind and rest in equipoise” indicates that you should relax your mind and rest in equipoise when you are not analyzing with discriminating wisdom.

original: sngar zhi gnas 'ba' zhig bsgom pa'i skabs su bying rgod la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: sngar zhi gnas 'ba' zhig bsgom pa'i skabs su bying rgod la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: The statement, “When you see that you are not focusing on the object of meditation with tight focus, you should tighten your mind and focus on the object of meditation” indicates that you should tighten your mind and focus on the object of meditation when you are not focusing on the object of meditation with tight focus.🔽The statement, “When you see that you are not focusing on the object of meditation with tight focus, you should relax your mind and rest in equipoise” indicates that you should relax your mind and rest in equipoise when you are focusing on the object of meditation with tight focus.🔽The statement, “When you see that you are not focusing on the object of meditation with tight focus, you should tighten your mind and focus on the object of meditation” indicates that you should tighten your mind and focus on the object of meditation when you are not focusing on the object of meditation with tight focus.🔽The statement, “When you see that you are not focusing on the object of meditation with tight focus, you should relax your mind and rest in equipoise” indicates that you should relax your mind and rest in equipoise when you are focusing on the object of meditation with tight focus.

original: bsam pa'i shes rab kyis so sor brtags pa'i do la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar bsgom pa 'di la yang zhi bar bya dgos pa'i don to /🔽gang gi tshe chos thams @255b cad ngo bo nyid med par dmigs pa zhes gsungs pas ni spros pa phyogs re bcad pa pa dgongs pa ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: bsam pa'i shes rab kyis so sor brtags pa'i do la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar bsgom pa 'di la yang zhi bar bya dgos pa'i don to /🔽gang gi tshe chos thams @255b cad ngo bo nyid med par dmigs pa zhes gsungs pas ni spros pa phyogs re bcad pa pa dgongs pa ma yin par bstan to //
translated: The statement, “When you see that you are not engaging in analysis with discriminating wisdom, you should relax your mind and rest in equipoise” indicates that you should relax your mind and rest in equipoise when you are not analyzing with discriminating wisdom.🔽The statement, “When you see that you are not focusing on the object of meditation with tight focus, you should tighten your mind and focus on the object of meditation” indicates that you should tighten your mind and focus on the object of meditation when you are not focusing on the object of meditation with tight focus.🔽The statement, “When you see that you are not focusing on the object of meditation with tight focus, you should relax your mind and rest in equipoise” indicates that you should relax your mind and rest

original: bying ba dang rgod pa la sogs pa bral zhing zhes gsungs pas ni zhi gnas kyi shas che ba dag lhag mthong gi shas che ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i shes pa dang yang bral bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bying ba dang rgod pa la sogs pa bral zhing zhes gsungs pas ni zhi gnas kyi shas che ba dag lhag mthong gi shas che ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i shes pa dang yang bral bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase free from laxity, excitation, and so on means that you should be free from a predominance of śamatha, a predominance of vipaśyanā, unhappiness, and neutral awareness.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med par shes pa 'jug par gyur pa de'i tshe zhes gsungs pas ni /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med par shes pa 'jug par gyur pa de'i tshe zhes gsungs pas ni /
translated: The phrase when your mind is engaged without the need for active application means that

original: rtsol ma byas kyang lhan ne gnas zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsol ma byas kyang lhan ne gnas zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: you should rest in equipoise without exertion.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar 'jug pa'i lam rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar 'jug pa'i lam rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: This completes the path that unites śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: zhes gsungs pa ni gnyis ka chung yang mnyam par zung du 'brel bar yod pas gdags su 'dod de //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ni gnyis ka chung yang mnyam par zung du 'brel bar yod pas gdags su 'dod de //
translated: The phrase when śamatha and vipaśyanā are in equipoise means that you should be free from the faults of dullness and agitation and that you should have a balance of śamatha and vipaśyanā, even if they are slight.

original: re zhig skabs der rtsol ba mi bya zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig skabs der rtsol ba mi bya zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase at that time, do not apply yourself means that you should not apply yourself to analysis at that point.

original: de'i tshe ji srid du nus pa de srid du mos pa'i stobs kyis //
analyzed: de'i tshe ji srid du nus pa de srid du mos pa'i stobs kyis //
translated: At that time, as long as you are able, you should rest in equipoise through the power of your interest.

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa la gnas par bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pas ni /
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa la gnas par bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pas ni /
translated: The statement one should cultivate the stage of action in faith means that

original: 'phags pa shin tu chos thams cad kyi chos nyid mngon du ma gyur te /
analyzed: 'phags pa shin tu chos thams cad kyi chos nyid mngon du ma gyur te /
translated: the noble one has not yet realized the reality of all phenomena.

original: gtan tshigs la brten nas de lkog tu gyur pa'i don la nges pa skyes shing /
analyzed: gtan tshigs la brten nas de lkog tu gyur pa'i don la nges pa skyes shing /
translated: On the basis of reasoning, one generates certainty about the meaning that is hidden from one.

original: de la so so'i skye bo'i sa na mos pa yin pas de la goms par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo'i sa na mos pa yin pas de la goms par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since that is faith on the stage of ordinary beings, one should cultivate it.

original: 'di ni so so'i skye bo'i sa nas yang mos pa sgo nas cir yang mi rtog pa bsgom pa yod do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni so so'i skye bo'i sa nas yang mos pa sgo nas cir yang mi rtog pa bsgom pa yod do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This teaches that from the stage of ordinary beings, one cultivates nonconceptuality through faith.

original: de lta ma yin na rim gyis bsgom nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skyes par byas nas yang mos pa'i sgo nas bsgom par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rim gyis bsgom nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skyes par byas nas yang mos pa'i sgo nas bsgom par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that one would cultivate nonconceptual wisdom through gradual meditation and then cultivate it through faith.🔽Well then, how do you interpret the statement in the Compendium of Bases:

original: 'o na gnas skabs kyi bye brag bcu gnyis su 'gyur //
analyzed: 'o na gnas skabs kyi bye brag bcu gnyis su 'gyur //
translated: There are twelve specific states:

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / drod dang / rtse mo'i gnas skabs su phyi gzung ba'i yul spong //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / drod dang / rtse mo'i gnas skabs su phyi gzung ba'i yul spong //
translated: The states of heat and peak eliminate external apprehended objects.

original: bzod pa dang / 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs su nang 'dzin pa'i sems spong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de ji ltar drang zhe na /
analyzed: bzod pa dang / 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs su nang 'dzin pa'i sems spong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de ji ltar drang zhe na /
translated: And in the context of the acceptance and the supreme mundane quality, it is said, the inner apprehending mind is abandoned. How do you interpret these statements?

original: bden mod kyi /
analyzed: bden mod kyi /
translated: It is true, but

original: 'on kyang thams cad kyi chos nyid mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba tsam la yang mi gnas par bsgom yang spang bar bya ba'i rtog pa rags rim gyis 'brel te /
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad kyi chos nyid mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba tsam la yang mi gnas par bsgom yang spang bar bya ba'i rtog pa rags rim gyis 'brel te /
translated: nevertheless, one meditates without abiding in the mere absence of all characteristics, the reality of all phenomena, and one is connected with the coarse stages of the conceptual thoughts to be abandoned.

original: de la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is with this in mind that the above statements are made.

original: 'o na chos nyid rim gyis bsgoms na ni rim gyis 'brel bar rigs kyi cig car du bsgoms pas chos can spangs rgyu rim gyis 'bral ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'o na chos nyid rim gyis bsgoms na ni rim gyis 'brel bar rigs kyi cig car du bsgoms pas chos can spangs rgyu rim gyis 'bral ba mi rigs te /
translated: If one meditates on reality gradually, then it is logical that one is connected with it gradually. But if one meditates on it instantaneously, it is illogical that one is connected with the abandonment of the possessor of the attributes gradually.

original: cig car du spong ba rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: cig car du spong ba rigs so zhe na /
translated: It is logical that one would abandon it instantaneously.

original: @256a * // 'o na sa dang por chos thams cad kyi chos nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i ye shes skyes pa'i bsgom pas sbang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa yang dus gcig tu spong ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: @256a * // 'o na sa dang por chos thams cad kyi chos nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i ye shes skyes pa'i bsgom pas sbang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa yang dus gcig tu spong ba'i rigs so //
translated: Well then, it is logical that the afflictions to be abandoned by the meditation of the wisdom that directly perceives the reality of all phenomena on the first ground would be simultaneously abandoned.

original: de ni gos kyi dri ma dang 'dra ste rags rim gyis spong ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni gos kyi dri ma dang 'dra ste rags rim gyis spong ba yin te /
translated: That is like the stains on a piece of cloth, which are removed in stages.

original: de bas na dus gcig tu spong mi nus so zhe na ;
analyzed: de bas na dus gcig tu spong mi nus so zhe na ;
translated: Therefore, they cannot be simultaneously abandoned.

original: de bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin no //
translated: That is so.

original: 'o na rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa'i gzungs las kyang /🔽rang bzhin la rnam par rtog pa dang / gnyen po la rnam par rtog pa dang / de kho na la rnam par rtog pa dang / 'thob pa la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma dang / bzhi rim gyis spong bar gsungs pa zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa'i gzungs las kyang / rang bzhin la rnam par rtog pa dang / gnyen po la rnam par rtog pa dang / de kho na la rnam par rtog pa dang / 'thob pa la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma dang / bzhi rim gyis spong bar gsungs pa zhe na /
translated: Well then, the Dhāraṇī of Entering Nonconceptuality says:🔽The signs of the conceptions of the nature, the conceptions of the antidote, the conceptions of thatness, and the conceptions of attainment are abandoned in stages.

original: de yang zhi gnas grub nas bsam pa'i shes rab kyi so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis nam yid ches kyi bar du brtags pa la /
analyzed: de yang zhi gnas grub nas bsam pa'i shes rab kyi so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis nam yid ches kyi bar du brtags pa la /
translated: That is said with reference to the conceptions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de'i don la mi rtog par bsgom mo zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i don la mi rtog par bsgom mo zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: One should meditate without conceptualizing its meaning.🔽In the same text, in the section on the seventh topic, the summary of the application that completely abandons signs, after achieving serenity, one should individually investigate the signs of conceptualization about reality.

original: de nyid las mtshan ma rnams yongs su spong ba yang dag par sbyor ba bsdus pa'i don bdun pa'i skabs su zhi gnas grub nas rang bzhin la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma la so sor brtags nas de nas de spong ba na brgya la rnal 'byor pa
analyzed: de nyid las mtshan ma rnams yongs su spong ba yang dag par sbyor ba bsdus pa'i don bdun pa'i skabs su zhi gnas grub nas rang bzhin la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma la so sor brtags nas de nas de spong ba na brgya la rnal 'byor pa
translated: Then, when one abandons that, if the yogin

original: dag 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang rtog pa byung na /
analyzed: dag 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang rtog pa byung na /
translated: thinks, “I am abandoning signs,”

original: de la so sor rtog par bya'o //
analyzed: de la so sor rtog par bya'o //
translated: one should individually investigate that.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin te /🔽gal te rang bzhin la rnam par rtog pa la yid ches pa'i skabs su bzhi ga la yid ches na yang de nas bsgom zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin te / gal te rang bzhin la rnam par rtog pa la yid ches pa'i skabs su bzhi ga la yid ches na yang de nas bsgom zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That is what is said.🔽If one has confidence in conceptualization about reality, then one should meditate.

original: gal te yid ma ches na 'thob pa la rnam par rtog pa yang so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te yid ma ches na 'thob pa la rnam par rtog pa yang so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis spang bar bya ste /
translated: If one lacks confidence, then one should abandon conceptualization about attainment with the wisdom of individual investigation.

original: des ni so so'i skye bos spang ba yin par de nyid las sa la sogs pa la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma la kun tu spyod pa 'di dag ni las dang po'i rnal 'byor pa kho na'i ste /🔽sa la zhugs pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des ni so so'i skye bos spang ba yin par de nyid las sa la sogs pa la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma la kun tu spyod pa 'di dag ni las dang po'i rnal 'byor pa kho na'i ste / sa la zhugs pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: The same text says, “These who engage in the signs of conceptualization of earth and so on are only beginners in yoga.

original: de la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la mi srid pa'i phyir ro // zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are not on the stages, because it is impossible for them.

original: de nas bsam pa'i shes rab kyis mtshan ma bzhi car ma grub par yid ches pa'i don bsgom pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de nas bsam pa'i shes rab kyis mtshan ma bzhi car ma grub par yid ches pa'i don bsgom pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Then, from the perspective of cultivating the meaning of confidence that the four signs are not established by the wisdom of reflection,

original: de nas rnal 'byor pa mos pa'i dbang dang / shes rab kyis yod pa la sogs par rtog pa'i mtshan ma'i dra ba thams cad spangs la /
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor pa mos pa'i dbang dang / shes rab kyis yod pa la sogs par rtog pa'i mtshan ma'i dra ba thams cad spangs la /
translated: the text says, “Then, the yogi/nī, by the power of interest and wisdom, should abandon all the nets of signs that conceive of existence and so on.

original: rtog pa med cing dpyod pa dang 'bral ba brjod pa med par ro gcig pa'i yid kyi de kho na nyid la mos nas mngon par 'du mi byed par shin tu @256b gsal bar bsgom zhing 'dug par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa des ni
analyzed: rtog pa med cing dpyod pa dang 'bral ba brjod pa med par ro gcig pa'i yid kyi de kho na nyid la mos nas mngon par 'du mi byed par shin tu @256b gsal bar bsgom zhing 'dug par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa des ni
translated: Having conviction in the suchness of the mind, which is of one taste in being free from thought and analysis and free from expression, one should meditate and remain in a state of non-application with vivid clarity.

original: 'di skad du so so'i skye bos ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas bsam pa'i shes rab kyis so sor brtags nas mtshan ma thams cad la rtog pa'i dra ba spangs la cir yang mi rtog pa mos pa'i sgo nas bsgom zhing 'dug par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin🔽te / spros pa phyogs re bcad nas bsgom zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'di skad du so so'i skye bos ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas bsam pa'i shes rab kyis so sor brtags nas mtshan ma thams cad la rtog pa'i dra ba spangs la cir yang mi rtog pa mos pa'i sgo nas bsgom zhing 'dug par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin te / spros pa phyogs re bcad nas bsgom zhes bya ba'am /
translated: This teaches that an ordinary being should remain in samādhi, and through the prajñā of reflection, should analyze and abandon the net of concepts about all signs. Then, through conviction, one should meditate and remain in a state of non-conceptuality.

original: las dang po ba cir yang mi rtog pa bsgom pa ni ma bstan to //
analyzed: las dang po ba cir yang mi rtog pa bsgom pa ni ma bstan to //
translated: This is not teaching that beginners should meditate without any concepts at all.

original: bsgom pa'i rim pa bar du mdzad pa las kyang /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rim pa bar du mdzad pa las kyang /
translated: Also, in the Stages of Meditation it says:

original: de nas zhi gnas grub nas lhag mthong bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas zhi gnas grub nas lhag mthong bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Then, once śamatha has been accomplished, you should cultivate vipaśyanā.

original: 'di snyam du bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di snyam du bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: One should think like this.🔽 From here up to the passage that says,🔽One is called a meditator with supreme wisdom,🔽the wisdom of contemplation is taught.

original: shes rab mchog gi bsam gtan pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du bsam pa'i shes rab bstan nas bsgom pa'i shes rab kyi gnas skabs su de ltar gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa /
analyzed: shes rab mchog gi bsam gtan pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du bsam pa'i shes rab bstan nas bsgom pa'i shes rab kyi gnas skabs su de ltar gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa /
translated: In the context of the wisdom of meditation, one should meditate on the selflessness of persons and phenomena,

original: de kho na la zhugs pa /
analyzed: de kho na la zhugs pa /
translated: engaging in suchness,🔽free from investigation and analysis, inexpressible, and single-pointed mental attention, without any other view to be examined.

original: de yongs su brtag par bya ba blta bar bya ba gzhan med pas rtog pa dang ; dpyod pa dang bral ba brjod du med pa dang gcig tu 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa mngon par 'du byed pa med pas de kho na nyid la shin tu gsal bar bsgom zhing 'dug par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa
analyzed: de yongs su brtag par bya ba blta bar bya ba gzhan med pas rtog pa dang ; dpyod pa dang bral ba brjod du med pa dang gcig tu 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa mngon par 'du byed pa med pas de kho na nyid la shin tu gsal bar bsgom zhing 'dug par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa
translated: Since it is effortless, one should meditate and remain in suchness with complete clarity.

original: gsungs te / der yang spros pa phyogs gcig bcad pa la bsgom pa yang gsungs la /
analyzed: gsungs te / der yang spros pa phyogs gcig bcad pa la bsgom pa yang gsungs la /
translated: Here, it is also taught that meditation is the elimination of one aspect of conceptual elaboration.

original: las dang po pa la mi rtog par bsgom pa yang grub pa yin te /
analyzed: las dang po pa la mi rtog par bsgom pa yang grub pa yin te /
translated: For beginners, meditation without concepts is also established.

original: sa dang po pa me la tshe thun phyed la sogs pa las gnas mi nus pa ni mi srid do //
analyzed: sa dang po pa me la tshe thun phyed la sogs pa las gnas mi nus pa ni mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible for one on the first ground to be unable to remain in fire for half a watch and so on.

original: bsgom pa'i rim pa tha mar mdzad pa las kyang /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rim pa tha mar mdzad pa las kyang /
translated: Also, in the final part of the Stages of Meditation it says:

original: ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas bsam pa'i shes rab kyi so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas bsam pa'i shes rab kyi so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Having remained in samādhi, with the wisdom of discernment, the wisdom of reflection,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ji srid du mdun du bzhugs pa bzhin du gsal bar mthong bar gyur pa de srid du bsam gtan bya'o //🔽de nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gzugs brnyan byon pa 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ji srid du mdun du bzhugs pa bzhin du gsal bar mthong bar gyur pa de srid du bsam gtan bya'o // de nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gzugs brnyan byon pa 'am /
translated: you should meditate until you see the form of the tathāgata as clear as if it were in front of you.

original: bzhud pa la rtog pas lhag mthong bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhud pa la rtog pas lhag mthong bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, by observing whether the image of the tathāgata comes or goes, you should cultivate vipaśyanā.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs nas /
translated: Having said this,

original: de nas de'i don la bsgom pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de nas de'i don la bsgom pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: in the section on the meaning of meditation,🔽it says:

original: yod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from the nature of existence and so on.
