original: zhes dpyad nas rnam par rtog pa med cing brjod pa med pa dang gcig tu gyur ba'i yid kyis de kho na bsgom zhing ji srid 'dod pa'i bar du 'dug par bya ba la @257a * //
analyzed: zhes dpyad nas rnam par rtog pa med cing brjod pa med pa dang gcig tu gyur ba'i yid kyis de kho na bsgom zhing ji srid 'dod pa'i bar du 'dug par bya ba la @257a * //
translated: Having analyzed in this way, one should meditate on thatness with a mind that is nonconceptual and non-utterant, and one should remain in this state for as long as one wishes.

original: sogs pa gsungs pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i zhi gnas grub nas de kho na rtogs par bya ba'i phyir de nas lhag mthong bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: sogs pa gsungs pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i zhi gnas grub nas de kho na rtogs par bya ba'i phyir de nas lhag mthong bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Having achieved śamatha, the yogin should then cultivate vipaśyanā in order to realize thatness.

original: yang dag pa la so sor rtog pa ni lhag mthong zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyis brtags nas /
analyzed: yang dag pa la so sor rtog pa ni lhag mthong zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyis brtags nas /
translated: Correct discernment is called vipaśyanā.

original: dngos po mtha' dag gi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir shes rab mchog gi bsam gtan pa yang yin no zhes gsungs nas /
analyzed: dngos po mtha' dag gi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir shes rab mchog gi bsam gtan pa yang yin no zhes gsungs nas /
translated: Having investigated with prajñā, one is also a meditator on supreme prajñā because one does not observe the essence of any thing.

original: de bsgom pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de bsgom pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With that meditation in mind, it says:

original: de ltar gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa de kho na la zhugs pas blta bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa de kho na la zhugs pas blta bar bya ba'am /
translated: In that way, by engaging in the suchness of the absence of a self of persons and phenomena, one does not observe any phenomena that are to be viewed.

original: brtag par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir dpyod pa med cing brjod pa med pa dang / ngang gcig tu gyur pa'i yid rang gi ngang gis 'jug pas mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtag par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir dpyod pa med cing brjod pa med pa dang / ngang gcig tu gyur pa'i yid rang gi ngang gis 'jug pas mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the mind, which has become one-pointed, enters its natural state without any deliberate effort,

original: rnal 'byor pa de kho na shin tu gsal bar nges par gzung zhing 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de kho na shin tu gsal bar nges par gzung zhing 'dug par bya'o //
translated: the yogi should remain in that state, holding it very clearly.

original: der gnas nas kyang sems kyi rgyud mi g-yeng bar bya'o //
analyzed: der gnas nas kyang sems kyi rgyud mi g-yeng bar bya'o //
translated: And while remaining in that state, he should not let his mind be distracted.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang zhi gnas la gnas nas /🔽bsam pa'i shes rab kyis lhag mthong so sor rtog pa des gang zag dang chos thams cad ma dmigs nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang zhi gnas la gnas nas / bsam pa'i shes rab kyis lhag mthong so sor rtog pa des gang zag dang chos thams cad ma dmigs nas /
translated: And so on.🔽Having remained in shamatha, he should use the wisdom of reflection to discern the view of vipashyana.

original: de'i don bsgom pa'i phyir yang mi rtog par nges par gzung du med pa'i tshul gyis gzung zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i don bsgom pa'i phyir yang mi rtog par nges par gzung du med pa'i tshul gyis gzung zhes bya ste /
translated: When he does not observe any person or phenomena, he should hold the meaning of that in his mind without any conceptualization, in a way that is beyond any ascertainment.

original: spros pa phyogs re la bsgom pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: spros pa phyogs re la bsgom pa yang ma yin la /
translated: He should not meditate on just one aspect of the elaborations.

original: las dang po pa rtog pa dang tshol ba las mi rtog pa'i bsgom pa med pa yang ma yin zhing //
analyzed: las dang po pa rtog pa dang tshol ba las mi rtog pa'i bsgom pa med pa yang ma yin zhing //
translated: But he should not be without the non-conceptual meditation of a beginner, which is a search for understanding.

original: de tsam gyis bden pa mthong ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis bden pa mthong ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But that alone is not seeing the truth.

original: shas che chung la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: shas che chung la sogs pa yang /
translated: The amount of the non-conceptual is great or small,

original: yang dang yang du bcos la /
analyzed: yang dang yang du bcos la /
translated: and one must repeatedly cultivate it.

original: de lta bu des kyang chu tshod gcig la sogs pa las gnas mi nus par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu des kyang chu tshod gcig la sogs pa las gnas mi nus par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is taught that one who is like that cannot remain in the non-conceptual state for more than an hour, etc.

original: las dang po pa spros pa thams cad bral ba yang mi rtog pa bsgom pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: las dang po pa spros pa thams cad bral ba yang mi rtog pa bsgom pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The beginner who is free from all conceptual elaborations is also not cultivating non-conceptuality.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya pa las /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Seven Hundred Lines says:🔽The Tathagata said to Manjushri, “Manjushri, you are not entering into the equipoise of the inconceivable samadhi?”

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'jam dpal khyod bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par mi 'jug gam zhes gsungs pa dang / 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'jam dpal khyod bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par mi 'jug gam zhes gsungs pa dang / 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Manjushri replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par mi 'jug lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par mi 'jug lags so //
translated: “Bhagavat, I am not entering into the equipoise of the inconceivable samadhi.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag sngon las dang po pa'i tshe na ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: bdag sngon las dang po pa'i tshe na ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: When I was previously a beginner, I entered into the equipoise of the inconceivable samadhi.

original: da ltar ni bdag nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa lags @257b pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par mi 'jug lags so //
analyzed: da ltar ni bdag nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa lags @257b pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par mi 'jug lags so //
translated: Now, since I am inconceivable, I do not enter the concentration of the inconceivable.

original: zhes dpe dang bcas nas gsungs so //🔽bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni de nyid kyi 'grel pa las //
analyzed: zhes dpe dang bcas nas gsungs so // bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni de nyid kyi 'grel pa las //
translated: Thus he speaks with an example.🔽The inconceivable is explained in the commentary to that:

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The inconceivable is

original: bsam pa las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa las 'das pa'o //
translated: beyond thought.

original: bsam pa las 'das pa ni bsam du med pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa las 'das pa ni bsam du med pa'o //
translated: Beyond thought is unthinkable.

original: zhes spros pa dang bral ba las gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes spros pa dang bral ba las gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said in the freedom from conceptual elaboration.

original: rnam par mi rtog par 'jug pa'i gzungs las kyang /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog par 'jug pa'i gzungs las kyang /
translated: The Dhāraṇī of Entering Nonconceptuality also says:

original: mtshan ma spong ba'i thabs kyi skabs su rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis /
analyzed: mtshan ma spong ba'i thabs kyi skabs su rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis /
translated: In the section on the method of abandoning signs,

original: gang rnam par ma brtags pa de rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings so ;
analyzed: gang rnam par ma brtags pa de rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings so ;
translated: whatever is not analyzed by any conception is the realm of nonconceptuality.

original: / zhes dpyod na yang rnam par rtog pa la dpyod pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: / zhes dpyod na yang rnam par rtog pa la dpyod pa'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you analyze, you analyze conceptions.

original: ston mun zhes bya ba ni cig car 'jug ces bya ste /
analyzed: ston mun zhes bya ba ni cig car 'jug ces bya ste /
translated: Darkness and light are said to be mutually exclusive.

original: gang cig car 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang cig car 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for simultaneous entry,

original: chos nyid spros pa thams cad dang bral ba la so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis legs par rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba spangs nas cir yang mi rtog par bsgom pa tsam byed pa yin par slob dpon ka ma la sh'i las bstan to //
analyzed: chos nyid spros pa thams cad dang bral ba la so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis legs par rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba spangs nas cir yang mi rtog par bsgom pa tsam byed pa yin par slob dpon ka ma la sh'i las bstan to //
translated: it is taught by Master Kamalaśīla that first you thoroughly investigate reality, which is free from all elaborations, with discerning wisdom, and then, abandoning that, you meditate without any thoughts at all.

original: thabs mi ston pa ni gzhan du bstan zin to //
analyzed: thabs mi ston pa ni gzhan du bstan zin to //
translated: As for not teaching a method, that has already been taught elsewhere.

original: de bas na de lta bu la zer ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na de lta bu la zer ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, that is what is being referred to here.

original: so sor rtog pa sngon du song nas cir yang mi rtog pa ni rim gyis 'jug pa yin par slob dpon nyid kyis gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa sngon du song nas cir yang mi rtog pa ni rim gyis 'jug pa yin par slob dpon nyid kyis gsungs pa yin te /
translated: However, after discerning wisdom precedes it, not thinking about anything at all is gradual entry, as taught by the master himself.

original: gong du smos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gong du smos pa bzhin no //
translated: It is as stated above.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi shes pa ni glo bur du dmigs pa med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi shes pa ni glo bur du dmigs pa med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The consciousness of ordinary beings does not suddenly become nonconceptual.

original: zhes gsungs pa de yang rgyu med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa de yang rgyu med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And that is not causeless.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: That is what is being taught.

original: yun ring po ma lon pas mi rtog pa'i ye shes mi skye zhes gsungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yun ring po ma lon pas mi rtog pa'i ye shes mi skye zhes gsungs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not said that non-conceptual intuition does not arise because the meditation is not long-lasting.

original: de ni gzhan dag kyang khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gzhan dag kyang khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For others also do not accept that.

original: de lta bas na de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, this is what is said:

original: gang dang gang legs par rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba med pa de dag ni dmigs pa med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dang gang legs par rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba med pa de dag ni dmigs pa med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Those who do not have prior analysis do not have non-apprehension of the objective.

original: dper na smig rgyu la chur snang ba gang zhig legs par rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba med pas chur dmigs pa med par mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na smig rgyu la chur snang ba gang zhig legs par rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba med pas chur dmigs pa med par mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, those who do not have prior analysis of a mirage as water do not have non-apprehension of water.

original: rnal 'byor pa 'di yang rnam par ma yengs pa'i yid kyis gang zag dang chos la dmigs pa 'jig par byed pa'i @258a * //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa 'di yang rnam par ma yengs pa'i yid kyis gang zag dang chos la dmigs pa 'jig par byed pa'i @258a * //
translated: This yogi, with a mind not distracted, does not have prior analysis of the objective, the person and things,

original: rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba med pas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba med pas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: and so does not have non-apprehension of the pervader.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las /
analyzed: 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las /
translated: In the noble Samādhirāja it is said,

original: ting nge 'dzin de sgom par byed mod kyi //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de sgom par byed mod kyi //
translated: “Although he cultivates that samadhi,

original: de ni bdag tu 'du shes 'jig mi byed //
analyzed: de ni bdag tu 'du shes 'jig mi byed //
translated: He does not destroy the notion of self.

original: de yis nyon mongs phyi nas rab tu ldang // zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de yis nyon mongs phyi nas rab tu ldang // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The afflictions arise again for him.

original: gang dang gang ma yengs par legs par rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba de ni dmigs pa med par 'gyur te /🔽dper na smig rgyu la chur mthong ba gang zhig ma yengs par gyen la 'gro bar snang ba 'di //
analyzed: gang dang gang ma yengs par legs par rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba de ni dmigs pa med par 'gyur te / dper na smig rgyu la chur mthong ba gang zhig ma yengs par gyen la 'gro bar snang ba 'di //
translated: Whatever is preceded by proper investigation without distraction becomes free from the objective support.🔽For example, when one sees a mirage as water, if one investigates without distraction, “Does this go to the end, or to the middle?”

original: mtha' 'gro'am / dbus 'gro'am zhes bya ba la sogs par ma yengs par rtog pa sngon du 'gro bas chur dmigs pa'i shes pa skye ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtha' 'gro'am / dbus 'gro'am zhes bya ba la sogs par ma yengs par rtog pa sngon du 'gro bas chur dmigs pa'i shes pa skye ba lta bu'o //
translated: and so on, then the perception of water arises, preceded by investigation.

original: las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pa 'di yang zhi gnas la gnas nas 'di yang dag par gcig yin nam //🔽du ma yin /
analyzed: las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pa 'di yang zhi gnas la gnas nas 'di yang dag par gcig yin nam // du ma yin /
translated: This beginner yogi, also, having abided in śamatha, “Is this one or many?”

original: zhes legs par rtog pa sngon du 'gro bas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: zhes legs par rtog pa sngon du 'gro bas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: and so on, by the prior investigation, it is a natural reason.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las /
translated: In the Sublime Cloud of Jewels,

original: lhag mthong gis brtags nas ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pa ni mtshan ma med pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gis brtags nas ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pa ni mtshan ma med pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The insight that investigates and realizes the absence of intrinsic reality is the entry into signlessness.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: In the noble Descent into Laṅkā,🔽it says:

original: blo gros chen po gang gi phyir /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gang gi phyir /
translated: “Mahāmati, it is because

original: blos rnam par brtags nas rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi rtog ste /
analyzed: blos rnam par brtags nas rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi rtog ste /
translated: the mind, having investigated, does not conceive of the characteristics of universals and particulars.

original: des na chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are said to be without intrinsic reality.”

original: yang de nyid las /
analyzed: yang de nyid las /
translated: Again, the same text says:

original: blo gros chen po glang gi rva yang rdul phra mor bshig na mi 'dug go //
analyzed: blo gros chen po glang gi rva yang rdul phra mor bshig na mi 'dug go //
translated: “Mahāmati, if you destroy the ox’s horn into atoms, it does not exist.

original: rdul phra mo rnams kyang so sor bshig nas rdul phra mo'i mtshan nyid du mi gnas so //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rdul phra mo rnams kyang so sor bshig nas rdul phra mo'i mtshan nyid du mi gnas so // zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you destroy the atoms individually, the characteristic of the atom does not exist.”

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal rnam par rol pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal rnam par rol pa las kyang /
translated: In the noble Playful Sport of Mañjuśrī,

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa //
translated: Mañjuśrī said:

original: bu mo ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' g-yul las rnam par rgyal ba yin /
analyzed: bu mo ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' g-yul las rnam par rgyal ba yin /
translated: “Girl, how is it that a bodhisattva is victorious in battle?”

original: bu mos smras pa /
analyzed: bu mos smras pa /
translated: The girl said:🔽“Mañjuśrī, a bodhisattva is victorious in battle when he does not see even the slightest phenomenon that is not included in the realm of totality.”

original: 'jam dpal gang chos thams cad la rnam par 'byed kyang dmigs pa lags so //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gang chos thams cad la rnam par 'byed kyang dmigs pa lags so // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is the discernment of all phenomena, but it is not an object of observation.

original: 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las /
analyzed: 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las /
translated: The noble King of Samādhis says:

original: gal te chos la bdag med so sor @258b rtog ;
analyzed: gal te chos la bdag med so sor @258b rtog ;
translated: If you discern the absence of self in phenomena,

original: / so sor de dag gal te sgom byed na //
analyzed: / so sor de dag gal te sgom byed na //
translated: and if you meditate on that individually,

original: de nyid mya ngan 'das thob 'bras bu'i rgyu //
analyzed: de nyid mya ngan 'das thob 'bras bu'i rgyu //
translated: that is the cause for attaining the result of nirvāṇa.

original: rgyu gzhan gang yin des ni zhing mi 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan gang yin des ni zhing mi 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Other causes will not make you a buddha.

original: sgom pa'i rim pa tha mar mdzad pa las /
analyzed: sgom pa'i rim pa tha mar mdzad pa las /
translated: The final stage of the process of meditation says:

original: de nyid kyi skabs su sor rtog pa sngon du song nas yid la bya bar nus pa dang / dmigs pa med par nus pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi skabs su sor rtog pa sngon du song nas yid la bya bar nus pa dang / dmigs pa med par nus pa gsungs te /
translated: In that context, having first discerned, you are able to bring to mind and you are able to be without an object of observation.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It says:

original: de lta bas na dam pa'i chos las dran pa med pa dang // yid la byed pa med par 'byung ba de yang /
analyzed: de lta bas na dam pa'i chos las dran pa med pa dang // yid la byed pa med par 'byung ba de yang /
translated: Therefore, the arising of non-mindfulness and non-attention in the excellent teaching

original: yang dag par so sor rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag par so sor rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: should be seen as preceded by correct discernment.

original: gang gi phyir yang dag par so sor rtog pa nyid kyi dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med par nus srid kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang dag par so sor rtog pa nyid kyi dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med par nus srid kyi /
translated: Because it is possible to be without forgetfulness and without mental activity through correct discrimination itself.

original: gzhan du ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin te /
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: 'di ltar rnal 'byor bas gang gi tshe yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis brtags na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnal 'byor bas gang gi tshe yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis brtags na /
translated: Thus, when a practitioner examines with correct wisdom,

original: don dam par na dus gsum du chos skyes pa gang yang ma mthong ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: don dam par na dus gsum du chos skyes pa gang yang ma mthong ba de'i tshe /
translated: ultimately he does not see any dharma arisen in the three times.🔽At that time, how can there be forgetfulness and mental activity?

original: ji ltar dran pa dang yid la byed par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar dran pa dang yid la byed par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: bsgom pa'i rim pa dang por mdzad pa las kyang /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rim pa dang por mdzad pa las kyang /
translated: Also, in the first stage of meditation,🔽it is said:

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi lag gis bzung ste shin tu cha phra ba'i shes rab kyi mtshon gyis gzugs la sogs pa la log par rnam par rtog pa'i sa bon gyi zug rdu sems de la yod pa bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi lag gis bzung ste shin tu cha phra ba'i shes rab kyi mtshon gyis gzugs la sogs pa la log par rnam par rtog pa'i sa bon gyi zug rdu sems de la yod pa bsal bar bya'o //
translated: Having taken hold with the hand of samadhi, with the weapon of very subtle wisdom, the yogin should remove the dart of the seed of false imagination about form and so on that exists in the mind.

original: de ltar byas na rtsa ba nas phyung ba'i shing dag sa la mi skye ba bzhin du rtsa ba med pas na log par rnam par rtog pa'i sems de yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar byas na rtsa ba nas phyung ba'i shing dag sa la mi skye ba bzhin du rtsa ba med pas na log par rnam par rtog pa'i sems de yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, just as a tree uprooted from the earth does not grow again, so too, the mind that is a false imagination will not arise, because it has no root.

original: bsam gtan bzhi ma thob pa'i zhes gsungs pa de yang pha rol po la mnyam par gzhag pa'i dus su /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi ma thob pa'i zhes gsungs pa de yang pha rol po la mnyam par gzhag pa'i dus su /
translated: The statement “without attaining the four meditative concentrations” means that, for the opponent, at the time of meditative equipoise,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod na ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod na ni de'i tshe /
translated: if there is a mental consciousness,

original: gdon mi za bar ci zhig la dmigs dgos te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar ci zhig la dmigs dgos te /
translated: then it must definitely have an object of observation.

original: so so'i skye bo'i shes pa rgyu med par dmigs pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i shes pa rgyu med par dmigs pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The consciousness of ordinary beings cannot be without an object of observation.

original: ci ste yid kyi rnam par shes pa med na ni ;
analyzed: ci ste yid kyi rnam par shes pa med na ni ;
translated: But if there is no mental consciousness,

original: de'i tshe ji ltar chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med par rtog par 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med par rtog par 'gyur //
translated: then how could one conceive of the essencelessness of phenomena?

original: gnyen po gang gis ni nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyen po gang gis ni nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur //
translated: By what antidote would the afflictions be eliminated?

original: de lta bas na rnal 'byor par ji ltar 'gyur zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnal 'byor par ji ltar 'gyur zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Thus, how could one be a yogi?

original: de'i lan du pha rol po brgya la 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la yid kyi rnam @259a * //
analyzed: de'i lan du pha rol po brgya la 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la yid kyi rnam @259a * //
translated: In response to that, some opponents might say that although mental consciousness does not exist in the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, it is called a yogic meditative attainment.

original: shes med kyang rnal 'byor pa zhes zer ba dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la yid kyi rnam shes yod bzhin du yul la dmigs par mi 'gyur bas skyon de ma nges so zhes zer du dogs nas /
analyzed: shes med kyang rnal 'byor pa zhes zer ba dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la yid kyi rnam shes yod bzhin du yul la dmigs par mi 'gyur bas skyon de ma nges so zhes zer du dogs nas /
translated: And they might say that the fault is not definite because mental consciousness exists in the meditative attainment of cessation but does not focus on an object.

original: lan du so so'i skye bo yin yang bsam gtan bzhi pa ma thob par yid kyi rnam shes dgag par mi nus la /
analyzed: lan du so so'i skye bo yin yang bsam gtan bzhi pa ma thob par yid kyi rnam shes dgag par mi nus la /
translated: In response to that, the text says that even ordinary beings who have not attained the fourth absorption are unable to stop mental consciousness.

original: so sor rtog pa'i shes rab sngon du ma song bar yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod bzhin du dmigs pa med par 'gyur ba ni 'phags pas nus kyi /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i shes rab sngon du ma song bar yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod bzhin du dmigs pa med par 'gyur ba ni 'phags pas nus kyi /
translated: And it is the āryas who are able to make mental consciousness exist while it does not focus on an object without the prior use of discerning wisdom.

original: so so'i skye bo ni mi nus pas de skad smras pas ci la phan zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni mi nus pas de skad smras pas ci la phan zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Ordinary beings are not able to do that, so what is the use of saying that?

original: so so'i skye bo la ting nge 'dzin sngon du song nas legs par brtags kyang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo la ting nge 'dzin sngon du song nas legs par brtags kyang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Even though ordinary people examine well with prior concentration, the object does not appear.

original: de bas na zug po'i blos mi dpyod par res 'ga' ni da ltar dmigs pa med par 'gyur mi srid de zhes khungs 'dren par byed //
analyzed: de bas na zug po'i blos mi dpyod par res 'ga' ni da ltar dmigs pa med par 'gyur mi srid de zhes khungs 'dren par byed //
translated: Therefore, without the mind of analysis, sometimes it is impossible for the object not to appear.

original: res 'ga' ni cir yang mi rtog par ma sgoms shig /'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni cir yang mi rtog par ma sgoms shig /'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa ni /
translated: Sometimes, do not meditate without any thought whatsoever, lest you enter the attainment of non-perception.

original: mkhas pa'i sems 'phrogs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i sems 'phrogs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not the way to captivate the mind of the wise.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: de la rtags la log par rtog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rtags la log par rtog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of misconceptions about the sign:

original: mnyam par gzhag pa dang / lags pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa dang / lags pa'o //
translated: those of equipoise and post-equipoise.

original: de na kha cig na re mnyam par gzhag tsam na lus phyogs re la sogs pa ha cang za ba dang / g-ya' ba dang / 'dzag pa dang / rtsub pa dang / 'dar zhing g-yo 'phar ba dang / dro ba dang / gting du'am /
analyzed: de na kha cig na re mnyam par gzhag tsam na lus phyogs re la sogs pa ha cang za ba dang / g-ya' ba dang / 'dzag pa dang / rtsub pa dang / 'dar zhing g-yo 'phar ba dang / dro ba dang / gting du'am /
translated: Some say that in mere meditative equipoise, the body is excessively numb, or itches, or oozes, or is rough, or trembles and shakes, or is hot, or is lifted up,

original: gyen du bteg pa la sogs pa dang / sems kyis dga' ba tsam lhag mthong gi rtags su byed pa de ni log par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: gyen du bteg pa la sogs pa dang / sems kyis dga' ba tsam lhag mthong gi rtags su byed pa de ni log par rtog pa yin te /
translated: or is sunken down, or is lifted up, and so on, and that mere mental pleasure is a sign of vipaśyanā. That is a misconception,

original: zhi gnas tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is merely a consequence of śamatha.

original: mi ma yin pa'i sgra thos pa dang / gzugs mthong ba dang / 'od la sogs pa dang / zas stobs pa la ngo mtshar du 'dzin pa dang / kha cig ni dri ma rags pa gsum dang ma bral bar ni sprul pa'i sku'i zhal mi mthong na lo dang zla ba tsam lon ma thag tu 'phags pas lung ston pa dang /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i sgra thos pa dang / gzugs mthong ba dang / 'od la sogs pa dang / zas stobs pa la ngo mtshar du 'dzin pa dang / kha cig ni dri ma rags pa gsum dang ma bral bar ni sprul pa'i sku'i zhal mi mthong na lo dang zla ba tsam lon ma thag tu 'phags pas lung ston pa dang /
translated: Some are amazed when they hear the sounds of nonhuman beings, see forms, see lights, and so on, and when they are given food. Some say that if one has not become free of the three coarse stains, one will not see the face of the nirmāṇakāya, but that as soon as one year or month has passed, one will receive a prophecy from a noble one.

original: byin gyis brlabs su re ba dag ni bdud kyis byin gyis rlob pa'i phyir log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs su re ba dag ni bdud kyis byin gyis rlob pa'i phyir log par rtog pa'o //
translated: Those who hope for consecration are consecrated by Mara.

original: langs pa'i gnas skabs su kha cig rdul phra rab tu mthong zhes zer @259b ba'am ci yang ma mthong zhes zer ba yang log par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: langs pa'i gnas skabs su kha cig rdul phra rab tu mthong zhes zer @259b ba'am ci yang ma mthong zhes zer ba yang log par rtog pa yin te /
translated: Some say that in the state of rising from meditative concentration, one sees atoms, and some say that one does not see anything at all.

original: 'dus pa dang gnyis kyis tha snyad 'dogs pa dang / langs pa'i shes pa la rnam pa med par skye mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus pa dang gnyis kyis tha snyad 'dogs pa dang / langs pa'i shes pa la rnam pa med par skye mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is a misconception, because the conventional designation of the two, the assembled and the atom, and the aspectless arising of consciousness in the state of rising are impossible.

original: de bas na 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: Therefore, in the noble Lankavatara-sutra,

original: byis pa nye bar spyod pa'i bsam gtan dang / don rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i bsam gtan gyi dbang du mdzad nas /🔽rnal 'byor can gyis brtson byas na //
analyzed: byis pa nye bar spyod pa'i bsam gtan dang / don rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i bsam gtan gyi dbang du mdzad nas / rnal 'byor can gyis brtson byas na //
translated: the meditative concentration of the childish who are engaged in experience and the meditative concentration of the bodhisattva who is engaged in the meaning are taught.

original: nyi ma zla ba'i gzugs 'dra dang // 'od dang padmo 'dra ba dang // ri mo nam mkha'i me 'dra mthong //🔽mtshan ma sna tshogs de dag ni //
analyzed: nyi ma zla ba'i gzugs 'dra dang // 'od dang padmo 'dra ba dang // ri mo nam mkha'i me 'dra mthong // mtshan ma sna tshogs de dag ni //
translated: The sutra says: The yogi who is diligent sees forms like the sun and moon, like light and a lotus, like a painting and the sky and fire.

original: mu stegs can lam khrid par byed //
analyzed: mu stegs can lam khrid par byed //
translated: Those various signs lead the tirthikas astray.

original: de dag thams cad rnam spong shing //
analyzed: de dag thams cad rnam spong shing //
translated: Having abandoned all of those,

original: snang ba med par nam gyur pa //
analyzed: snang ba med par nam gyur pa //
translated: when one becomes free of appearances,🔽at that time the Buddha, the god of gods,

original: de tshe sangs rgyas lha yi phyag / thams cad zhi nas byung ba yis //
analyzed: de tshe sangs rgyas lha yi phyag / thams cad zhi nas byung ba yis //
translated: with all his peacefulness,

original: de yi mgo la nyug mdzad de //
analyzed: de yi mgo la nyug mdzad de //
translated: will touch the crown of one’s head.

original: yang dag rjes su 'gro ba'i ltas //🔽zhes gsungs so //🔽de lta bas na bslab pa bsrung bar 'dod pas lkugs pa bzhin du bya zhing nam mkha' lta bu'i ye shes dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i ye shes skye bar 'dod pas mnyam par gzhag pa'i dus su ci la yang mi gnas par bslab cing langs pa'i skabs su yang dag pa'i ngo bos stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag rjes su 'gro ba'i ltas // zhes gsungs so // de lta bas na bslab pa bsrung bar 'dod pas lkugs pa bzhin du bya zhing nam mkha' lta bu'i ye shes dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i ye shes skye bar 'dod pas mnyam par gzhag pa'i dus su ci la yang mi gnas par bslab cing langs pa'i skabs su yang dag pa'i ngo bos stong pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the sign of following the truth.

original: rmi lam snang ba dang 'dra ba la bslab dgos pas /
analyzed: rmi lam snang ba dang 'dra ba la bslab dgos pas /
translated: Therefore, those who wish to protect the trainings should be like the mute. Those who wish to generate the space-like wisdom and the illusion-like wisdom should train in not abiding in anything during meditative equipoise. And because of being empty of true nature, during the post-meditation period one should train in the appearances being like a dream.

original: shin tu dben pa'i skabs su de la mos pa brten po 'byung na lam du zhugs pa'i rtags yin no //
analyzed: shin tu dben pa'i skabs su de la mos pa brten po 'byung na lam du zhugs pa'i rtags yin no //
translated: Therefore, when one becomes very isolated and a stable interest in that arises, this is a sign of having entered the path.

original: ma nor lam rtags gzhan dag ni //
analyzed: ma nor lam rtags gzhan dag ni //
translated: The other signs of the unmistaken path

original: sgrub pa snying por byed pa la //
analyzed: sgrub pa snying por byed pa la //
translated: are for those who make practice the essence.

original: de dag rim gyis bstan par bya //
analyzed: de dag rim gyis bstan par bya //
translated: These will be explained in order.

original: bar skabs kyi ni tshigs bcad yin //
analyzed: bar skabs kyi ni tshigs bcad yin //
translated: The intermediate one is a verse.

original: dmigs pa dang ni shes pa la//
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ni shes pa la//
translated: In regard to the objective support and knowledge,🔽the refutation of false imagination is briefly indicated,

original: log rtog sun dbyung mdor bstan dang // rtags la log rtogs sun dbyung gis //
analyzed: log rtog sun dbyung mdor bstan dang // rtags la log rtogs sun dbyung gis //
translated: and the refutation of false imagination in regard to the reason

original: bsgom la log rtog bsdus pa yin //
analyzed: bsgom la log rtog bsdus pa yin //
translated: is a summary of the false imagination in regard to meditation.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is the verse of summary.

original: de la rang gi phyogs sgrub tu med pa'i tshul gyis bsgrub pa ni zhen pa mi skyed ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de la rang gi phyogs sgrub tu med pa'i tshul gyis bsgrub pa ni zhen pa mi skyed ces bya ba yin te /
translated: In this regard, the establishment of one's own position by way of non-establishment is the non-production of attachment.

original: gang dag la ni phyogs med pa //
analyzed: gang dag la ni phyogs med pa //
translated: For those who have no position,

original: de la gzhan phyogs ga la yod //
analyzed: de la gzhan phyogs ga la yod //
translated: how can there be another's position?

original: ces 'byung ba'i rjes su slob pas so //
analyzed: ces 'byung ba'i rjes su slob pas so //
translated: This is because one is following the statement,

original: 'on kyang gang zhig bsgrub bya gang dang 'brel pa'i rtags dran zhing 'brel pa'i rjes la skyes pa'i shes pa de ni rtog bcas yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang zhig bsgrub bya gang dang 'brel pa'i rtags dran zhing 'brel pa'i rjes la skyes pa'i shes pa de ni rtog bcas yin te /
translated: But, that knowledge which is born after the memory of the relation of the reason to the probandum, is discursive,

original: dper na du ba la brten nas 'brel pa dran pa'i @260a * //
analyzed: dper na du ba la brten nas 'brel pa dran pa'i @260a * //
translated: for example, the knowledge of fire based on the memory of the relation of smoke to it.

original: rjes la skyes pa'i shes pa lkog tu gyur pa'i mer snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rjes la skyes pa'i shes pa lkog tu gyur pa'i mer snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: The subsequent cognition is like the appearance of fire that is hidden.

original: chos nyid spros pa thams cad dang bral ba dang 'brel ba'i rtags gcig dang du ma dang bral ba la brten nas 'brel pa dran pa'i rjes la skyes pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: chos nyid spros pa thams cad dang bral ba dang 'brel ba'i rtags gcig dang du ma dang bral ba la brten nas 'brel pa dran pa'i rjes la skyes pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The natural inference is based on the sign of the absence of one and many, which is related to reality, which is free from all conceptual elaborations. Since it arises subsequent to the recollection of the relation, it is a natural inference.

original: gang rtog pa dang bcas pa de ni spyi'i yul can yin te dper na me ma yin pa las log pa tsam la dmigs pa'i shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang rtog pa dang bcas pa de ni spyi'i yul can yin te dper na me ma yin pa las log pa tsam la dmigs pa'i shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Whatever is conceptual has a universal as its object, like the cognition that observes the mere exclusion of non-fire.

original: so so'i skye bo don lkog tu gyur pa la dpyod pa'i chos nyid la dmigs pa 'di yang rtog pa dang bcas pa yin pas yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i spyi'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo don lkog tu gyur pa la dpyod pa'i chos nyid la dmigs pa 'di yang rtog pa dang bcas pa yin pas yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i spyi'i yul can yin no //
translated: This observation of reality by ordinary beings analyzing hidden objects is also conceptual, so it has a universal as its object, free from all conceptual elaborations such as existence and nonexistence.

original: de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa'i bsam pas gang yang khas mi len pas gong du smos pa'i skyon thams cad sel to //
analyzed: de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa'i bsam pas gang yang khas mi len pas gong du smos pa'i skyon thams cad sel to //
translated: Since the thought of the cognition of equipoise does not accept anything, all the previously mentioned faults are eliminated.

original: langs pa'i shes pas tha snyad 'dogs pa ni ngo bo'i sgo nas rtog bcas zhes bya ba dang / yod pa dang med pa'i brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba tsam dang ha cang ches spyir yang dmigs su med ces bya ba la yang mi nges pas mi rtog pa zhes bya dang /🔽de tsam la yul gsal zhes bya ba dang / byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba dang / rang gi mtshan nyid du zhen pa yod pas na kun brtags bsgom zhes bya ba la sogs pa gong du smos pa phal cher brjod du 'dod de /🔽'dir mangs kyis dogs nas ma bris so //🔽mnyam gzhag langs pa'i shes pa yis //
analyzed: langs pa'i shes pas tha snyad 'dogs pa ni ngo bo'i sgo nas rtog bcas zhes bya ba dang / yod pa dang med pa'i brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba tsam dang ha cang ches spyir yang dmigs su med ces bya ba la yang mi nges pas mi rtog pa zhes bya dang / de tsam la yul gsal zhes bya ba dang / byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba dang / rang gi mtshan nyid du zhen pa yod pas na kun brtags bsgom zhes bya ba la sogs pa gong du smos pa phal cher brjod du 'dod de / 'dir mangs kyis dogs nas ma bris so // mnyam gzhag langs pa'i shes pa yis //
translated: The consciousness of one who has arisen from meditative equipoise, which is called conceptual in terms of its nature, and which is called nonconceptual because it is not ascertained as the mere suitability of being conjoined with expressions of existence and nonexistence, and which is called the object of clarity, and which is called the thought of enlightenment, and which is called the meditation of the imagined because it has the adherence to its own character, and so on, as mentioned above, is mostly said to be the desire to express.🔽🔽Here, fearing prolixity, I have not written more.🔽The consciousness of one who has arisen from meditative equipoise🔽

original: tshul gnyis mtshon cha gzung nas ni //🔽rigs pa'i lag gis 'debs byed pa //🔽log rtog spangs nas lhag mthong skye //🔽zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: tshul gnyis mtshon cha gzung nas ni //🔽rigs pa'i lag gis 'debs byed pa //🔽log rtog spangs nas lhag mthong skye //🔽zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The consciousness that arises, which is called conceptual in terms of its nature, and which is called nonconceptual because it is not ascertained as the mere suitability of being mixed
